story:
Hello,

My name is Caroline O'Leary. I am a freshman at Drew University, which is located in New Jersey. I have noticed a distinct lack of support for sexual violence survivors, and am hoping that hosting a walk here in Madison will help garner support for the cause. I am working alongside other Drew students to create this event, and we need all the support we can get!  

We need to raise about $500 dollars

In order to advertise, buy equipment, and order goodies for our walkers, we need funds. I have estimated that about $500 dollars will allow us to create the best walk possible. I am hoping that with some support, we will be able to make this a great experience for all involved! Every bit helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

· Get the word out!

· Come and walk yourself! It is free to register, and everything else is a strongly suggested donation. The walk will be on April 26th, 2014, and it will be hosted in Madison, NJ.

· Donate directly to RAINN!

story:
Short Summary

Annee came to be a part of our family in 2006.  She is an amazing Bernise Mountain dog who loves everyone!  If you've met Annee, you are blessed for having done so.

What We Need & What You Get

Yesterday, Annee underwent surgery for anal gland surgery that had spread to her lymphatic system.  The surgery lasted over five hours.  It was very extensive.  She is doing fairly well today - not out of the woods - but we are hopeful of her recovery. 

After she recovers, she will have several chemotherapy treatments three weeks apart.  This will likely extend her life - barring any complications - by several months, perhaps years.

As you can imagine, all of this is very expensive.  Andrea is a single "parent" who works very hard to provide a loving and warm home for her beloved Annee.  Andrea does not know I am asking on her behalf, but if you could spare a small contribution to Annee's Healing Fund, I know she would be so very grateful.

I hope you know that I would love to give you a "gift" for your "gift" but everything is going toward this special Healing Fund.  If Annee could, she would call you and thank you - so THANK YOU! 

The Impact

The impact of your contribution would be amazing.  Perhaps your contribution is simply forwarding this request on to others you know who are acquainted with Andrea and Annee.  I don't know all their "friends" but perhaps you know one or more who might want to help. 

Gifts, regardless of size, are gifts of the heart.  The heart is one of Andrea's prized symbols of love and commitment.  Please give from the heart....

Other Ways You Can Help

You can be praying for Annee, her medical team, her mama, her extended family and all the others who have come to love and trust this big bear of a dog. 

And that's all there is to it.

story: Michelle was involved in a near fatal car accident where she lost a part of her left leg and had the whole left side of her body crushed. She is in and out of surgery to help repair her left hair amongst other damaged caused from the accident. We need to raise money so that her mother can stay at the hospital with her, her home is hours away from the hospital Michelle was life flights to, the cost is 35$ a night. Her mom is currently on disability herself and recovering from breast cancer. Anything will help!

Her mom is currently on disability herself and recovering from breast cancer. Anything will help!

story:
Monitoring in chronic diseases

Chronic diseases, such as heart disease, stroke, cancer, chronic respiratory diseases and diabetes, are by far the leading cause of mortality in the world, representing 60% of all deaths. Out of the 35 million people who died from chronic disease half were under 70 and half were women.

This invisible epidemic is an under-appreciated cause of poverty and hinders the economic development of many countries. Contrary to common perception, 80% of chronic disease deaths occur in low and middle income countries.

An effective monitoring along with a healthy lifestyle will reduce the mortality of chronic diseases in the coming years. Our goal is to develop a technology platform aimed at monitoring and improving the living conditions of these people,

This platform consists of a website with all the necessary information as well as mobile applications that allow easier monitoring of diseases. Using mobile technology will enable patients to have an easier monitoring of their disease as well as provide their doctor updated information about their health.

During emergencies, the crucial medical data and history can then be easily accessed by the medical staff.

What we need and what you get

We are covering nine chronic diseases:

  • Diabetes
  • Hepatic Insufficiency
  • Cardiac Insufficiency
  • Renal Insufficiency
  • Asthma
  • Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
  • Dementia
  • Ischemic Heart Disease (IHD)
  • Stroke

Therefore we need to develop a website and a mobile application for each  pathology and a special one for patients with multiple pathologies.

The main features of each application are:

  • General information on disease and healthy lifestyle.
  • Periodical registration of health information.
  • Custom reminders.
  • Alerts, send alert messages to people you choose when health conditions get worse. 
  • Historical information sharing with medical staff. 
First Design (Prototype)

Project Timeline

To implement this project, we estimate our funding needs in $ 15,000

In case of not achieving the goal we only would address the diseases with the highest incidence while our funds last.

Be a Health Improver! Donate $1,000 and you will be the exclusive sponsor of one app (choose a disease).

Other ways to help us

  • Spread the campaign and generate echo.
  • Use Indiegogo tools to share.

story:
Help HIV patients who are resistant to current treatments.

 Despite the great progress made in HIV/AIDS treatment, there is still an urgent need for new drugs, particularly for people who have had to abandon existing treatments due to HIV drug resistance and side effects. Our new potential therapy, based on a natural resistance molecule we discovered, will be effective to inhibit HIV infection including those that have become resistant to current drugs. Our treatment could extend the lives of many thousands; however, more work is needed before it becomes a successful drug candidate and attracts investment for clinical trials. We need $300,000. Our goal is to raise $75,000 matching funds to secure government grants to achieve this target.

Is the HIV/AIDS crisis over?

Significant progress has been made in the fight against HIV/AIDS, advances in treatment prolong lives of most patients that have access to anti HIV drugs, however many challenges remain, the HIV/AIDS pandemic is far from over.

More than 35 million people live with HIV/AIDS,  there are over 2 million new infections every year and 1.8 million people die, more than half are women and children.

Why is there a need for new therapies for HIV/AIDS?

There is no effective vaccine (all trials failed) or cure on the horizon. Although more than thirty drugs control most HIV infections for a period of time, nearly all of them eventually stop working due to resistance.

Today, up to 20 % of new HIV infections show increasing resistance to existing drugs and up to 60 % develop resistance during long-term treatment. We expect drug resistance will increase even more in the future.

 “Without a steady stream of new medicines to attack the virus in different ways, drug resistance will develop, leaving more patients without a viable treatment, said Scott Hammer, a professor of medicine at Columbia University in New York”

http://friendsofaids2.blogspot.ca/2011/03/hiv-drug-development-stalls.html

Who are we?

We are a group of scientists who joined efforts to develop this new class of therapy for HIV/AIDS based on our discoveries;

Dr. Mario Huesca, with extensive experience in drug development, has a fulltime commitment to this project.

Dr. Clifford Lingwood, senior scientist at the Hospital for Sick Children in Toronto Canada, and Dr. Donald Branch, an Associate Professor at the University of Toronto, discovered a natural molecule that provides resistance to HIV infection.

A derivative of this molecule produced in Dr. Lingwood’s laboratory is highly effective blocking HIV infections including those that are resistant to current therapies, but is too fragile for a drug.

Described as a “potential new weapon in battle against HIV infection” this molecule is a basis to develop a new means to prevent and treat HIV/AIDS,

Link to press releases:

http://www.sickkids.ca/AboutSickKids/Newsroom/Past-News/2009/hiv-infection-battle.html

http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2009/01/090112110050.htm

http://phys.org/news150983869.html#nRlv

Link to scientific publications:

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23380967,21524384,20582467,19139081,18842961,16439866
Why do we need your support?

We formed a new company “ViroCarb” to develop this new class of HIV treatment drug. With support from government grants, from family and close friends, we were able to develop new molecules with strong anti-HIV activity that can potentially be used as drugs.

Although this project has attracted great interest and is considered by experts a highly promising technology, it is still too early stage to be considered by investors.

We need at least $300,000 to perform studies to identify the best compounds for developing an effective treatment for HIV infected patients. These studies will include tests in a HIV “humanized” mouse model, which will provide a strong indication of potential efficacy in HIV patients -“proof of principle”.

For more information on humanized mouse models for HIV infection please visit:

http://jaxmice.jax.org/news/2012/HIV-1_NSG_BLT.html

Please share our campaign on Facebook and Twitter; we want to raise enough money to conduct “proof of principle” studies that will allow us to obtain funding to conduct clinical trials in patients infected with drug resistant HIV who have exhausted other treatment options.

Please donate.

Please tell all your friends.

We will be adding more perks as our campaign progresses.

 The impact.

Our novel HIV entry inhibitor will have a major impact on HIV treatment since infection with either of the two major HIV types will be blocked. The two current entry inhibitors either only target one HIV type, or are difficult to administer and expensive. Entry inhibitors are used as a first line of attack against drug-resistant HIV. We expect drug resistance to HIV to increase even further in the future and therefore our inhibitor will have an increasingly important role to play in the control of the continuing HIV pandemic.

story:
Jeff. Ray.

Cancer really sucks and one of the most beautiful souls on earth is about kick Chemo in the teeth. 


If you know Jeff, you're already aware of how simply wonderful he is, and if you don't, trust us...he is the bee's knees and now he needs our help.


After being diagnosed with testicular cancer last month, Jeff has put on the bravest face and made it through surgery without a hiccup. After many rounds of testing, it has been determined that the cancer has spread. Right now, our warrior is gearing up for Chemo-summer 2014.

Regrettably, Jeff has to receive treatment over 1000km away from his home and family in St. Anthony, NL. 


Here is how your donations will help:

  • Help cover prescriptions/medical expenses that are not covered by MCP
  • Travel between St. John's and St. Anthony between treatments
  • Travel expenses for family between St. John's and St. Anthony
  • All of the bills that get neglected when you're on long-term leave from work.


Every single dollar helps.

Even a spare penny goes a long way,  as does getting the word out to others that may be able to donate more.


What you get in return

In addition to the personal satisfaction you feel when you help someone in need, we have added a few other "perks"


DONATE $100 and receive a limited edition print!


Option #1  - Snack Painting of your choice by Ashley Smallwood

www.snackpaintings.com


Option 2 - one 8x10" photograph from photojournalist (and Jeff's cousin!) Amy Jo Espetveidt


Helen Crocker and I will also be accepting cold hard CASH and Interac E-transfers to jennifer.butler@outlook.com

Thank you so much for donating, the response has been overwhelming!


Please share this page with your friends and family, and donate to show your support to Jeff.

story:
So sah der 7-jährige Vlad Zavatchi aus Moldawien (Republik Moldau) vor 1,5 Jahren aus. 

Am 23. Mai 2013 beim Überqueren eines Zebrastreifens mit seiner Mutter wurde er von einem Taxi angefahren. Ein schwerer Unfall. Der Fahrer konnte per Bestechung den Knast umgehen, aber der kleine Vlad ist seitdem in einem katastrophalem Zustand. 

English and Russian versions below

Vlad Zavatchi kann schwer alleine atmen und ist bewegungslos. Sein Leben verbringt er im Rollstuhl. Hinter sich hat der Junge mehrere Operationen am Gehirn. Die Hälfte von seinem kleinen Schädel wurde durch Plastikteile ersetzt. Die Ärzte diagnostizierten apallisches Syndrom.

Das Neurologische Rehabilitationszentrum in Friedehorst, Deutschland, wäre bereit, den kleinen Vlad für eine intensive 6-Wochen-Rehabilitation aufzunehmen. 

Die benötigte Summe von 23.940 EUR haben die Eltern nicht, dafür aber eine große Hoffnung, dass ihr Sohn bald wieder lächeln kann. 

Wie man in Moldawien so schön sagt, die Welt ist nicht ohne gute Menschen. Lasst uns dem kleinen Vlad helfen. Das wäre das beste Geschenk zu Weihnachten. Und wir alle glauben an ein Weihnachtswunder. Bitte spenden!

Insgesamt werden 30.000 EUR benötigt:

  • 23.940 EUR für eine 6-Wochen-Rehabilitation im Neurologischen Rehabilitationszentrum Friedehorst gGmbH http://www.friedehorst.de/nrz/
  • 200 EUR Übersetzungen und Beglaubigungen beim Notar
  • 70 EUR Gebühr für die Ausstellung eines Passes 
  • Ca. 1500 EUR Flugkosten (Hin und Zurück) für Vlad und seine Mama (Chisinau-Frankfurt-Bremen)
  • 100-200 EUR Transportkosten vom Flughafen zur Klinik
  • Ca. 3000 EUR für eine(n) Dolmetscher/in vor Ort
  • Der Rest ist die Indiegogo-Gebühr (so sind die Bedingungen)

Falls Sie keine Kreditkarte or paypal besitzen, dann können Sie auf mein deutsches Konto überweisen: 


Alisa Bauchina  
Deutsche Bank  
IBAN: DE94 1007 0024 0314 7873 00  
BIC: DEUTDEDBBER   

Verwendungszweck: Spende für Vlad aus Moldova Indiegogo

________

Oder via webmoney:

Alisa Bauchina

E423494129649


Russian version below

The above picture of a seven year old Vlad Zavatchi from Moldavia (Republic of Moldova) was taken around 1,5 years ago.

On 23 of May 2013, while traversing a cross-walk with his Mom, Vlad had been hit by a taxi. A severe traffic accident. The committer is not even in prison - he escaped prison by paying a bribe to local corrupted institutions. But Vlad is since that dramatic accident in a severe physical condition.

Vlad Zavatschi can hardly breathe on his own and he is completely motionless. His life passes in the wheelchair. He has undergone several surgical interventions. A half of his skull was replaced by plasty parts and doctors diagnosed apallic syndrome.

The Neurological Rehabilitation Centre in Friedehorst, Germany, were ready to take little Vlad for a 6-week-rehabilitation therapy.

23,940 Euro are needed, though for Vlad's parents it is an unaffordable price. But they have a big hope that their son could smile again.

As people say in the Republic of Moldova: "The world is not without good people." Let us help Vlad! This would be the best Christmas gift. And we all hope that Christmas wishes can become true and miracles are possible. Please support.

30,000 Euro are needed for:

  • 23.940 Euro for an intensive 6-week rehabilitation at the Neurological Rehabilitation Centre Friedehorst gGmbH http://www.friedehorst.de/nrz/
  • 200 Euro for translation and notarization of documents 
  • 70 Euro fee for Vlad's passport
  • Ca. 1500 Euro flight expenses for Vlad and his Mom (Chisinau-Frankfurt-Bremen)
  • 100-200 Euro transport transfer from Bremen Airport to the hospital
  • Ca. 3000 Euro for translator service in the hospital 
  • The rest of the money is the indiegogo-fee (so are the conditions)

If you don't have a credit card or paypal, you can send your donation to my German bank account:

Alisa Bauchina
Deutsche Bank
IBAN: DE94 1007 0024 0314 7873 00
BIC: DEUTDEDBBER
Reference: Donation for Vlad from Moldova Indiegogo
______________________________________
Or via webmoney:
Alisa Bauchina
E423494129649

-------------------------------------

Вверху фотография ещё здорового семилетнего Влада Завацки из Молдовы до аварии.

23 мая 2013 года Влад с мамой пересекали пешеходный переход, когда на высокой скорости Влада сбило такси. Очень страшная авария. Преступнику грозил приличный тюремный срок, но он откупился благодаря коррупции. Влад остался в тяжелейшем физическом состоянии.

Влад Завацки с трудом дышит сам и полностью неподвижен. Жизнь Влада проходит в инвалидном кресле. Мальчик перенёс множество хирургических операций. Часть черепно-мозговой коробки была заменена на пластиковую, а врачи диагностировали апаллический синдром.

"Неврологический реабилитационный центр Фридехорст" в  Германии готов взять Влада на 6-недельный курс интенсивной реабилитации. 

Эти 6 недель обойдутся в 23.940 евро, но у родителей Влада нет такой денежной суммы. Зато у них есть большая надежда на то, что скоро Влад снова сможет улыбаться.

Как говорят в Молдове: "Мир не без добрых людей." Давайте поможем Владу вместе! Это был бы самый лучший подарок в канун Рождества. Мы все ведь верим в чудеса. Пожалуйста, помогите!

30.000 евро необходимы для:

  • 23.940 евро на 6-недельный курс интенсивной реабилитации в "Неврологическом реабилитационном центре Фридехорст" в Германии http://www.friedehorst.de/nrz/
  • 200 евро для перевода документов и необходимых нотариальных услуг
  • 70 евро для оформления Владу загранпаспорта
  • Около 1500 евро на перелёт (туда и обратно) для Влада и его мамы (Кишинёв-Франкфурт-Бремен)
  • 100-200 евро на транспортные затраты и трансфер из Бременского аэропорта в клинику
  • Около 3.000 евро переводчику в клинике  
  • Оставшаяся сумма - это услуги сайта indiegogo (таковы условия)

Maggio 2014, 23, Moldavia Chisinau.  Attraversando la strada con la sua madre al semaforo verde Vlad era investito da una taxi. Incidente molto grave. Il tassista non è in prigione. Lui ha evitato il carcere grazie alla corruzione. Da quel girno,dopo essere stato in coma,bambino è in grave condizioni fisiche. Lui non puo ne respirare da solo, ne mangiare. La sua vita passa in carrozzina e la meta della scatola cronica è stata sostituita con quella di plastica. I dottori hanno diagnosticato il sindrome apallico.

Il centro di riabilitazione di Friedehorst, Germania sono pronti a prendere il piccolo Vlad per 6 settimane di terapia intensiva. Ci vogliono 30000 euro, è una somma enorme per la famiglia di Vlad, pero loro hanno una grande speranza che Vlad potra sorridere di nuovo.
story_txt:
So sah der 7-jährige Vlad Zavatchi aus Moldawien (Republik Moldau) vor 1,5 Jahren aus. 
Am 23. Mai 2013 beim Überqueren eines Zebrastreifens mit seiner Mutter wurde er von einem Taxi angefahren. Ein schwerer Unfall. Der Fahrer konnte per Bestechung den Knast umgehen, aber der kleine Vlad ist seitdem in einem katastrophalem Zustand. 


English and Russian versions below

Vlad Zavatchi kann schwer alleine atmen und ist bewegungslos. Sein Leben verbringt er im Rollstuhl. Hinter sich hat der Junge mehrere Operationen am Gehirn. Die Hälfte von seinem kleinen Schädel wurde durch Plastikteile ersetzt. Die Ärzte diagnostizierten apallisches Syndrom.




Das Neurologische Rehabilitationszentrum in Friedehorst, Deutschland, wäre bereit, den kleinen Vlad für eine intensive 6-Wochen-Rehabilitation aufzunehmen. 

Die benötigte Summe von 23.940 EUR haben die Eltern nicht, dafür aber eine große Hoffnung, dass ihr Sohn bald wieder lächeln kann. 

Wie man in Moldawien so schön sagt, die Welt ist nicht ohne gute Menschen. Lasst uns dem kleinen Vlad helfen. Das wäre das beste Geschenk zu Weihnachten. Und wir alle glauben an ein Weihnachtswunder. Bitte spenden!

Insgesamt werden 30.000 EUR benötigt:


23.940 EUR für eine 6-Wochen-Rehabilitation im Neurologischen Rehabilitationszentrum Friedehorst gGmbH http://www.friedehorst.de/nrz/

200 EUR Übersetzungen und Beglaubigungen beim Notar
70 EUR Gebühr für die Ausstellung eines Passes 
Ca. 1500 EUR Flugkosten (Hin und Zurück) für Vlad und seine Mama (Chisinau-Frankfurt-Bremen)
100-200 EUR Transportkosten vom Flughafen zur Klinik
Ca. 3000 EUR für eine(n) Dolmetscher/in vor Ort
Der Rest ist die Indiegogo-Gebühr (so sind die Bedingungen)






Falls Sie keine Kreditkarte or paypal besitzen, dann können Sie auf 
mein deutsches Konto überweisen: Alisa Bauchina  Deutsche Bank  IBAN: DE94 1007 0024 0314 7873 00  BIC: DEUTDEDBBER   Verwendungszweck: Spende für Vlad aus Moldova Indiegogo________

Oder via webmoney:Alisa BauchinaE423494129649


Russian version below
The above picture of a seven year old Vlad Zavatchi from Moldavia (Republic of Moldova) was taken around 1,5 years ago.




On 23 of May 2013, while traversing a cross-walk with his Mom, Vlad had been hit by a taxi. A severe traffic accident. The committer is not even in prison - he escaped prison by paying a bribe to local corrupted institutions. But Vlad is since that dramatic accident in a severe physical condition.



Vlad Zavatschi can hardly breathe on his own and he is completely motionless. His life passes in the wheelchair. He has undergone several surgical interventions. A half of his skull was replaced by plasty parts and doctors diagnosed apallic syndrome.

The Neurological Rehabilitation Centre in Friedehorst, Germany, were ready to take little Vlad for a 6-week-rehabilitation therapy.
23,940 Euro are needed, though for Vlad's parents it is an unaffordable price. But they have a big hope that their son could smile again.
As people say in the Republic of Moldova: "The world is not without good people." Let us help Vlad! This would be the best Christmas gift. And we all hope that Christmas wishes can become true and miracles are possible. Please support.



30,000 Euro are needed for:


23.940 Euro for an intensive 6-week rehabilitation at the Neurological Rehabilitation Centre Friedehorst gGmbH http://www.friedehorst.de/nrz/

200 Euro for translation and notarization of documents 
70 Euro fee for Vlad's passport
Ca. 1500 Euro flight expenses for Vlad and his Mom (Chisinau-Frankfurt-Bremen)
100-200 Euro transport transfer from Bremen Airport to the hospital
Ca. 3000 Euro for translator service in the hospital 
The rest of the money is the indiegogo-fee (so are the conditions)







If you don't have a credit card or paypal, you can send your donation to my German bank account:
Alisa BauchinaDeutsche BankIBAN: DE94 1007 0024 0314 7873 00BIC: DEUTDEDBBERReference: Donation for Vlad from Moldova Indiegogo______________________________________Or via webmoney:
Alisa BauchinaE423494129649



-------------------------------------


Вверху фотография ещё здорового семилетнего Влада Завацки из Молдовы до аварии.
23 мая 2013 года Влад с мамой пересекали пешеходный переход, когда на высокой скорости Влада сбило такси. Очень страшная авария. Преступнику грозил приличный тюремный срок, но он откупился благодаря коррупции. Влад остался в тяжелейшем физическом состоянии.


Влад Завацки с трудом дышит сам и полностью неподвижен. Жизнь Влада проходит в инвалидном кресле. Мальчик перенёс множество хирургических операций. Часть черепно-мозговой коробки была заменена на пластиковую, а врачи диагностировали апаллический синдром.


"Неврологический реабилитационный центр Фридехорст" в  Германии готов взять Влада на 6-недельный курс интенсивной реабилитации. 



Эти 6 недель обойдутся в 23.940 евро, но у родителей Влада нет такой денежной суммы. Зато у них есть большая надежда на то, что скоро Влад снова сможет улыбаться.
Как говорят в Молдове: "Мир не без добрых людей." Давайте поможем Владу вместе! Это был бы самый лучший подарок в канун Рождества. Мы все ведь верим в чудеса. Пожалуйста, помогите!
30.000 евро необходимы для:


23.940 евро на 6-недельный курс интенсивной реабилитации в "Неврологическом реабилитационном центре Фридехорст" в Германии http://www.friedehorst.de/nrz/
200 евро для перевода документов и необходимых нотариальных услуг
70 евро для оформления Владу загранпаспорта
Около 1500 евро на перелёт (туда и обратно) для Влада и его мамы (Кишинёв-Франкфурт-Бремен)
100-200 евро на транспортные затраты и трансфер из Бременского аэропорта в клинику
Около 3.000 евро переводчику в клинике  
Оставшаяся сумма - это услуги сайта indiegogo (таковы условия)

story:
On June 14th, I will be doing the Chesapeake Bay Bridge Swim- 4.4 miles across the Chesapeake Bay. Each year, 600 swimmers are given the opportunity to complete this challenge and its organizers encourage participants to use the swim to raise money for worthy causes.

For my race, I will be partnering with the non-profit HealthCorps. This organization trains educators who work with schools and communities to implement a health education curriculum based on nutrition, fitness and mental resilience. HealthCorps has two programs – Living Labs and HealthCorps University (HCU). In Living Labs, which is primarily in low-income, underserved communities, full-time Coordinators teach daily classroom lessons, organize and facilitate after school programming, provide staff and parent outreach, and hold school/community-wide events. With HCU, staff and students from schools and organizations across the nation are trained to deliver HealthCorps’ innovative curriculum in their particular setting. HealthCorps’ approach is unique because it focuses on whole person and total community wellness, and is tailored to fit the needs of any school or organization. This program is especially important these days as education funding cuts are ever increasing and affecting the quality of instruction students receive. I want to help this cause to ensure that kids and communities in DC and across the country can access the resources they need that would allow them to become healthy adults, and possibly athletes the way I was able to.

My goal is to raise at least $2500 for this race, the first $300 of which will help me afford to pay the race registration fee, and the rest of which will go to fund the training and year-long support of 2 HCU educators in a Washington D.C. public high school. Every donation, no matter how small, will make a difference.

To learn more about HealthCorps, please visit www.healthcorps.org

story:
The Association of Independent Midwives of Maryland (AIMM) is thrilled to announce our triumphant victory with the passage of
The Maryland Licensure of Direct-Entry Midwives Act! 
We couldn't have done it without your support of our last campaign.

Now here's where your lesson in civics comes in: Regulations for the bill must be written before any Certified Professional Midwives can get a license in Maryland. 

This campaign will get us the funds to push us past the finish line and get licenses into the hands of the Midwives who want to serve Maryland families.  Without licenses for our midwives, Maryland families are no better off than they were before our bill passed.  Your help will turn this law on paper into home birth access for Maryland families.


What We Need & What You Get

We need you to share this campaign with as many of your family, friends and networks as possible. 

AIMM plans to spend money this year:

  • pushing the regulations process to completion
  • laying the groundwork to incorporate access to homebirth for VBAC families into the law and
  • keeping Maryland families connected and informed through community events.

PERKS:

We are happy to offer bumper stickers, buttons and tote bags for you to express your love of midwives to the world.

For those of you who love to learn and teach about birth, we offer the film, "The Mama Sherpas" from the makers of "The Business of Being Born."

And, we are most excited to offer a premium perk for this campaign: Coffee With a Midwife.  The recipient of this perk will get an hour at a cafe with one of our wise midwives--share your birth story, ask her about the journey to midwifery, or just thank her for her service to families!  A perfect gift for the midwife-lover in your life.  


The Impact

Anyone who has had a home birth or midwifery care knows the impact it has on the whole family's life.  Parents remember their birth stories forever.  This is why we midwives want to offer families the best care that we can.  Mothers need to have the options of home and birth center as well as hospital birth.  Presently, those options are severely limited for Maryland families.  We are changing that.  Sharing this campaign will change that.

We are proud of all that we did with the funds from our last campaign and dedicated to expanding home and birth center midwifery options for Maryland families with the money we are gathering with this campaign


Risks & Challenges

Our opposition is happy to make this process as slow as possible because without regulations, CPMs can still not practice legally.  Our opposition is happy to see VBAC mothers excluded from this law.  We will not stop fighting for it.  Every dollar we collect helps us forward our mission and takes some of the financial burden off of the midwives of AIMM and our families.


Other Ways You Can Help

We are grateful for all contributions, large and small.  We are especially grateful to those of you who can help us reach groups across the country and the world, who believe in birth as a human right and want those choices in the hands of the families giving birth.

Thank you for your contribution and for sharing our campaign today!

Use these links to spread the word!

story:
I’m an adventurer but afraid of heights! I’m braving a Skydive challenge to help give terminally ill children the hope of a better, healthier future.

It will be terrifying- but this cause is definitely worth facing my fears for. After all, these children who suffer from life-limiting illnesses, have a greater fear of whether or not they’ll live to see another day.

Your kind donations and support through Give a Gift charity will assist the children suffering from heart conditions and other life-threatening illnesses such as cancer and long term progressive disorders such as Spinal Muscular Atrophy.

The charity works with Children's Heart Unit and Martin House (Children's hospice), both establishments are committed to supporting and providing for terminally ill children.

£10 from 50 kind hearts will allow me to reach my target, but any amount of support you can offer will be greatly appreciated.

Jazaakumullahu khair.

Thank you in advance!
Shabeena Koser.

story:
We Believe Cats Make People Happier

Everything we do, we believe in making the world a meower place because cats make people happier. The way we do this is by making a Spa beautifully designed for both humans and cats. We just happen to heal humans by fostering stray kittens in a Spa.

We are an entrepreneurial couple that experienced a difficult time in our lives. We did however, feel a remarkable improvement when we rescued a couple of street cats who became part of our family. We then collaborated with local animal shelters to foster stray kittens at home and realised two things: 

  • There are a lot of kittens needing a home.
  • People feel good spending time with kittens.

Can we make the world a better place for humans and cats at the same time?

The stress of fast paced urban living, away from what is natural, has a major impact on our wellbeing and stray kittens are keeping the shelters at their maximum capacity, leaving animals on the streets. Spaws is a disruptive idea that solves this problem by fostering stray kittens in a Spa, so that two species can help each other.

What We Need & What You Get

To make this happen we estimate that $150,000 will cover starting costs for a great location in Sydney's CBD including the refurbishment of the venue, veterinary expenses, food etc. We need your support to reach our goal and for that we have created exciting perks that will contribute to the funding of this campaign. However, Indiegogo will only give us the funds if we reach our target in full. If we don't, all money collected will be returned to every donor.

The Impact

The world's first kitten Spa will have a positive impact on the wellbeing of human visitors who will release oxytocin thanks to stray kittens that would otherwise be left on the streets.

Risks & Challenges

This project has never been done before and we will face some hurdles. Our background in Project Management, Hospitality, Marketing and Business will help, but our determination and passion to improve the lives of people and cats, will ensure we overcome all hurdles. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand it is not always possible to contribute financially, but your help to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign will be very helpful. Please share our campaign on social media and tag cat lovers on our Facebook page.

story:
My twin sister, Charlotte, had an accident, falling off a bale of hay when we were 16 years old, leaving her paraplegic. She has since graduated from Southampton University with a Law degree, and is well on her way to becoming a successful lawyer in Bristol, UK.

We created Next Steps , a non-profit charity, whose aim is to help young para- and tetraplegics, victims of spinal cord injuries, regain mobility through various forms of intensive physiotherapy.  We now have 12 young beneficiaries. 

At a crazy 2,660m altitude, I am going to be running the 12km Merrell hike in Guatavita, Colombia on April 19.  (http://www.merrellcolombia.com/trailtour/). The funds raised will go towards physiotherapy sessions for our beneficiaries, new wheelchairs and scientific research.

Any donation and support would be great and very much appreciated!!

Gracias!

For more information about Next Steps check our website out:  www.associationnextsteps.com (we are working on an English version!)

story:
Three years ago, when Allen signed up for his first Ironman Canada triathlon competition, we all thought he was a little bit crazy! Well, he did it.. twice.. cutting the time off his 2nd attempt of the Penticton, BC course by 3 WHOLE HOURS. Now, still ambitious and addicted to the sport, Allen has won a lottery spot in the CELTMAN and he will be THE ONLY CANADIAN competing in this year's event! Known as one of the world's most extreme triathlons, this race includes a 4K swim in the cold, jelly-fish infested waters of Loch Torridon, a 202K bike through the North Western Scottish Highlands, and a 42K run of 4000 metres elevation over the Beinn Eighe Mountain Range.

We have created this campaign to help Allen, not only get to Scotland for the race, but equip himself well enough to excel in the event. We ask for your help in supporting Allen in this adventure! He will bravely represent Canada among the 218 athletes from over 47 other countries. 

Now for the many of you that know and love Allen, you probably want to support him anyhow. But for those that might need some incentive, we've created a plethora of promising perks for you :) So, please consider donating and help Allen achieve this feat!

Furthermore, as an added incentive, 20% of ALL MONEY RAISED will be donated to the SCHIZOPHRENIA SOCIETY OF ALBERTA in memory of Allen's brother, Zoel, who passed away on March 4, 2010.
Zoel left behind a yellow bike that he'd recently purchased to get around town. Allen wanted to do something big in honour of his older brother and used that bike in his first Ironman Canada competition the following year. Today, Allen continues to ride that bike during his training in memory of Zoel. 

In addition to raising funds for the fight against Mental Illness, the rest of the money will go to helping Allen get to Scotland and properly prepare for this exciting challenge!

** Note, we set the goal low in order to lower the campaign fees we need to pay to Indiegogo. Hopefully we will meet & surpass the goal !!! **

COST BREAKDOWN:
A. $1200 Round trip flight, Vancouver to Scotland
B. $500 Rental Car for two weeks (necessary to get to the remote race location and to provide car support for the bike section of the race)
C. $900 Allen's share of 2 weeks accommodation in Northern Scotland
D. $500 Travel allowance for Allen's cousin, Stale, who is joining him from Norway to be his support during the extreme section of the run
E. $560 Race Entry Fee
F. $300 Bike box and extra luggage fees (to get bike to Scotland)
G. $250 Travel Insurance
H. $800 New gear needed (bike helmet, bike seat, hydration pack, swim booties)
TOTAL: approx $5000 CAN
story_txt: Three years ago, when Allen signed up for his first Ironman Canada triathlon competition, we all thought he was a little bit crazy! Well, he did it.. twice.. cutting the time off his 2nd attempt of the Penticton, BC course by 3 WHOLE HOURS. Now, still ambitious and addicted to the sport, Allen has won a lottery spot in the CELTMAN and he will be THE ONLY CANADIAN competing in this year's event! Known as one of the world's most extreme triathlons, this race includes a 4K swim in the cold, jelly-fish infested waters of Loch Torridon, a 202K bike through the North Western Scottish Highlands, and a 42K run of 4000 metres elevation over the Beinn Eighe Mountain Range. We have created this campaign to help Allen, not only get to Scotland for the race, but equip himself well enough to excel in the event. We ask for your help in supporting Allen in this adventure! He will bravely represent Canada among the 218 athletes from over 47 other countries. Now for the many of you that know and love Allen, you probably want to support him anyhow. But for those that might need some incentive, we've created a plethora of promising perks for you :) So, please consider donating and help Allen achieve this feat!Furthermore, as an added incentive, 20% of ALL MONEY RAISED will be donated to the SCHIZOPHRENIA SOCIETY OF ALBERTA in memory of Allen's brother, Zoel, who passed away on March 4, 2010. Zoel left behind a yellow bike that he'd recently purchased to get around town. Allen wanted to do something big in honour of his older brother and used that bike in his first Ironman Canada competition the following year. Today, Allen continues to ride that bike during his training in memory of Zoel. In addition to raising funds for the fight against Mental Illness, the rest of the money will go to helping Allen get to Scotland and properly prepare for this exciting challenge!** Note, we set the goal low in order to lower the campaign fees we need to pay to Indiegogo. Hopefully we will meet & surpass the goal !!! **COST BREAKDOWN:A. $1200 Round trip flight, Vancouver to ScotlandB. $500 Rental Car for two weeks (necessary to get to the remote race location and to provide car support for the bike section of the race)C. $900 Allen's share of 2 weeks accommodation in Northern ScotlandD. $500 Travel allowance for Allen's cousin, Stale, who is joining him from Norway to be his support during the extreme section of the runE. $560 Race Entry FeeF. $300 Bike box and extra luggage fees (to get bike to Scotland)G. $250 Travel InsuranceH. $800 New gear needed (bike helmet, bike seat, hydration pack, swim booties)TOTAL: approx $5000 CAN

story:
After giving much thought, we have decided to shut down our campaign. Although Indiegogo is an excellent way to seek funding support, we realized this platform was not a good fit for our product. We have decided to focus our efforts on other opportunities so that we may continue development.

For the current backers, thank you so much for your support and as you know, we will continue to honor your perks as stated.

To all, look out for iCareNote in early 2015!!!

Thank you!

story:
Particulate Pollution (Air Pollution): A complex mixture of extremely small particles and liquid droplets that get into the air. Once inhaled, these particles can affect the heart and lungs and cause serious health effects.

 

Active Carbon Filter: 5 layer filtering system that includes a replaceable activated carbon filter for capturing particulates found in air pollution. Activated carbon has an extremely large surface area and contains microporosity making it the perfect solution for capturing small particulates.

Independent 3rd Party Lab Results:

We worked with a lab to independently test our replaceable filter and here are the results copied/scanned directly from the report. We received stellar results as no particulates penetrated the filter!

 

Everyday Carry and Bug Out Bags

Infographic:

Here are just a handful of applications you can use the Inversion Gaiter 2.0...

We are completely committed to reducing and eliminating pollution, not only in our home town, but throughout the world. Throughout the entire creative process, our goal was to provide you with a solution to protect against the negative effects of pollution while supporting organizations that work every day to eliminate pollution all together. As part of our #STOPTHEINVERSION campaign, we will take a portion of our income from each mask sold and support local and national organizations such as Utah Physicians for a Health Environment, SLC Air Protectors and Protect our Winters. We also use any influence we have as citizens to address our goals with local and national policy makers.

In 2016 Jeff Morton, founder of outdoor apparel company jaMo threads, was inspired by his 4-year-old son, Cole, who struggled to breathe last February due to air pollution. Jeff gave Cole a regular medical mask when he had to go outside, but Cole refused to wear it.

Morton decided to try putting a carbon mask inside one his company's gaiters, which are neck warmers used for winter sports and the original Inversion Gaiter was born.

The first version of the Inversion Gaiter was made by hand and had a few issues. In-order to make the new and improved Inversion Gaiter with a removable filter and at an affordable price he found a high-quality manufacturing partner to help it become a reality.


However to reach the MOQ (Minimum Order Quantity) that the manufacturing partner requires we are here on Kickstarter to get a big enough 1st order to make the Inversion Gaiter 2.0 a reality!

What are the improvements of Inversion Gaiter 2.0?

Replaceable Active Carbon Filters

Two Exhalation Valves

Built by a Best-in-Class Apparel Manufacturer

Risks and challenges

Producing a functional air pollution mask definitely has its challenges. Probably the biggest challenge of all, is ensuring that the Inversion Gaiter properly filters out the particulates. During the entire process we have worked closely with one of the premier testing facilities in the United States, having conducted dozens of tests on our masks using the latest particle-filtration testing equipment. However, final testing will need to be conducted in the next few months and while we are confident in our designs and results from previous testing, there is always a chance the test results will be negative.

Even with negative results we know that we will be able to make quick tweaks to the product as we have a talented team of designers and production staff to work to solve any issue that may arise out of product testing.

We also face a potential risk of production capacity. As a newer organization we rely heavily on small batch manufacturing to produce or products, as demand begins to grow, their capacity may be exceeded running the risk of not delivering the product on time. To mitigate this risk we are currently interviewing larger manufacturers both in the United States and abroad to help us meet any excess demand over our current production capacity.

story:
Jim Morrison Sat Here (definitely)

The Isabelle Clark Memorial Bench in Alameda's Jackson Park has intrigued passersby for generations with its quizzical inscription: "In Memory of My Dumb Friends."  Who put it there? What did they mean by "dumb" friends?"

In 1957, Jim Morrison, frontman of the rock group The Doors, moved with his family to Alameda, California. When he shot to rock super stardom just a few years later, his old pals made sure nobody forgot that Jim Morrison was once one of our own.  

As time went on, the origin of the Clark Memorial Bench was forgotten, and people began to say that Jim Morrison donated it to the city in honor of his friends at Alameda High.  It is a myth that persists to this day, despite the fact that the bench was built in 1920, long before Morrison was born. An old friend of Morrison's, Timothy Malone, confirms that Jim did hang out at the bench, however. (The "dumb friends" is a reference to animals who, of course, don't speak. Isabelle Clark was an early supporter of animal rights.)

When the bench was damaged by a falling palm tree during a winter storm, this beloved landmark was threatened with demolition. I formed a group called Save the Bench and, with the help of the Alameda Architectural Preservation Society, residents, business people, and park officials, raised the money to repair it.  The restoration is already underway.

Concerns about the bench being a gathering spot for nocturnal mischief persist, however, and it was suggested that a lamp post be installed to discourage this activity and make the area safer for everyone.

Break On Through to a Safer Site

  • Local organizations including the Alameda Community Fund have pledged matching funds toward the installation of a lamp post if we are able to raise $1,600.
  • The site will not only be improved, but safer for visitors to the area at night.
  • Major donors of $500 and up will have their names inscribed on a plaque that will be installed on the bench and they will be invited to the re-dedication ceremony.
  • If we do not raise the required funds, any money raised will be used to improve the site in other ways such as landscaping.

Hang On to Your History

  • The Clark Bench has been an Alameda icon for over 95 years. Site improvements like this one can insure that it will continue to amuse, inspire and provide a resting place for Alamedans and visitors for years to come.
  • We have already raised over $12,000 to restore this bench. The lighting will help discourage vandals, and preserve the hard work the community has already put in to saving this beloved icon.
  • Thanks to our pledged matching funds, we are already halfway there. All it takes is a few dollars more. We can do this, with your help!

Unknown Soldiers Welcome

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help:

  • Tell your friends on Facebook and other social media about this campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Shasta Wrestling is committed to shaping our youth into men and women with  strong character, confidence, a sense of personal responsibility, and an unmatched work ethic. 

If you are a wrestling fan, parent, or you have endured the blood, sweat and tears that come with stepping onto the mat to compete, you know that once these traits are embraced,  they can not be unlearned.

The Shasta Wolves Wrestling Team is kicking off our 3rd annual  golf tournament fundraising campaign to help with our travel, accommodations, competitions, and training costs. In order to face the most elite competition, this season we plan to travel to tournaments in Elk Grove, Sacramento, Reno, Escalon, Modesto, Chico, Gilroy, and Bakersfield. We plan to continue building our legacy this year and make Shasta Wrestling a force in California.

The 3rd annual Shasta Wrestling Golf Tournament is September 17th, 2016 at Gold Hills Golf Course. As part of the tournament, we will be selling balls for a helicopter ball drop and tee sponsorships ONLINE. Our Helicopter Ball Drop has a grand prize of $1000! See details below. (All contributions are tax deductible and a donation receipt will be provided upon request.) 

How it Works: Helicopter Ball Drop

Shasta Wrestling Supporters purchase  golf balls for $10 each online.

Shasta Wrestling will send you an e-mail with your ball numbers

At approximately 6:00pm on September 17th, golf balls will be dropped from  a helicopter. The first ball in or closest to the hole wins the grand prize of $1000. The 2nd and 3rd balls in or closest to the hole will win  prizes as well.

Contestants do not need to be present to win. Winner will be notified via e-mail and a phone call.

How it Works: Hole Sponsorships

Purchase a hole sponsorship online  for $50 and Shasta Wrestling will put your name, family name, or business on a banner at the tee box.

Purchase a hole sponsorship online  for $100 and Shasta Wrestling will put your name, family name, or business on a banner at the tee box AND you will get 10 balls in the helicopter ball drop

How it Works: OFFICIAL TEAM SPONSOR

Select this perk ($500 or $1000) and you will be an official sponsor of Shasta Wrestling for the 2017 season. We will make you a custom banner and hang it in our practice room, dual meets, and the masters tournament for all to see.

 

As coach and former wrestler myself, I can confidently say that not a day passes when I do not draw upon a lesson or skill I learned in the Shasta High School Wrestling Room.

Alumni Wrestlers and Wolf Pack supporters, last year you came together and helped our young generation of wolves because you remember the glory days in the Shasta Wrestling Room and you see the positive impact Wrestling has on our youth. Please help us out once again, so we can continue to build our program and be a powerhouse in the  State.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT.

WOLF PACK!!!

story:
What is Conquer Self Lifestyle?

Conquer Self is a lifestyle clothing brand for those who rise above, wishing to better themselves in body, mind and spirit.

  • We all fall, we all fail. But those of us who get back up and never give up are the ones who conquer self.
  • Whether it's losing weight or becoming healthier. Facing a fear or learning something new, and challenging the mind. Even going beyond the mind and becoming more conscious and aware. None of it can happen without you conquering yourself, your insecurities, your demons, your fears. It's about letting go.
  • The Conquer Self  Lifestyle is about taking action and not giving up - as well as living life to the fullest, enjoying the journey and taking chances. It's about balance.

Our clothing is quality made and our designs are limited edition. That means that you can rest assured that everyone and their mothers won't be wearing the same designs. Only 50-100 of each design will ever be made. 


INSTRUCTIONS ON CONTRIBUTING IN EXCHANGE FOR A T SHIRT (PERK). 

When ready, click on the Perk you want on the right side of page.

You have some choices, like 1 shirt, 2 shirts, etc. After you donate/contribute, I will contact you to find out what size, style and color you want. The address you input is where your items will be shipped to. If you have any questions, please contact me.

SIZES: They come in X Small, Small, Medium, Large and X Large


Below are my premier, four designs to launch Conquer Self.


What We Need & What You Get

I need your help my friends:

  • I need to come up with (at least) $2,000 or more so I can launch The Conquer Self Lifestyle Co. and invest in creating new designs and marketing.
  • I CAN'T DO IT WITH OUT YOU!
  • With your contribution (s) you get Perks! They're listed to your right, up top -->

The Impact

Conquer Self is more then you and me. It's about helping others. Especially our youth.

 I strongly believe that if we focus on our youth, helping them become emotionally intelligent, creative, kind, healthy and educated, we can make this world a better place to live in.

It's about making a difference in this world, That is why I have teamed up with these two charities and more on the way!

Conquer Self will give 15% of monthly sales to:

Mindfulness Without Borders.org  They provide educational programs in mindfulness-based social and emotional learning that help individuals to flourish socially, emotionally, academically and professionally. They really focus on children and teens.

CenterForChildren.org MISSION: Protect the joy of childhood. Prevent emotional suffering. Incite change. VISION: Inspiring a world where all children and families live joyful, healthy lives.

AS SOON AS POSSIBLE WE'LL BE HELPING THE CHARITIES BELOW AS WELL.

LA-AlStars.org  After-School All-Stars (ASAS-LA) mission is to educate, enlighten, and inspire young people by providing exciting and dynamic opportunities for their success, while cultivating students’ self-esteem, leadership and respect for one another to help build healthier communities.

Stand Up for Kids.org StandUp For Kids advocates for young people in the nation to have the basic human rights of shelter, food and security. We believe it is the responsibility of the entire community to keep our youth safe, sheltered and supported. Our goal: Change the notion that youth are on the streets because they want to be!

                      "Be the change you wish to see in the world"  -Gandhi 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially in return for a Perk, then would you please share this campaign with your friends and family on social media? Now, if you could do both, well, that would make you pretty amazing in my book! ;) 


A LITTLE BIT ABOUT ME

My name is Efrain Guerrero Jr. Founder of the Conquer Self Lifestyle Co. I started Conquer Self because I know firsthand how difficult it is to rise above and not listen and believe the voice in my own head that tells me, I’m not good enough. Just give up.

You see, I have Dyslexia and ADD. What this means is that what comes easy for most, is very difficult for me. Difficult but not impossible.

The upside to this is my creativity. Then downside however, is that I give up on many ventures and as a result have spiraled into depression in the past. I have learned how to deal with this for the most part.

My R/X?

A balance of exercise, eating healthy (most of the time), meditating, feeding my mind daily and living life to the fullest because it’s too damn short. That means, enjoying life and all its splendor, i.e. drinking wine, traveling, enjoying the present moment and being kind and helping others along the way.

Every morning when we wake up, we have a choice to make. To be positive or negative. To let our bad thoughts and emotions dictate how are day goes, or to conquer them. I choose the latter... Most of the time :)

ABOUT THE RABBIT? 

I chose the rabbit as the logo as a nod to the movie The Matrix. It symbolizes freedom and reminds us to WAKE UP and stop living a life trapped in illusion; socially conditioned by the media, government and corporations. 


Thank you for your time and help. :)

PEACE, LOVE, HEALTH & SUCCESS!

Sincerely,

 Efrain Guerrero Jr.

www.ConquerSelfLifestyle.co

story:
Facebook            YouTube        Webpage


BlackBox is a grill oven. What is so special about it?

The first prototype was built for a friend who got fed up with the cheap and lousy charcoal grills. He wanted something better than the overpriced charcoal grills, but he didn't want to cook with gas as it would not give that distinct flavour.

So the first grill was built in 2012. When we first fired it up we knew we built something special. Since then we kept on designing, and now we have a truly usable product.
As we usually work with motorbikes in the workshop the functionality and simplicity of a design are the key features we are looking for. A good design doesn't need any unnecessary critter, or put it this way "function before form".

Don't you hate when you have to buy several appliances to cook a few different meals? We have developed our product with modularity in mind. Designed the housing to support a whole bunch of different types of grill cooking.

As we started to test our grill our friends came up with ideas, about how should we cook with it. We tried to incorporate as many methods as we could to give you a good all around tool. So take a look at the different types of cooking that is possible in this oven.

Basic grilling - with the use of the simple grate you can cook meat or vegetables over the wood cinder.

Flat plate - with this you can cook steaks and hamburgers best.

Slow cook - if you add the "Drip Tray" below the "Simple Grate" you can easily cook big pieces of meat slowly without burning it on the outside. Just pour some water or beer to make that perfect juicy meat.

Smoking - you can set up the grill for smoking at low temperatures. This is perfect to cook pulled pork or that unmatchable smoked barbecue which is cooked for several hours for perfection.

Grilled chicken - With the help of our "Skew" you can easily cook chicken, or anything you'd like on a skew

Because everybody's different we offer the possibility to customize your grill for your needs. If you buy the Basic Model we will ship it to you equipped with a set of simple grates. These are perfect for the simple barbecue. If you want to extend your possibilities you can always add one of our accessories later. Or buy the Deluxe Model which is equipped with all the accessories.


Firebox

This is were the magic happens. Grilling on open flames is not at all the best solution. This is why we have separated the fire from the cooking area. The carefully designed firebox is optimized to turn wood into cinder just under a matter of minutes. It keeps heat in and allows huge amount of air to feed the fire. When operated correctly this furnace produces large amounts of live cinder that can be used to grill. This method allows for perfect temperature control, while keeping the flavours from the wood smoke inside.


The heat storing lining

One of the biggest problem of the standard charcoal grills is that they cool down instantly when the cinder dies out. With the use of the special heat storing ceramic bricks the temperatures inside change slowly and evenly. Of course it takes some time to warm it up (25~35 minutes depending on the outside temperature) but once it has been heated it keeps the temperature even. This allows for a much more relaxed pace of grilling. You can adjust the temperature easily with the amount of cinder. Once the fire dies out the lining will keep the inside warm for hours. This way you can keep the food warm for later.


Adjustable and interchangeable grates


The height of the grate can be adjusted with the help of two simple handles. This allows for precisely setting up the amount of heat from below. For example for a good steak you want your cooking plate to be as hot as hell so you lower the grate, but for a big chunk of pork you would set it high to let it cook more slower.

We have developed different grates for different cooking styles and dishes. You can easily change these even during grilling. Find which one fits the food you are cooking the best.


Folding Legs

The legs are always a problem when you want to put away your barbecue, or want to put it into the car...etc. Usually they are fixed with bolts, so it takes time to fix 'em or they just fall out every time you want to lift the thing. BlackBox has stable fold-able legs. They are locked in both open and closed position by simple pin-bolts. You'll never loose the legs, and when you need them it just a moment to fold them out. The legs tall enough to place the grill in a comfortable height for cooking.


Cinder feed through

Once the cinder fell from the firebox you can simply push it below the grates. We realized that when you spend the whole afternoon grilling, eventually you need to clear the ash to make space for the new live cinder. So we made another opening on the opposite side where you can push the cinder through and out. It is great if you are cooking for a lot of friends. Basically you can operate the grill all day and all night long. 


Cover and vents

Every decent grill must have a proper cover to keep flavours and heat inside. Ours have one too. We made it hinged instead of the cheap take it off solution. Even if it is hot you can simple fold it open and it locks in. The simple spring loaded mechanism needs only one hand to operate. No more problem if you have a plate in one hand and want to close the lid.


For a better airflow control in the cooking space there are built in vents. They are easy to operate and with the temperature gauge built into the cover you can keep an eye on the process. With the help of the vents you can set your grill into "Smoking" mode. By directing the smoke and heat from the firebox into the cooking space you can make a perfect low temperature smoked barbecue.


Specifications

Overall dimensions:

Length   -   925[mm]  /   36,4[inch]

Width     -   330[mm]  /       13[inch]   (without cover handle)

Height    -  350[mm]  /    13,7[inch]   (with the legs closed)

Height   - 1020[mm]  / 40,15[inch]  (with the legs open)

Weight   -     50[kg]    /     110 [lb] (equipped with a set of grates and with all necessary tools)

Effective Grate size:

Length   - 556[mm]   / 21,9 [inch]  (divided into 2 separate grates)

Width     - 272[mm]   /  10,7[inch]

Materials:

Body  - Mild Steel (Painted with heat resistant paint)

Heat storing lining  - Ceramic fire-brick

Grate  - Stainless steel


We have built two prototypes and a small batch from the third one. We have put a lot of effort into designing and testing our grill. Now we would like to share the experience with you by offering the BlackBox Grill for pre-order. 

With your help we can establish a small business based on the BlackBox grill. We can spend money on marketing and reach an even wider audience. Or dream is not to get rich from this, but to create something we can be truly proud of and provide it to people who can appreciate the quality of a well designed and well built product.

We have designed a whole bunch of clever accessories which you can add to your existing grill thus improving and customizing it to your own needs. But we need a customer basis to offer these for the BlackBOX users.

In contrast with today's consumer society we don't want to create the cheapest possible grill. Sometimes it makes sense to pay a little more for something extra in quality. We want you to feel that if you buy our product than you have a grill for your life. One that you can pass onto your children, and they can to theirs. Like it was in the old days. Because a quality piece of meat grilled to perfection will never go out of date.

Zoltan - Founder / Engineering

I have graduated as a mechanical engineer, but since then I had the opportunity to work in many fields in different industries. I have commissioned wind turbines and for this travelled all around the world. I have repaired and programmed industrial robots and CNC machinery. Currently I am working for a design firm as a design engineer developing prototypes. Besides my professional career I have an almost professional workshop where I have been working ever since I was a little boy. I have modified and repaired motorcycles, built special tools, electric guitars, and for the last few years I am working on the restoration of my '66 VW Beetle. I love to cook and what I enjoy the most is cooking for and with my friends and family. When I am not out riding one of my bikes I am most probably grilling in the backyard with my buddies.

Daniel - Co-Founder / Production

I have been working on production lines as a service technician, keeping the machinery running, and installing new ones. After 3 years I wanted more challenges, so I left for a more interesting job, installing wind turbines around the world. Currently I am working for a developer company in the automotive industry. As a technician I build equipment for testing. Most of these are prototypes, used for testing power steering systems. Thanks to these wide experiences I have practical knowledge about how things work, and how they don't.

Ilus - Design / Marketing

As a graphic designer - I am the odd one out after the two engineers. My mission is to bring some colour and fun to the matt-black metal. I have designed wrapping for exclusive chocolate, wine labels and book covers. I like the simple but elegant designs. I am responsible for the appearance of the website and the Indiegogo campaign. I am also working on the marketing.


BlackBOX Cotton Apron

Made from heavy duty cotton fabric, branded with our logo on of our catchphrase.

Available in 3 colours: white, black, red. Do not forget to specify which one would you like when purchasing this perk. Just write the name of the selected colour in you comment.


Early bird - Discount

We offer the first buyers a grill with a huge discount. This is your opportunity to get our product at only half the price. Be quick and claim yours now!


Early bird - Fastest shipping

We are offering 10 grills with super fast shipping time. Claim this perk and you have the chance to actually have your grill before Christmas (oversees shipping may take longer but we will do our best). We will start manufacturing these while the campaign is still running to have them ready by the end of the campaign and ready to ship out.

Basic Model

This is the basic grill. We are offering it with a set of simple rod grates. It is up to you to customize your grill later with the add-ons you really need.

Includes:

- 1 BlackBox Grill oven

- 2 Simple rod type grates

- 1 set of tools (fire-iron, cinder pusher tool, grate height adjustment tool)


Deluxe Model

The Deluxe Model includes the Basic Model plus all the available add-ons (Flat-Plate, Pan, Skew...).

Includes:

- 1 BlackBox Grill oven

- 2 Simple rod type grates

- 1 set of tools (fire-iron, cinder pusher tool, grate height adjustment tool)

- 2 Flat plate

- 1 Skew  for grilled chicken

- 2 Pan / Dip-tray

Professional Model

The Professional model is intended for restaurants, bars, diners. This model is made of entirely from stainless steel in order to meet the strict regulations that apply for professional kitchens.

Includes:

- 1 BlackBox Grill oven (made from stainless steel)

- 2 Simple rod type grates

- 1 set of tools (fire-iron, cinder pusher tool, grate height adjustment tool)

- 2 Flat plate

- 1 Skew  for grilled chicken

- 2 Pan / Dip-tray

We have tried to take into account all the possible risks that can occur during the realization of the project. As we have passed the design and prototyping we have validated the design and identified most of the problematic areas. As this campaign is rolling we are simultaneously testing our product, by constantly cooking on it, let others cook on it and trying to abuse it as much as possible.

Besides the testing we are cooperating with our manufacturers to eliminate every problematic points regarding the manufacturing process. By the end of the campaign we will have a final design ready which will be optimized for usability as well as for manufacturability.

We are confident that the first 100 pieces would not present any problems and will be shipped by the date indicated in each perk. However if the campaign will get hugely successful the second batch can be delayed. We sourced some backup manufacturers to help us out in the case we need more grills than it was expected.

Overseas shipping might also cause some trouble. As the Grill is heavy, shipping by Air wouldn't be feasible. Shipping a product on sea can always encounter problems and delays. We are trying to figure out the best and quickest solution to avoid these problems.  We are currently negotiating with shipping companies to select the best.


Maybe you don't have the money or the space to buy a grill from us, but if you like our design then please help us with our vision.

Share our Facebook page, Website...

If you know somebody who might be interested please point him into our direction.

Please help our campaign to be successful and share...


- Do I need to add the cost of shipping to my pledge?

Please specify your address when ordering your grill and the shipping cost will be added automatically if you are living outside the EU.

- Will it work with wood charcoal?

The whole idea behind the BlackBOX is to eliminate the need for charcoal. With some modifications it could be adopted for it, but currently it is not equipped with such thing.

- What if my question isn’t answered here?

Please feel free to ask any questions. You can contact us by email, use the contact form on our website or contact via our Facebook page. Every question is important to us as it may even help us to hear about your concerns.

- Why fire-brick?

By using a ceramic heat storing lining (fire-brick) the temperature inside the grill is much more even. Of course it takes some to heat it up, but once it is warm it helps to cook by not letting the grill to cool down or heat up rapidly.

- Why wood?

To get that unmistakable taste that nothing can reproduce.

- How long does it take to heat up for cooking?

It depends on the firewood, outside temperature and how good are you in managing the grill. But usually between 25 to 45 minutes is all what you need.

- What type of dishes can you cook on this grill?

It is up to you, how creative are you. We tested it with almost everything we could think of. Here is a sort list of possibilities: hamburger, steak, pork, grilled chicken, grilled vegetables, pancakes, brownies, muffins, bread...

story: In the past 4 months since Logan was diagnosed , she has undergone 4 Chemotherapy Treatments at Great Ormond Street Hospital in London. She has tumours on her Adrenal Gland , Liver , Skull and throughout her bones. All 4 treatments have lasted 3 days where Logan has been put into the patient accomodation which is near the hospital which is mostly free but does have some expenses. She is often Neutropenic where her White Blood Cells are low and her body is open to infections so she is not allowed on public transport and travels to hospital in taxi to ensure her safety , a round trip of about 130 Miles. She has to be fed via a NG Tube and is on a milk supplement as she has not eaten properly for about 6 Months. She will eat finger foods but is almost always sick after and is seen by a dietician to try sort out her eating. Her treatment as of now has stopped as the tumours in her Skull and Bones are gone , The tumour on her Liver has decreased slightly but her primary tumour is still there and has not shrunk. Doctors don`t want to continue chemotherapy if the remaining tumours have not shrunk and are reluctant to operate as it is too dangerous for Logan , therefore she still has 2 tumours which could grow bigger and spread. At the moment it is continous testing and scans at Great Ormond Street Hospital to monitor the growths.

story: On May 9, 2015, Jordan Mary Margaret Wiswall tragically died after her mother, Stacey Feeney Wiswall, a single Mom, desperately tried to save her after a severe asthma attack. Jordan was a sweet, caring little girl. She loved fashion and was known as "a girlie girl." She loved to draw, swim at her grandparents, care for her dog, Teddy, but most important - play with her 4 siblings, Kaleb, 13, Michaela, 9 (her twin), Gabe, 8 and Sammy, 5. The money raised will be used for the family's bereavement counseling, day-to-day expenses and college funds for her siblings. Please help our dear friend and her family cope with this horrible, untimely passing of their daughter and sister, Jordan. Thank you for your generosity. Her friends: Catherine, Tracy, and JoAnne.

story:
Our Mission:

We are raising money and awareness for the American Cancer Society. If we reach our goal of $3,000, our teammate Caroline will participate in the Philadelphia Half Marathon in honor of her mother. We need your help!

A letter from Caroline:

In 2015, nearly 2 million new cases of cancer will be diagnosed in the United States, and over a quarter of those people will lose their lives.

My name is Caroline Kirkwood and in December 2014, my mother lost her life to blood cancer after a courageous 2.5 year battle. With my mother’s passing, my role as a caregiver was officially over, but my role in fighting cancer had only begun.

As I thought of ways to honor my mother and a play a role in finding a cure to cancer, I figured I would follow in my mother’s footsteps.

Years before my mother’s diagnosis, she herself walked a half marathon to raise funds for cancer research. This November, I will run the Philly Half Marathon while raising funds for the American Cancer Society.

Help me honor her memory and the memory of all of those who have battled cancer by donating to my fund. 

When I cross that finish line in November, we will be one step closer to a cancer free future.

Thank you for your support.

Love,

Caroline
story_txt: Our Mission:We are raising money and awareness for the American Cancer Society. If we reach our goal of $3,000, our teammate Caroline will participate in the Philadelphia Half Marathon in honor of her mother. We need your help!A letter from Caroline:In 2015, nearly 2 million new cases of cancer will be diagnosed in the United States, and over a quarter of those people will lose their lives.My name is Caroline Kirkwood and in December 2014, my mother lost her life to blood cancer after a courageous 2.5 year battle. With my mother’s passing, my role as a caregiver was officially over, but my role in fighting cancer had only begun.As I thought of ways to honor my mother and a play a role in finding a cure to cancer, I figured I would follow in my mother’s footsteps.Years before my mother’s diagnosis, she herself walked a half marathon to raise funds for cancer research. This November, I will run the Philly Half Marathon while raising funds for the American Cancer Society.Help me honor her memory and the memory of all of those who have battled cancer by donating to my fund. When I cross that finish line in November, we will be one step closer to a cancer free future.Thank you for your support.Love,Caroline

story:
Hi my name is Amy :) 

I am doing this due to the fact that a lot of people i have known over the years have died of cancer. It is bad enough when you find out someone has it but its even worse when you find out it is terminal and there is nothing you can do to help them. 

Recently, someone i know has lost a retaliative to cancer and it was really upsetting to know that she fought it the first time and lost the battle the second. The thing that inspired me to shave my hair was the fact that when this women found out she had cancer the first time she shaved off all her hair before treatment so that her hair wouldn't fall out randomly after treatment. 

To me my hair means a lot to me as it is a part of who i am so knowing that this women could shave her hair knowing it was going to fall out, i am sure i can get the courage to shave my hair to support all those who are going through treatment for cancer. 

Charities: 

I will be splitting the money that is earned between two charities; 
  • Cancer research (http://www.cancerresearchuk.org) - Over the past century, our researchers have made consistent progress in the fight against cancer. From studies of the intricate workings of molecules within cells to the results of large-scale clinical trials of treatments, every result helps to deepen our understanding of cancer, and highlight new ways to prevent, diagnose and treat it.
  • Teenage Cancer Trust - The TCT help to support teenagers who are suffering from cancer, such as Hodgkin's Lymphoma and leukaemia. There are currently 27 centres across the UK, and the money raised will help go towards building another 7.

I am hoping to raise at least £100 but £500 would be amazing :) 

Thanks guys for donating it means a lot to me and all the people who are fighting the battle with cancer.

story: My little orange girl is sick and we need help to get her better. Cooper has between $800 and $1000 of tests that need to be done to find out why her left eye is filling with blood. It's inflamed and she's in pain. All of the money raised will go to Cooper's medical care. Please help us do everything for her that we can.

story:
* OTA Upgrade refers to the wireless upgrade of software on your Memo Box.

 

 

 

 

FAQ's

 

1.  How does Memo Box 7-Day Smart Pill Box Set remind me?

After pairing Memo Box with the Memo Health app, you can set up and customize reminders on the app, which will be subsequently synched to your Memo Box. 

When it is your set alarm time, Memo Box will remind you with ‘beep’ sound, as well as green indicators. Visual and audio meds alarms repeat every 10 min and can persist for 30 mins (default alarm mode) or 90 mins (extended alarm mode).

In the event where you are unable to take medications when the alarm goes off, you can simply press the 'Alarm Snooze Button' on the pill box.

2. What are the differences between the three reminder options?

Regular mode: Memo Box will remind you with audio and visual alerts, during a 30 min period, with 10 min intervals.

Extended mode: Memo Box will remind you with audio and visual alert, during a 90 min period, with 10 min interval. You can choose 'extended mode', if you tend to be busy around the alarm time, and need to extend the length of the reminders.

Smart mode: If you usually take medication before the set alarm, you may want to set 'smart mode' on your Memo Box, which will record meds as 'taken', if you take medication 30 min prior to the set alarm. The alarm will only remind you, if you do not take medication 30 min prior.

3. How does Memo Box 7-Day Smart Pill Box Set track my medication intakes?

Memo Box automatically timestamps your access to meds when you open it. If this takes place during scheduled alarm intervals, corresponding medications will be marked as ‘taken'.

As a backup measure for users requiring strict medication adherence, family members and doctors can remotely track users' real-time medication intake on app; they can also be notified by the APP and intervene, when users miss their scheduled dose.

4. How does over-dose alert work?

Distractions or absent-mindedness can lead to overdosing. The attempt to open the pill box and access medication the second time, during a scheduled alarm interval, will trigger a double-dose-alert with sound and visual LED flashing.

You can track medication intake history on APP, to clear any possible confusion to whether you have already taken a scheduled medication or not.

5. What batteries do I use with Memo Box 7-Day?

Memo Box 7-Day is powered by built-in lithium-ion battery. It is rechargeable, with 1 month under typical usage.

6. How do I get started with using Memo Box 7-Day?

As well as the Quick Starter Guide, we have also prepared a series of short Youtube tutorials for you, where there are 30 s quick explanations of how each feature works.

Memo Box 7-Day Smart Pillbox Set Tutorials

7. What type of mobile device and system do I need for Memo Box?

  • Apple Watch and iPhone 4S and above, running iOS 8 or later.
  • Android device running OS 4.3 or later, with Bluetooth 4.0 support.

8. What's in the box?

  • x7 Smart Pillbox (color: cotton white).
  • x7 USB charging cables.
