story:
New member of Move It Club!

 

Dear friends,

Thanks for your support on Move It Speed. We are introducing a new product, Move It Swift, a type of Smart Boxing Gloves with 6-axis gyro sensor and patented algorithms, tracking your workouts in real time.

Check Out the Move It Swift !

 

With love,

Move It Team

 

Whether you are at home or in the office, Move It Speed is the perfect choice to relieve tension and stay fit. For both professionals or amateurs, it can bring the boxing experience to next level with the intelligent Move It App. Visualize the training process, follow fitness progress, and even gamify your workouts!​

 

​

*All the backers will get a Move It App 30-Days VIP Trial Card along your perk, and we will draw the winner of the prizes once the ends. Even more prizes are waiting for you to unlock!

Your Personal Online Trainer

No matter what your fitness level or goal is, the included Move It App has courses to meet your training needs. Follow along and learn the fundamental punching strikes and defensive positioning in real-time boxing. Review your punching performance data at the end of workout session.

Knock Out Your Stress

Long working hours, stressful thoughts, and general tension... Almost everyone suffers from them. So, why not take a break with Move It Speed, its freestanding design enables you to use it anywhere you want, office, hallway, bedroom... with a simple one touch-setup, you can ignite your power and release your stress. When the pressure builds…punch it out! With Move It Speed.

Convenient Whole-Body Workout at Home

Boxing is incredibly good for calorie burning and muscle building. It is an intense cardio workout that engages the entire body. It can burn up to 1000 calories per hour, making it a very efficient use of exercise time. It’s heart-healthy, builds muscle and increases speed, stamina, and endurance. Use Move It Speed along with Move It App to follow your progress, see real-time calorie consumption and to ultimately, get fit for life.

Have Fun with Friends

Stay engaged in your workouts by challenging your friends and community members to compete for higher score. Battle with your pals or even add their profile picture for inspiration or competition. Hit it hard, move up the leaderboard, and achieve healthy fitness in your communities.

Adjustable Rebound Speed

Unlike typical freestanding reflex bags, Move It Speed’s rebound speed can be varied by adjusting the spring’s emerging height. Thus, it’s suitable for all kinds of users from tall to short. Plus, the cemented carbide-made spring is made for years of use and abuse, ready to respond to your powerful strikes and bounce back reliably and safely.

Install On Any Surface

Move It Speed delivers unparalleled stability with its unique suction pad design. No matter whether it’s on ceramic tile or wood floor, you will never worry about tipping over or moving around. Just set it and go, your workout is steady and ready.

Durable and Safe

The stylish design of Move It Speed has the function as well as form. It uses the latest ultra-durable materials for superior comfort and reliability. The outer skin is wear-proof and punch-proof for long-lasting use. It also contains special multi-layer padding that protects you from injury with cushioning effect. It’s a modern take on an exercise equipment classic.

Power Longer Workouts

Powered by a 180mAh lithium battery and low-power Bluetooth components, Move It Speed will impress you with its ultra-long standby time and use time. Also, its Micro-USB charging port and detachable design enable you to charge it anywhere, for true convenience.

Read More

From Youtuber: "Kwonkicker"-Emphasis on the Striking Arts

From Youtuber: “Boxear mx”-Mexican Style Boxing

With more Fund We Raised,  You will have more surprises!

Reach 1st Stretch Goal($50,000)= Every one of our backer will receive a 30-Days VIP Courses on the Move It Fitness App!

Reach 2nd Stretch Goal($100,000)= Draw 20 Backers to win the Move It Boxing Training  Gloves!

Reach 3rd Stretch Goal($200,000)= Draw 1 Backer to win the Apple Watch 4!

Reach 4th Stretch Goal($300,000)= Draw 1 Backer to win the iPad Pro!

Reach 5th Stretch Goal($500,000)= Draw 1 Backer to win the iPhone Xs Max!

Reach 6th Stretch Goal($700,000)= Draw 1 Backer to win the Touch Bar MacBook Pro!

Reach 7th Stretch Goal($1,000,000)= Vote for anything you want!!!

*We will draw the winner once the campaign ends.

*All the backers will get a VIP card along your perk, which contains an unique series number, enter the number in our App and you can start your 30-day trail.

Durability Test

Move It Speed has been tested to sustain 150,000 hits without problem, each with force punching the punch bag + rod to 35-40 degrees, and at an average hit interval of 0.6 sec. Moreover, we have performed destructive testing on Speed’s design. it can sustain a maximum single punch force of 300 kg+ without problem.

Eggplant Technologies was founded in Dec 2014 with the focus on developing smart home devices and intelligent health products. We started the project of the “Move It" in July 2015 to give everyone, from beginner to higher level fitness enthusiasts, a convenient and engaging way to workout.

“As exercise physiologists and sports product makers, we understand what it takes to create effective exercise equipment that can help people lose weight, gain muscle and feel better. But stress takes a heavy toll on general health and can’t be ignored.

With Move It Speed, we have created an exercise system that gives people a great workout as well as an outlet for stress. It’s a fun and challenging way to knock out stress after a hard day’s work and get healthy at the same time. ” 

                                                                                                                                 - CEO of Move It

Lastly, we want to invite you to Join in our Referral Program:

【Share to Win!】

After your contribution to the Move It Speed, with more Friends you bring, you will get more Rewards:

How to join the Referral Program?

After getting your own Move It Speed, simple Click the buttons here:

Or:

  1. Log in your Indiegogo Account.
  2. Go to our Campaign Page.
  3. Share your personal Indiegogo Link to your friends.

   4. Your friend successfully pre-order the Move It Speed on Indiegogo.

    5. You will receive the referrals in your account.


How to check your Referrals?

1.  Log into your Indiegogo account

2.  Select the “My Profile” option

3.  Click the tab “Referrals”

4.  Count the number of backers you’ve accumulated


After the completion of our campaign, we will count your referral number and ship out the corresponding reward with your perk (We can track the referrals in our dashboard, every conversion count!). So, come and share it with all your friends! Get it for free!

 

*Our Referral Tips:

1, Share your pixel link to the place that more people can see, like Facebook, Twitter, Emails, Blogs, Groups, forums and so on. The more you share, the greater the chance you can win!

2, Share with more interesting topics, like: “Check out this intelligent punching bag I ordered on Indiegogo” or “It's time to get a smart Reflex Bag in your life!”

3, Share on some good forums, like some boxing forum, gadget forum, tech forum, etc.

4, ...Spread the 'Move It Speed' across the World!

 

Thanks for all your support!

 

Move It Team

story:
Campaign for new QuietOn Sleep launched! Check it out:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/quieton-slee...



QuietOn launched in Indiegogo Marketplace! Our sales continue in: 

https://www.indiegogo.com/products/quieton-acti...

 

 

 

QuietOn is an earplug that combines active noise cancellation and acoustic noise attenuation to create silence. The earplugs have no wires and are small enough to fit in your ears, enabling you to comfortably sleep with your head on a pillow. The noise cancellation is optimized to reduce noises that affect sleep, such as noise coming through walls and snoring.

 

 

 

Continuous exposure to noise results in significantly raised stress levels and presents a significant barrier to restful sleep, relaxation, or mental focus. QuietOn is an earplug that combines active noise cancellation and acoustic noise attenuation to create silence. These wireless earplugs are designed to fit perfectly in your ears, enabling you to comfortably sleep with your head on a pillow or enjoy some much-needed silence while you work or travel. 

Noise that affects sleep can reduce sleep quality and hence affect health and daily performance. Noise can have an enormous effect on mood and concentration. Being fully relaxed is critical in multiple situations eg. when heading to a business negotiation straight after a long flight, going to an important meeting after a long day, having a performance at the stage or a competition at the arena. QuietOn can calm your mind.

 

Perfect for Everyday Use

Also:

 

  • Motorcycling 
  • Meditating
  • Replacing uncomfortable hearing protection devices
  • Children and students having concentration problems
  • Creating a "personal space" in public facilities
  • Sport shooting
  • People suffering from noise sensitivity disorder
  • Airline pilots and cabin crew.

 

 

 

Top Performance Without Wires

 

 

 QuietOn earplugs provide noise reduction on the same level as the best on-ear noise cancelling headphones, yet they have no wires and are so small they fit in your ear. QuietOn enables top class noise cancellation performance with up to 50 hours battery life on a single charge. The active noise cancellation of QuietOn is especially focused to reduce low frequency ‘bass’ noise, which is not addressed by normal earplugs.

 

 

 

Comfortable, Ergonomic, and Wireless

Extensive research and modeling have resulted in an optimal design that ensures the earplugs fit perfectly in your ear. The earplugs are small enough to enable sleeping with your head on a pillow.

Portable & Easy to Use

 

No buttons - the earplugs switch on automatically when removed from the charging and carrying case. The case fits easily in a pocket or bag, so you can carry it with you wherever you go.

 

 

 

QuietOn in media

 

Product Description

Sales package includes the box which is the charging case itself includes one pair of earplugs and two pairs of silicone tips. One pair of tips for smaller ears and the other pair of tips for bigger ears. 

Dimensions

Our Manufacturing / Fulfillment Timeline

QuietOn prototypes were tested with a wide audience and they got superb feedback! Often, test users asked if they could buy the prototype right after testing. The device clearly improves ability to sleep both at home and while travelling.

Here are the steps for the QuietOn team. Currently we are setting up the mass production. Manufacturing has started and QuietOn is now shipping. Estimation is that all the items will be sent in October at the latest.  Sales will continue on Indiegogo also after that with real retail price and shorter waiting time. 

 

 

We have planned four different kind of perks for you. When funding a perk you will be one of the first to have this ground-breaking product at a special price! 

 

 

The QuietOn team

 

Janne Kyllönen - Founder, Product Director, COB

 

Janne is enthuastic innovator and user experience driven Product Manager. He has over 14 years experience of product and project management in Nokia, Microsoft and Pehutec. Janne has is the inventor of a large number of patents and has led teams to develop outstanding consumer products. Janne is the inventor of QuietOn earplugs and will work to ensure that they deliver a superb user experience.

 

 

Matti Nisula - Founder, CTO

Matti is an audio, electronics and signal processing guru. Matti has eight years of working experience from Nokia and Microsoft where He was the “golden ear” for analyzing and fine tuning the mobile phone and mobile accessory devices to their world famous audio quality. Matti has developed QuietOn’s outstanding noise cancellation electronics and passive acoustic noise reduction capabilities. Matti is responsible for leading technology development to ensure product performance and production quality targets are met.

 

 

Pekka Sarlund - CEO

Pekka has an over 30 year career in the ICT business. He is a former Vice President of Nokia. Pekka has proven capabilities to successfully lead global operations and large scale ICT business. Pekka's wide contact network in the ICT industry gives QuietOn an advantage in finding the best technology and business  partner.

 

 

Ashley Colley - Senior Designer

Ashley is an innovator and user experience designer. Ashley has more than 20 years working experience in the technology development and design with Nokia and various other companies. Ashley is the inventor of over 30 patents. 

 

 


Marko Kangasluoma – Senior Designer

Marko has 15 years experience predominantly in audio development for Nokia and Microsoft. Marko has strong background in SW development and testing and will focus on building the quality assurance system for QuietOn production.

 

 

Hannu Lehtisalo - Director, Operations/Logistics/Sourcing 

Hannu has over 30 years of experience from directing the electronics and mechanics production in factories for Nokia and Huawei. Hannu is responsible for selecting production partners and ramping up the production process. Hannu will also be responsible for sourcing and logistics.
 

 

 

Pekka Päivärinta - Senior Manager

Pekka has 20 years of experience in the ICT Business in engineering and management roles. Pekka has been CEO of several successful R&D companies. Pekka is responsible for managing operative and business issues alongside the CEO.

 

 

Outi Forstén - Marketing Director

 

Outi has over a decade's long career in ICT companies. She's experienced in marketing within several different kind of businesses. Outi's influence has played a big role behind some of the greatest success stories in entertainment business in Northern Finland.

 

The QuietOn team is also strengthened with carefully selected sub-contracted designers. For example we are using electronics design and mechanical design services from Lewel Group. Company has a good track record of delivering high quality designs.

 

Partners

 

 

The History of QuietOn

It all started in an airport electronics store while waiting for a connection flight. Upon trying on a pair of noise-cancellation headphones, Janne felt like his stress levels had reduced immediately. Then he started thinking: Why hasn’t noise cancellation technology been used more? What are the key issues which prevent its widespread adoption by a wider audience?

The answer was simple: The device needs be wire-free and small enough to fit in the ear, thus enabling sleeping.

When Janne returned home he called Matti and started to discuss how they could miniaturize noise cancellation technology for the earplug form factor. Janne and Matti built several iterations of smaller and smaller prototypes of QuietOn and, finally in early 2015, they had first pair of earplugs, which were small enough to enable sleeping with the head on the pillow, plus noise cancellation performance that was even better than market's leading noise cancellation headphones.

The prototype was put straight into usability testing and was presented to the first investors. The feedback was great and product development was started.

 We developed prototypes with improved electronics and industrial design in cooperation with our technology development partner, Haltian. We spent a lot of time analyzing ear anatomy to find the perfect shape, and spent countless days finding ways to make the technology even smaller and more reliable without compromising performance. Additionally, we designed the small charging box to maximize portability and ease of use. With all of these key boxes checked, we filed the appropriate patents and were officially incorporated as QuietOn. 

 

Great Results from Airline Usability Tests

QuietOn noise cancelling earplugs were chosen to participate in Finnair's Test Lab in the Sky program where the airline tests different products and concepts with the aim of improving the travelling experience. In Finnair Test Lab, QuietOn earplugs were given to volunteering customers during select long haul Finnair flights during December 2015 and January 2016. The results from the tests are positive and passengers gave positive feedback for noise cancellation and comfort.

 

 

 

 

 

Feedback from airline usability tests:

"Was able to sleep well with the earplugs, did not wake up, only shortly before landing. Very good product would recommend" 

"My seat is 41J, above the engine. The QuietOn earplugs almost block 100% noise from outside. Good effect. Easy to wear during sleeping, not drop off. My ears are not uncomfortable after 1.5 hours wearing."

"Very useful"  

"It reduced background noise very well and it was easy to concentrate on reading a book." 

"Only positive things. Absolutely no complaints."

"Really good. This is what we have been waiting for. Ten points. Small size is handy. I will buy these right away. (I won't return the proto because these are so good)"

"I slept 1.5 hours with these earplugs, and actually I slept really well comparing sleeping without earplugs."

"They were excellent a lot better than imagined. By far the best I ever used. I would buy them today if the price was OK "

"Comfortable to wear and pleasant experience"

"Comfortable and easy to use even when sleeping. Allowed better different head positions"

"Very comfortable to fit in. Perfect shape. "

"I did not even physically feel the device more than soft foam earplugs. It has no wires which is a big plus especially in a tight airplane where you don’t want to be tangled in wires. Blocks hum around effectively."

"Earplugs worked very well, I was flying at the back of the plane where there is usually much more noise, it really kept noise level down" 

 

 

How it works?

Active noise cancelling uses a microphone to sample the sound, and a speaker to create a phase-shifted sound that cancels the original sound. 
In full-size on-ear noise cancelling headphones the microphone element is located outside the ear. However, in QuietOn, the microphone that samples the sound is located right inside the ear canal! This means that QuietOn can more accurately produce anti-noise that results in good noise cancellation at the ear drum. By locating the microphone in the air volume of the ear canal, QuietOn is also able to reduce noise that is conducted by the skull into the ear.
 

Traditional earplugs use passive attenuation to reduce the level of sound entering the ear. Whilst they are good at blocking high frequency sound, they are quite poor at reducing low frequency sound, especially below 200 Hz.

Thus, the problem area for traditional earplugs is these low frequencies. Examples of such penetrating low frequency sounds are airplane noise (noise level peaks at 70 Hz), noise in factories and noise that comes through the walls of buildings. Also, snoring is mostly comprised of this low frequency sound. When you use passive earplugs on an airplane, you will notice that, although it reduces sounds from people chatting in the cabin, the background engine noise is almost unchanged.

QuietOn earplugs combine the advantages of in-ear passive earplugs with active noise cancelling, providing optimal noise reduction across the whole audible spectrum. This makes QuietOn ideal for use in a variety of noisy environments.

 

You can contribute

We are trying to create comfortable silence but now we need You to make some big noise so that people become aware of our new invention.  Like, love, share and contribute to our campaign via the Indiegogo sharing tools, Google+, Facebook, Linkedin, Twitter, Youtube and Instagram.

 

FAQ

 

Q: How can we get in touch with your team?

A: We welcome you to visit our website www.QuietOn.com and if you have any questions regarding QuietOn or our Indiegogo campaign, please contact us info@quieton.com or our customer service salla.lamminpaa@quieton.com. 

Q: When will the first QuietOn earplugs be delivered? When will I get my own earplugs? Where do you ship?

A: Our pre-production started in March 2016. The first product deliveries were sent on August 2016. Currently we aim to ship during two weeks after order's been done.

Q: What comes in the box?

A:  You will get a pair of earplugs with two changeable silicone covers, which are designed for bigger and smaller ears. Also a pair of black M-size Comply foam tips are included. You will get a carrying case that works as a charging case. Charging can be performed with a normal micro USB cable connected to a charger or computer. A charger and USB cable are not included in the sales package.

Q: I'm having trouble claiming a perk. Who should I reach out to?

A: Email: support@indiegogo.com

Q: How do I upgrade my perk?

A: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/526756

Q: I would like a refund. How do I do this?

A: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/213172367

Q: If you compare QuietOn earplugs to other similar kind of products, how competitive is the product's noise cancelling performance?

A: We have tested competitor devices in our laboratory and also compared with results published on testing sites. We have not found any noise cancellation devices that have better performance than QuietOn.

Q: For what kind of noise situations is the product designed for?

A: The passive part of the noise cancellation works as an old fashioned passive earplug. In addition to that we have active noise cancellation, which is very effective at attenuating noise below 1KHz in frequency. Some examples of this low frequency noise are music or traffic sound coming through the walls, engine sound or snoring.

Q: What are the QuietOn's earplug's benefits compared to normal earplugs?

A: Normal earplugs are comfortable but unfortunately they are not able to block low frequency noise. QuietOn is the only earplug which can block low frequency noise.

Q: Can I listen to music with QuietOn earplugs?

A: The earplugs are intended for making silence. There is no Bluetooth connection and music playback is not supported.

Q: Is QuietOn able to minimize the effects of tinnitus (ringing inside the ears)?

A: Staying in a noisy environment might make tinnitus worse afterwards. Therefore we think QuietOn with its good noise reducing capabilities can work as a preventive action. On the other hand, tinnitus becomes more noticeable in silence, so the earplugs might not help if your ears are already ringing. QuietOn isn't able to turn tinnitus off because according to our understanding it isn't real noise but an error signal inside the head.

Q: How do I insert and use the QuietOn earplugs correctly?

A: Please check out the “How it Works” section above. Also make sure the device is inserted correctly in ears to get full performance. The earplug must be in the right angle, choose also correct size of tips. The device must be airtight. When the ear canal is sealed you can feel "small pressure" inside and hear small electronical background noise of the product.

Q: What is the size and weight of the device?
A: Please see the Product dimensions picture above.

Q: Customs, taxes?
A: QuietOn is not responsible for customs, taxes, import duties, brokerage or any additional charges by your local government, these are the responsibility of the recipient.
story_txt:
Campaign for new QuietOn Sleep launched! Check it out:https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/quieton-slee...QuietOn launched in Indiegogo Marketplace! Our sales continue in: 
https://www.indiegogo.com/products/quieton-acti...
 
 
 


QuietOn is an earplug that combines active noise cancellation and acoustic noise attenuation to create silence. The earplugs have no wires and are small enough to fit in your ears, enabling you to comfortably sleep with your head on a pillow. The noise cancellation is optimized to reduce noises that affect sleep, such as noise coming through walls and snoring. 
 

 
Continuous exposure to noise results in significantly raised stress levels and presents a significant barrier to restful sleep, relaxation, or mental focus. QuietOn is an earplug that combines active noise cancellation and acoustic noise attenuation to create silence. These wireless earplugs are designed to fit perfectly in your ears, enabling you to comfortably sleep with your head on a pillow or enjoy some much-needed silence while you work or travel. 
Noise that affects sleep can reduce sleep quality and hence affect health and daily performance. Noise can have an enormous effect on mood and concentration. Being fully relaxed is critical in multiple situations eg. when heading to a business negotiation straight after a long flight, going to an important meeting after a long day, having a performance at the stage or a competition at the arena. QuietOn can calm your mind.
 
Perfect for Everyday Use







Also:
 

Motorcycling 
Meditating
Replacing uncomfortable hearing protection devices
Children and students having concentration problems
Creating a "personal space" in public facilities
Sport shooting
People suffering from noise sensitivity disorder
Airline pilots and cabin crew.



 
 


 
Top Performance Without Wires
 

 
 QuietOn earplugs provide noise reduction on the same level as the best on-ear noise cancelling headphones, yet they have no wires and are so small they fit in your ear. QuietOn enables top class noise cancellation performance with up to 50 hours battery life on a single charge. The active noise cancellation of QuietOn is especially focused to reduce low frequency ‘bass’ noise, which is not addressed by normal earplugs.
 

 
 
Comfortable, Ergonomic, and Wireless
Extensive research and modeling have resulted in an optimal design that ensures the earplugs fit perfectly in your ear. The earplugs are small enough to enable sleeping with your head on a pillow.

Portable & Easy to Use
 
No buttons - the earplugs switch on automatically when removed from the charging and carrying case. The case fits easily in a pocket or bag, so you can carry it with you wherever you go.
 

  QuietOn in media

 

Product Description
Sales package includes the box which is the charging case itself includes one pair of earplugs and two pairs of silicone tips. One pair of tips for smaller ears and the other pair of tips for bigger ears. 
Dimensions

Our Manufacturing / Fulfillment Timeline

QuietOn prototypes were tested with a wide audience and they got superb feedback! Often, test users asked if they could buy the prototype right after testing. The device clearly improves ability to sleep both at home and while travelling.
Here are the steps for the QuietOn team. Currently we are setting up the mass production. Manufacturing has started and QuietOn is now shipping. Estimation is that all the items will be sent in October at the latest.  Sales will continue on Indiegogo also after that with real retail price and shorter waiting time. 


 


 
We have planned four different kind of perks for you. When funding a perk you will be one of the first to have this ground-breaking product at a special price! 
 
 
The QuietOn team
 


Janne Kyllönen - Founder, Product Director, COB
 
Janne is enthuastic innovator and user experience driven Product Manager. He has over 14 years experience of product and project management in Nokia, Microsoft and Pehutec. Janne has is the inventor of a large number of patents and has led teams to develop outstanding consumer products. Janne is the inventor of QuietOn earplugs and will work to ensure that they deliver a superb user experience.
 
 

Matti Nisula - Founder, CTO
Matti is an audio, electronics and signal processing guru. Matti has eight years of working experience from Nokia and Microsoft where He was the “golden ear” for analyzing and fine tuning the mobile phone and mobile accessory devices to their world famous audio quality. Matti has developed QuietOn’s outstanding noise cancellation electronics and passive acoustic noise reduction capabilities. Matti is responsible for leading technology development to ensure product performance and production quality targets are met.
 
 

Pekka Sarlund - CEO
Pekka has an over 30 year career in the ICT business. He is a former Vice President of Nokia. Pekka has proven capabilities to successfully lead global operations and large scale ICT business. Pekka's wide contact network in the ICT industry gives QuietOn an advantage in finding the best technology and business  partner.
 
 

Ashley Colley - Senior Designer
Ashley is an innovator and user experience designer. Ashley has more than 20 years working experience in the technology development and design with Nokia and various other companies. Ashley is the inventor of over 30 patents. 
 
 

Marko Kangasluoma – Senior Designer
Marko has 15 years experience predominantly in audio development for Nokia and Microsoft. Marko has strong background in SW development and testing and will focus on building the quality assurance system for QuietOn production.
 
 

Hannu Lehtisalo - Director, Operations/Logistics/Sourcing 

Hannu has over 30 years of experience from directing the electronics and mechanics production in factories for Nokia and Huawei. Hannu is responsible for selecting production partners and ramping up the production process. Hannu will also be responsible for sourcing and logistics.
 

 
 

Pekka Päivärinta - Senior Manager
Pekka has 20 years of experience in the ICT Business in engineering and management roles. Pekka has been CEO of several successful R&D companies. Pekka is responsible for managing operative and business issues alongside the CEO.

story:
The COMO Derby Dames, Columbia's only all-women, flat-track roller derby league, has played a pivotal role in promoting female empowerment in the Columbia community since 2007.

In 2011, the Dames were accepted to the Women's Flat Track Roller Derby Association (WFTDA) as a Class B member in the North Central Region - which meant they had to leave the friendly confines of their local COMO venue behind due to safety reasons.

"From 2008 to 2011, the team competed at the Boone County Fairgrounds — the girls would arrive early to clean horse manure off the floor and duct tape mattresses around the poles in the middle of the rink." (Inside Columbia Magazine, 2012)

The Dames headed to Jefferson City, more than a 30 minute drive away from the town they lived and practiced in.  They have been there ever since. 

Now the Dames have the chance to come back to Columbia - for good!  We have the building, fans, drive, and determination...we just need a floor. 

What We Need & What You Get

To purchase hardboard flooring, plywood under-flooring, storage space rental, sound equipment, and seating options, we need to raise $10,000 by December 2014.

We have a ton of uniquely COMO Derby Dames swag to reward you with for supporting the Dames. Anything from a high five to a custom taxidermied domestic animal, we've got you covered. All contributions received will still be used to bring the Dames back to COMO.

We are motivated to make a COMO homecoming, and while we hope our triumphant return will be for the 2015 season, we understand that fundraising can be challenging. We vow to keep chipping away at our $10,000 goal until we can come home.

The Impact

First and foremost, roller derby is powerful for all who participate. The COMO Derby Dames are a 501(c)3 non-profit organization, putting emphasis on giving back to our community - on and off skates.

We have volunteered with a number of organizations including:

  • Children's Miracle Network
  • Safe Kids Discovery Day at University Women & Childrens Hospital
  • Challenger Baseball
  • Ronald McDonald House
  • Relay for Life
  • Mid-Missouri PrideFest
  • Earth Day
  • True/False Film Festival
  • Citizen Jane Film Festival
  • ALS Association
  • Voluntary Action Center
  • Food Bank for Central and Northeast Missouri
Your contribution in bringing the Dames back to Columbia would allow us to devote more time to giving back to our community. We have successfully navigated being a competitive roller derby league as well as a volunteer organization for over 8 years. We look forward to many more to come in our hometown.

Risks & Challenges

Challenges:

  • Our Columbia venue does not have a floor suitable for a derby bout. 
  • We have to have a floor in order to return to COMO. The benefit of purchasing a floor allows us to grow and improve in Columbia.
  • We are an entirely volunteer run organization - everyone wants to help. However, we have created a top-down approach to organization and leadership within the league for this fundraiser.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? Share this far and wide with your friends and family. We know the roller derby community is huge and would appreciate your support in spreading the word.

We will need people to help us in the 2015 season as we (hopefully) transition to a new venue with the fancy new floor YOU helped us purchase. Volunteers are an essential part of our derby family - come join us!

Get out there and donate, spread the word, and bring us home!

story:
***SENSIMAT CAMPAIGN UPDATE***

Our Indiegogo campaign is now closed. Thanks to all of you, we managed to raise $16,871 to help improve the lives of wheelchair users. For more information, please visit www.sensimatsystems.com


Cheers,

Will Mann

Co-Founder, SENSIMAT


 

Breathing: It just happens automatically. The same can be said for shifting your position in a chair - when you are uncomfortable, your brain automatically signals for movement. However, for wheelchair users, relieving seat pressure is no longer an automatic process and if not counteracted through a strict pressure relief regimen, can potentially lead to health problems down the road.




 Discrete

The SENSIMAT is unintrusive. It is inserted underneath your wheelchair cushion and wirelessly syncs with your mobile phone.


Wireless

Set alerts, track pressure reliefs, and analyze relief trends to proactively monitor and manage your prevention regimen.


Collaborative

Enable access for your family members and care team to provide you with a better assessment of your progress.

Wheelchair users need to actively undergo pressure relief every 15 to 30 minutes by performing shifts, a lateral bend, forward lean, or vertical push-up. On top of all the other things that wheelchair users must deal with on a daily basis, pressure relief can fall by the wayside. This is where the SENSIMAT helps.

 

The SENSIMAT for Wheelchairs is a thin, wireless mat of pressure sensors that is inserted underneath a wheelchair cushion. The mat connects via Bluetooth to the SENSIMAT mobile app which allows 24/7 monitoring of the wheelchair cushion.



  

Option 1: Self-Managed

For users who want independent control of their pressure data. Record data on your pressure and relief during daily life. Identify issues and habits, and improve on your regimen.

Option 2: Remote Monitoring

Securely log in, roster your patients, and remotely monitor their adherence to a relief regimen. Get notified when patients are having trouble with their pressure relief.






Track

The SENSIMAT is unintrusive. It is inserted underneath your wheelchair cushion and wirelessly syncs with your mobile phone.




Relieve

Set alerts, track pressure reliefs, and analyze relief trends to proactively monitor and manage your prevention regimen.




Analyze

Enable access for your family members and care team to provide you with a better assessment of your progress.

 

The SENSIMAT is fully customized to your wheelchair cushion(ie. 16 inches front to back, 18 inches left to right). The SENSIMAT is inserted directly underneath your wheelchair cushion and zipped up in the existing wheelchair cushion sleeve.

The SENSIMAT is comprised of the sensor hardware, the SENSIMAT mobile app, and the SENSIMAT web portal. The hardware is 1/2 an inch thick with strategically-placed force sensors contained by a medical-grade fabric. The hardware has an on/off switch and a micro-USB charging port, but is otherwise wireless.

The SENSIMAT sends the pressure data to a mobile app via Bluetooth. A proprietary algorithm on the app detects whether a wheelchair user is: in/out of the seat, leaning left, right, forward, or is lifting off the seat. As the user is seated, visual indicators will turn from green to yellow and then red after the user-adjusted time has elapsed (ie. 15/30 minutes). User managed alerts (ie. vibrate, ring) are provided at each change. If a relief movement is detected, the sensor colors are reset to green and the relief type is logged in the dashboard. The mobile app syncs with our server, where we store 3.6 million data points/user/week.

SENSIMAT data can be accessed through the mobile app dashboard, or through the web portal.

The Canadian patent for the SENSIMAT has since been awarded and the American patent is currently pending. (Patent# CA2775250, Pending PCT/CA2009/001532). 

 

We have tested the SENSIMAT at the Toronto Rehabilitation Institute in combination with a number of different wheelchairs, cushions, and users. Our testing has allowed us to develop algorithms that can accurately detect if a user is in/out of the chair, leaning left, leaning right, leaning forward, and the associated time stamps.

If you are a researcher who is interested in working with us, please get in touch with us at info@sensimatsystems.com and check out our Research Package perk!

Figure: Temporal profile of SENSIMAT sensor signals when individuals engage in a left lean, followed by a right lean, followed by a forward lean.

Source: Gabison S, Verrier M, Nussbaum EN, et al. Can we reliably characterize weight shifting behaviours using a 'smart' pressure mat? Poster. Toronto Rehabilitation Institute. 2013.

The Perks: Not Just for Wheelchair Users

It doesn't matter if you are a wheelchair user, simply interested in the technology, or looking to support the cause: we have a perk for you! The SENSIMAT mobile app is a free download and all perks come with a minimum of 6 months access to the SENSIMAT web portal. The MSRP of the SENSIMAT for Wheelchairs will be approximately $599.00 and a small monthly fee to access the web portal, but for our campaign you can get the SENSIMAT heavily discounted.

The Impact: Why We Need Your Support

We've been working on SENSIMAT for over 18 months. We have tested the SENSIMAT for Wheelchairs at the Toronto Rehabilitation Institute with actual wheelchair users and validated that it can accurately detect a user's seating. It has also been tested at several other healthcare institutions including an advanced rehabilitation facility, a nursing simulation hospital, a spinal cord injury model center, an acute care facility, and many community-based wheelchair users.

We need your support to bring the SENSIMAT from it's current minimum viable product, all the way to the finish line by refining the hardware, software, and underlying data algorithms. We will also be finalizing our production run, certifying our hardware, and shipping out those units!

With your help, we can vastly improve the lives of wheelchair users.

Do You Know a Wheelchair User in Economic Need?

If you can't contribute, that's OK! You can still help us out:

  • Spread the word about our campaign, Tweet about us, like us on Facebook, and post a link to our campaign on both
  • Write about us on your blog or news page
  • Use Indiegogo's built-in share tool to get the word out.

At SENSIMAT, we understand that not all wheelchair users who want a SENSIMAT can afford one. That is why we have designated a perk to allow the community to donate contributions towards giving a SENSIMAT to a wheelchair user in need.

Are you a wheelchair user in need? Do you know one - a family member, a friend, someone that you really admire? Please email us at info@sensimatsystems.com and let us know your story. We can't give a SENSIMAT to everyone, but we will select as many wheelchair users as we possibly can. All we ask in return is that you thank the Indiegogo community member that donated a contribution towards your SENSIMAT in the medium of your choice: paper and pen, video, pictures - be as creative as you want!
story_txt:
***SENSIMAT CAMPAIGN UPDATE***Our Indiegogo campaign is now closed. Thanks to all of you, we managed to raise $16,871 to help improve the lives of wheelchair users. For more information, please visit www.sensimatsystems.comCheers,Will MannCo-Founder, SENSIMAT 
Breathing: It just happens automatically. The same can be said for shifting your position in a chair - when you are uncomfortable, your brain automatically signals for movement. story:
Short Summary

Please watch this news video that features Mom and Dad . It details their situation.   http://abc30.com/191445/

This fund has been set up for Jack(82) and Earlene(77) by two of their daughters, Jackie and Rachel.  We are trying to find any way to help our parents dig a new well on their property in Merced, CA.  

Dad and Mom's well dried up this weekend and they were told they must drill a new well to reach the depth of the lowered water table (300 feet).  It will cost AT LEAST $20,000 to dig a new one.  

Our parents are both elderly and live in the tiny house that they have been in for years.  Dad is a retired Baptist minister and Korean War veteran. Mom has been a full-time mother to her 5 kids and wife to Dad for over 50 years.They live on a fixed income from their Social Security.  There is no way they are going to be able to afford this new well without help. Many people have asked us what they can do to help.  One of the easiest and most immediate ways to help is to contribute to this fund!  Any contribution, no matter how small, will help!

What We Need 

  • We need any funds possible to offset the cost of digging a new well.  A whole new well will need to be drilled and the cost will be AT LEAST $20, 000!

The Impact

Currently, Jack and Earlene are borrowing water from their neighbor through a water hose that has been stretched across the fence between the two properties.  They have limited their water use to 2 minute showers and restricting their flushing.  Also, they are having to take their laundry to a laundromat and driving to the grocery store to fill up 5 gallon jugs for drinking and cooking water.

Please, help us help our parents.  We do not want to see them spending their golden years struggling for something as basic as water.  They have sacrificed so much for us and others.  They have shown love to so many throughout the years.  Help us show them how much we care about them.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share this campaign on your Facebook page and help get the word out!
  • Please PRAY. 
  • If you want to send them your well-wishes, you can contact them through Jackie at jackettewill@yahoo.com

story:
We are students from the University of Pennsylvania pursuing careers in the medical field.  The summer of 2013 we went to Ghana through an internship program organized by a partnership between  University of Pennsylvania andKwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology, called theInternational Development Summer Institute where we worked at Asonomaso district hospital. We identified lots of challenges facing the health sector which we intend to tackle through this campaign. For example, the hospital lacked efficient malaria testing kits that sometimes led to inaccurate diagnosis. Also the improvised TB testing which was done in open space put both the lab technician and other people passing by at risk of contracting the disease. The hospital also lacked basic amenities that promote hygiene in the hospital and to us this was counter productive to the hospital's mission.

This campaign is an effort to provide quality healthcare especially in the neo maternal healthcare sector and health literacy.  The hospital could benefit from simple patient care signs, as well as medical supplies and equipments.  Contributors would help us achieve this mission in the area by providing them with any kind of monetary support or medical facilities .

More detail about our mission:

Asonomaso District hospital is the center medical facility for 10 surrounding rural districts that consist primarily of people who are less educated (meaning they do not speak English or have a formal education) and stick closely to tradition.  The hospital, while not developed at all, is run in the English language and practices contemporary medicine.  Many patients already have an aversion to “new,” despite the fact that they do not understand much of what is happening because of the language barrier.  

Our project also effectively attempts to destroy this language barrier so that the hospital can work on other advancements in patient literacy.  The instructions on various medicines, and posters intended to remind the patients of how to take care of themselves are in a language that they do not understand and by translating their posters on maternal health, malaria and HIV prevention, treatment of sepsis and hypertension, water safety and sanitation etc. will greatly improve the patient’s knowledge. 

Based on our observations, insufficient health education occurs on an everyday basis due several factors including limited patient-physician interaction and lack of patient access to formal education. In terms of limited patient-physician interaction, on a typical day in Asonomaso District Hospital a physician assistant sees 40-60 patients a day and refers patients that require immediate consultation to the physician. The physician is responsible for both following up on patient referrals and performing surgical procedures. Particularly in this district hospital, there are two physician assistants and one physician and they tend to an average of 150-200 patients each day. As a result of this deficient physician-to-patient ratio, physicians spend approximately 3-5 minutes with each patient in order to see all of the patients. Overall, a major barrier to educational health promotion is simply the fact that the medical team does not have enough time to both address patient health issues and effectively teach each patient how to prevent or manage certain diseases.  

In order to have an assessment of patient knowledge there must be an effective method of communication between health care provider and patient, and from our observations in Asonomaso this is the heart of the problem.

You can also find other projects done by a different section of the IDSI group on this link



      Synae Allen,

      Britney Smith

      Kevin Muriuki

story:
Meet The Mindfulness Center

The Mindfulness Center is a non-profit wellness center, dedicated to bringing mindfulness to all dimensions of life through meditation, mindfulness in health, lifestyle and community. Through research, education and practice, we strive to promote optimal well-being and a sustainable lifestyle.


Campaign Goal

The goal is to raise $5,000 to develop a mindfulness meditation program as an intervention for families with children diagnosed with Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder. We are recruiting at least 100 families, through several major urban health facilities, to participate in the development and testing stage of this program.  Each family will receive a package with two guided meditations, for use by all family members. This set also includes an instructional recording explaining the evidence-basis for the use of mindfulness practices for treatment of ADHD and guidance on how to use this program.

After the development and testing stage, the program will be available for distribution to the public.  Mindfulness Practices for ADHD: A Family Practice, with Deborah Norris, Ph.D., will be evaluated for its clinical effectiveness in significantly reducing and relieving the symptoms of ADHD. Prior interventions and recordings by Dr. Norris have proven effective in reducing stress and anxiety and improving self-control in other children and adult populations.


According to the Center for Disease Control,

  • The percentage of children with an ADHD diagnosis continues to increase, rising from 7.8% in 2003 to 11% in 2011.
  • Approximately 14% of all boys 3-17 years of age have been diagnosed with ADHD as of 2011.
  • The average family with an ADHD child spends about $1,474 annually in direct cost expenditures, and $2,728… [in] indirect expenditures.  (Firmin and Phillips, 2009)

Percent of Youth Age 3-17 Diagnosed with ADHD by State: National Survey of Children's Health

ADHD is an epidemic in the United States.  The effects of ADHD can drastically impact a person's life trajectory in countless detrimental ways. Previous research suggests that meditation is an ideal treatment for ADHD.  Practicing meditation leads to decreased impulsivity, improved self-regulation and feelings of self-control. Research also suggests that the most effective approaches to treating children with ADHD are interventions involving the entire family. Clinical trials are essential to discover the effectiveness of our program for families with children with ADHD.

Diagnostic Characteristic of ADHD:

Effect of Meditation:


Inability to attend to  details.

Improved executive functioning (alerting and orienting to details)


Difficulty sustaining attention in tasks or play activities.

Increased attention regulation


Not seeming to listen when spoken to directly.

Increased expressive attention


Not following through on instructions and failing to finish schoolwork, chores, or duties in the workplace.

Increased motivation and ability to follow through on projects


Difficulty organizing tasks and activities

Increased planning and organizing


Avoiding or being reluctant to engage in tasks that require sustained mental effort

Increased ability to sustain mental effort


Losing things necessary for tasks or activities

Improved organizational skills


Easily distracted by extraneous stimuli

Increased selective (visual) attention scores; Decreased distractibility


Forgetful in daily activities

Increase in working memory


Fidgeting with hands or feet or squirming in seat

Increased behavioral regulation


Leaving seat in classroom or in other situations in which remaining seated is expected

Reduced problem behavior; Decreased impulsivity


Feeling restless

Reduced anxiety


Difficulty playing or engaging in leisure activities quietly

Increased health-promoting effects


“On the go”, or acting as if “driven by a motor”

Increased sleep quality


Talking excessively

Decreased problems associated with social skills


Blurts out answers before questions have been completed

Decreased impulsivity


Difficulty waiting or taking turns

Improved self-control


Interrupts or intrudes upon others

Improved self-regulation

Why it might work:  Testimonials to-date;

"Since using your meditation, my son has been sleeping better through the night.  Now the whole family is sleeping better."  - Mother of 10 year old boy.

"My daughter was part of the study with Children's Hospital in DC that used your relaxation tapes when drawing blood.  She has a lot of anxiety with blood draws and the audio she heard made it much easier to relax and have it done.  I was wondering if I could purchase one for when she has subsequent blood draws." -  Father of young girl.

"Wow! I can see everything so much more clearly now. "  - 8 year old meditation student.
"Mommy, when can we do the breathing exercises? " - 5 year old step-son of a woman taking meditation classes.
"I made Dean's list this semester! " - 20 year old student with ADHD, after completing a meditation program with Dr. Norris.


The Plan:

Audio meditation recordings will be designed, produced and distributed to 100 families across the country who will be tested before and after an 8 week period in order to determine the specific effects of practicing the meditation program.


What We Need & What You Get

PROPOSED BUDGET –where is the money going?

  • Audio production
  • Graphic and web design
  • CD and Booklet production
  • Domestic and international distribution
  • Indiegogo fee: 10% of funded project
  • Rest assured, every penny will go into making this the best project possible, and bringing it to the most people. If we exceed our goal, funds will go not only to the impending research project, but making the product available after the study has been published.


The Impact

Individuals who practice meditation find that they develop better focus and ability to pay attention.  Researchers report dramatic reductions in stress, anxiety and depression in children with ADHD who practice meditation. Other benefits of meditation include better social and emotional skills. Children who meditate do better in school, and have better organizational skills and ability to plan and complete their school work.  In most cases, student grades improve. Adults find that their memory improves and levels of stress or anxiety decrease, while quality of sleep improves significantly.  Finally, practicing meditation, along with healthy eating and regular exercise can have other health benefits, improving quality of life and family time.  In essence, meditation may make you and your family happier and healthier.

Source: http://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/adhd/data.html#med


Thank you for visiting!

Improved self-regulation


Why it might work:  Testimonials to-date;"Since using your meditation, my son has been sleeping better through the night.  Now the whole family is sleeping better."  - Mother of 10 year old boy.
"My daughter was part of the study with Children's Hospital in DC that 
used your relaxation tapes when drawing blood.  She has a lot of anxiety
 with blood draws and the audio she heard made it much easier to relax 
and have it done.  I was wondering if I could purchase one for when she 
has subsequent blood draws." -  Father of young girl.
"Wow! I can see everything so much more clearly now. "  - 8 year old meditation student.
"Mommy, when can we do the breathing exercises? " - 5 year old step-son of a woman taking meditation classes.
"I made Dean's list this semester! " - 20 year old student with ADHD, after completing a meditation program with Dr. Norris.


The Plan:
Audio meditation recordings will be designed, produced and distributed to 100 families across the country who will be tested before and after an 8 week period in order to determine the specific effects of practicing the meditation program.

What We Need & What You Get


PROPOSED
BUDGET –where is the money going?

Audio production
Graphic and web design
CD and Booklet production
Domestic and international
     distribution
Indiegogo fee: 10% of funded
     project


Rest assured, every penny will go into making this the
     best project possible, and bringing it to the most people. If we exceed our goal, funds will go not only to the impending research project, but making the product available after the study has been published.



The ImpactIndividuals who practice meditation find 
that they develop better focus and ability to pay attention.  Researchers report dramatic reductions in stress, anxiety and depression in children with ADHD who practice meditation. Other 
benefits of meditation include better social and emotional skills. Children who 
meditate do better in school, and have better organizational skills and 
ability to plan and complete their school work.  In most cases, student 
grades improve. Adults find that their memory improves and levels of 
stress or anxiety decrease, while quality of sleep improves 
significantly.  Finally, practicing meditation, along with healthy 
eating and regular exercise can have other health benefits, improving 
quality of life and family time.  In essence, meditation may make you 
and your family happier and healthier.


Source: http://www.cdc.gov/ncbddd/adhd/data.html#med
Thank you for visiting!

story:
Short Summary: I am Margaret Harrison, NC Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist

Down in the dumps?  Want to feel better?  Can't afford to go to the counselor but can swing $5.00?  This book is full of my favorite, most effective counseling wisdom that will help you take your life back!  It works for me every day, and I am confident it will work for you!  

  • 11 Reasons I Wrote this Book For YOU!  I wrote this book for you because YOU:

    1.  Hate the idea of going to a counselor but want to know what goes on in there.

    2.  Are feeling too blah to call for an appointment.

    3.  Can’t afford a counselor, but can afford $5.00 for a book.

    4.   Are looking for the simple truth about how to get better.

    5.  Are scared that there is something irreparably wrong with you.

    6.  Are tired of psychological mumbo-jumbo that makes the simple complicated.

    7.  Think an expert is someone who tells you something you already know in a way you can’t understand!

    8.  I wrote this book to give you hope!

    9.  I wrote this book because a word picture is better than a thousand words!

    10.  I wrote this book because I have been mangled by many therapists. ;-|

    11.   I wrote this book because I get to see miracles!

  •  I'm a Marriage and Family Therapist in fulltime private practice in the Winston-Salem NC area with 30 years counseling experience (last 12 in private practice.): http://therapists.psychologytoday.com/rms/750 

    I am passionate about counseling and coaching families, couples, and adults to use their strengths to find their own best solutions! 

    Training and credentials:  Masters degree in Counseling from Wake Forest University (1982), Postmasters in Marriage Family Counseling (UNCG 2001) Licensed Professional Counselor (NC license #3768) Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (NC license #935).

    This book will bring solutions to many more folks than I can possibly see in my office!

  • Let's get the help to folks who need it and can't afford it!!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money you contribute will publish, illustrate, and promote my book Howtogetbetternow.  Breakdown of funds:  $1,200.00 for professional formatting of interior and cover through Createspace, $500.00 for illustrations (artist Jennifer Edwards), $500.00 for proofreading, $800.00 for initial advertising.  Total = $3,000. 
  • The fun Perks you will receive for your generosity are your personalized signed copies of Howtogetbetternow presented to you at book kickoff party (or mailed to you), limited edition reproductions of my watercolors (http://www.mharrison.com, click on prints for sale-be sure to click on small pics to enlarge), and live (free) individual phone coaching sessions with me.
  • The funds will be used in the order that I have presented them above. 

The Impact

  •  You'll help deliver the complicated concepts of mental health in a down-to earth manner (like I do in my counseling practice.)  Folks like you (and me) just need help getting over the "hump" so we can get back to  living our best life now!
  • Risks & Challenges
  • You're showing your faith in me and my track record by contributing to this  campaign.  I'm used to hard work and perserverance and like to build things from scratch.  I began my counseling private practice 12 years ago with 1 client.  That client became 2, then 3.  Folks paid out of pocket first. Now I am on most major insurance panels and see 25-30 clients a week. 
  • I also taught myself to paint when my children were young and have been selling originals and limited edition reproductions through my website mharrison.com for 25 years.  One of your contribution perks is some of the art from this website. 
  • I'll put this same kind of effort into building a community of Howtogetbetternow folks who help each other and move us all towards fulfilling our life dreams and living our best lives NOW! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, get the word out and make some noise about Howtogetbetternow!  Please share on FB, friends, family, co-workers!  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
