story:
Watching him take a break from destroying yet another opponent, we wondered... How come
the role-model of clean sportsmanship drinks his water from a cheap plastic bottle?
 
All athletes, from amateur to professional, know the benefits of a squeezable bottle. It allows for one-handed, fast and precise drinking. Keeping distraction to a minimum and yourself in full focus.
 
 

 

However, up until now all squeezable bottles were made of plastic. Which comes with a lot of disadvantages: Potential health risks, a throw-away mentality and most of all BAD TASTE. Roger knows what we’re talking about. Stale and flat water, contaminated by plasticisers and softeners.

When even the greatest among us have to sacrifice purity and fresh taste for mere functionality, something needs to be changed.After all, next to our willpower, water is the main thing that keeps our body going.

 

As the first of it’s kind, KEEGO fuses all the benefits of a light and squeezable plastic bottle with the clean taste and endurance of a metal one.Allowing you to fully focus on your performance with a precise water stream and good flow-rate. While keeping your water pure and healthy.

 

 

You’ve got high-tech shoes, shirt and a high-tech bike. Why not a high-tech bottle?

 

 

                                                      

 

 

We are striving for excellence to create the perfect bottle for every athlete. Not only does KEEGO fit the bottle cage of every bicycle – thanks to its ergonomic shape, light weight and ideal flow-rate, it is a perfect fit for any athlete, who knows the true value of full focus.

 

 

 

 

 

This is where you come in. We are here on Indiegogo because we need your support to buy the tools and materials for our first production run. Help us bring the world's first squeezable metal bottle to life and you will be richly rewarded!

KEEGO comes in 3 colours. You can choose your own mix of colours at the check out.

 

 

 

A true champion always goes the extra mile – that’s why we offer some extras for your KEEGO bottle. All add ons can be selected after the Indiegogo campaign and before shipping.

 

 

 

 

How can titanium be elastic? The secret behind KEEGO’s functionality lies within the ground-breaking production process, which allows us to add an elastic core to a titanium bottle. The key is to accurately control the fusion process in order to modulate the elasticity according to the amount of stress in different parts of the squeeze bottle. By the way: The Danish company mastering this process is renowned for producing accelerator parts for CERN and other accelerators around the world.

 

 

 

 

Every evolution is a story of trial and error. It took us some time to find the right technology and a fitting design for our bottle – more or less two years of intense research and testing. In this time our prototypes have come a long way. See for yourself...

 

 

 

 

 

Lukas Angst - Pacemaker

Robert Vierlinger - Product Design

René Bang Madsen - Material Development

Florence Forbach - Product and Brand Design

Hieronymus Kloss - Concept and Text

Christian Melzer - Campaign Management

Wolfgang Gumpelmaier-Mach - Crowdfunding Consultant

               

 

In case you want to write about KEEGO, we have assembled a Press-Kit containing all the important info about the evolution of the sports bottle. Should you need any additional input, please do not hesitate to contact us at pioneers@keego.at

A big Thank You to our existing supporter

Risks and challenges

KEEGO has come a long way: We have a functioning prototype, the contracts with our manufacturers are sewn up and there is a clear and reliable plan for what's coming. Of course, one has to be aware that the production process of a KEEGO bottle is highly scientific and involves dealing with very small tolerances and a lot of variables. So, upscaling the production will come with a lot of challenges. Since we are not willing to sacrifice product quality for quick results, this may result in a delay of the final delivery. But thanks to our highly professional production partners we are convinced the world's first squeezable metal bottle will be delivered to you without any shortcomings.

But thanks to our highly professional production partners we are convinced the world's first squeezable metal bottle will be delivered to you without any shortcomings.

story:
Our Story

At age 43, I had double hip replacements due to congenital hip dysplasia.  As an athlete competing in sports throughout my life, including wrestling in college, I have always been a fitness enthusiast.  The 5 years prior to my hip replacement surgeries were enormously painful on my joints due to lack of mobility.  My desire to “get back in the game” and find a complete fitness solution was what ultimately inspired this product.   My vision of creating a universal piece of fitness equipment that INTEGRATED stretching with a full-body workout came to fruition with our invention of the XFlex360.  

In addition to XFlex Fitness, I am the Owner and CEO of Saletta Leadership, a consulting, training, and speaking company dedicated to leadership, sales, and strategy.   The companies that I have owned have trained more than 10,000 organizations around the world directly impacting more than 250,000 individuals.    

My partners, James and Christopher Mortensen, are the engineering masterminds behind the patented XFlex360 design.  James Mortensen is a genius engineer and 3D Graphic Designer that relentlessly pursued structural and artistic perfection on this project.  His son, Christopher Mortensen is also a master engineer and expert welder, as well as a production specialist.  Together they created a versatile, space-saving, collapsible, and expandable (18 accessories and growing) piece of fitness equipment that is unparalleled in the workout world.  


But please don't just take our word for it... Here is a leading authority on the design and real marketability of fitness equipment.  Colleen Szot is touted as one of the top informercial writers in the world.  She wrote informercials for wildly successful products like NordicTrack and the George Foreman Grill.  Here are her words:

I want to e-introduce you to Michael Saletta, who I think has the next blockbuster Total Gym/Fluidity product to come to the market.
I see thousands of new fitness products come across my desk every week. Most of them are over- or under-engineered, aimed at a very limited niche market, or have a poor cost of goods to price ratio. That is NOT the case with Michael's innovative XFlex machine.
I know the importance of stretching as part of an overall fitness program, yet most people don't. So imagine a cardio and resistance workout that has stretching built right into it...no matter what your age - 8 or 80 - no matter what your fitness level - athlete or wheelchair warrior - everyone stretches. This product is an amazing machine that automatically begins the stretching motion while it flexes, builds and shapes your muscles, including the most important muscle of all - your heart!
There hasn't been a real competitor to the Total Gym in years - I honestly think the XFlex360 could be it.
~Colleen Szot
The XFlex360 seamlessly integrates stretching WITH building muscles, working your core, and enhancing cardio.  One machine with unlimited workout possibilities has been ergonomically engineered to engage the user to stretch, flex, shape and build their body from every angle and direction. It's time for stretching, bodyweight, strength and cardio training to be combined into the same workout.   It’s the one-stop solution for complete total body fitness! 

Why We Need Your Support

This crowdfunding campaign will enable us to ramp up manufacturing and offer the XFlex360 to homes, gyms, dance studios, MMA gyms, CrossFit gyms, sport teams, physical therapy offices, and multitude of other fitness centers.   The funds raised with your support will go directly to the production of the XFlex360.  

  • Each machine is meticulously crafted with the highest quality standards
  • Numerous accessories have been developed and the list is growing (See below for a sample of current and future accessories)
  • Made in the USA

The Impact of Your Support

Fitness is our PASSION!  Our passion is to provide a comprehensive fitness machine that is adaptable to anyone's level of fitness.  We will never compromise quality and functionality.  We are relentless in creation of new accessories and will be open to your feedback.  Please join us in launching the XFlex360!  

Risks

Some have said the $1500 is above their budget.  We are not here to judge anyone's financial situation, but we are certain that the versatility of the XFlex360 makes our machine the absolute biggest bang for your buck!  When you consider the unlimited stretching angles, the body weight training, the core training, the strength training, the resistant training, the attachment capabilities, etc. -- the XFlex360 is unparalleled in its function for a complete fitness solution.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, we would greatly appreciate your willingness to spread the word!  Please share this site and like us on Facebook.  Thank you!

Assembly Video - It's Collapsible!



Weight Storage Rack Accessory


Squat/Bench Safety Rack Accessory

MMA Accessory (coming soon)


Expanded Squat/Bench Rack (coming soon)

Roman Chair (coming soon)


Balance Board Accessory (coming soon)

Cardio Stepper (coming soon)

Benefits


PERKS

Embroidered Hat

T-Shirt (Men's and Women's available)

Resistance Bands

Bodyweight Workout Series of 10 Videos

TRX Straps (plus above Resistance Bands and Workout Video Series)


XFlex360 

(BTW, The design is based on the Golden Ratio... and it's okay to Google "Golden Ratio" ;)


XFlex360 Complete (Does not include bench or barbell; will include resistance bands above)


XFlex360 Quad


The Making of XFlex360


Production Disclaimer:  XFlex360 is pre-production and is subject to refinements and enhancements.

 Some have said the $1500 is above their budget.  We are not here to judge anyone's financial situation, but we are certain that the versatility of the XFlex360 makes our machine the absolute biggest bang for your buck!  When you consider the unlimited stretching angles, the body weight training, the core training, the strength training, the resistant training, the attachment capabilities, etc. -- the XFlex360 is unparalleled in its function for a complete fitness solution.  
    Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't contribute, we would greatly appreciate your willingness to spread the word!  Please share this site and like us on Facebook.  Thank you!

story: Our friend Roy has been diagnosed with kidney cancer. This sucks balls. He is to get surgery in the coming weeks to get his kidney removed. He currently sits on a shitty kitchen chair to game on (how we know him) and he really can't afford a new one. Therefore, we will get him a truly bitching chair so that he can use his computer after his surgery!

story:
Blake Arnold is 8 months old and was recently Diagnosed with a very rare cancer. He has an Extra Renal Rhabdoid tumor that is 11.1cm in size, and currently there are less then 15 cases a year in the us. The rarity of this cancer makes it harder to treat, but they are going with what they believe is the best treatment they know for it. The Arnold family attends our church, Highpoint Christian Church in Clinton Ohio and Lives in Canal Fulton Ohio. We are asking for lots and lots of prayers for this Family.
 
(10-9-2012) the MRI showed that there are cancer cells lining the brain and there is fluid/pressure in his brain. Left pupil is larger than right this morning...so now he is in surgery having a ventricle-paritineal shunt put in place that will be in his brain to release the pressure. They are also going to do a bone biopsy to see if any cancer cells are there. Our oncologist is doing all he can and contacting others from all over the world to come up with a new chemo plan. Usually with the type of tumor that he has it does not go to the brain...but his did and there is no literature on how to treat it. We are having a tremendously hard time dealing with this. Thank you all for your support/love/prayers
 
 (10-10-2012) Blake will start a new chemo medicine that is very harsh and try to kill the cancer cells in the brain. Chemo in the brain does not mix since the brains job is to fight off everything. Only certain chemo meds can~ so please pray that he can at least be comfortable today♥ thank you
 
 (10-11-2012) Baby Blakes Cancer Cells are spreading RAPIDLY... PLEASE PRAY
 
(10-15-2012) His Mom, Natalie Moore-Arnold said he had a good day yesterday and they cherished it....
He was able to drink 1/2 oz of water (hasn't been able to swallow) and was excited to do so. Also, Blake loves listening to music and watching baby Einstein. He is still fighting hard. If you believe, you will receive whatever you ask for in prayer. Matthew 21:22
See More
 
I am taking it upon myself to try and help support and raise money for this church family and help to get them the money they need for the best treatment possible to beat the odds for baby Blake
ANY amount will help even just $10 can add up, and if you cant help financially PLEASE PRAY for baby Blake

story:
HELLO MY NAME IS JOHN REVELIN,  I SURVIVED THE IMPOSSIBLE!  LIVING WITH A CHILDHOOD BRAIN TUMOR FROM THE AGE OF 4 TO 21 (UNTIL MY  BRAIN CANCER REMOVAL/SURGERY.)  I SURVIVED THAT TOO.  THEN I SURVIVED 7 YEARS OF EXTREMELY PAINFUL PHYSICAL THERAPY.

SOON AFTER THE MAIN SURGERY I "CRASHED" AND I FELL INTO A COMA.   WHEN I WOKE UP EVERYTHING WAS FOREIGN TO ME.  MY MEMORIES OF THE  BASIC/NATURAL ACTIONS THAT I LEARNED HOW TO DO IN LIFE WERE GONE.  FOR A LONG TIME I COULD NOT EVEN MOVE, BREATHE, THINK, TALK, WALK, SEE, OR HEAR.  NOW I CAN!

NOWADAYS ( 7 YEARS AFTER THE SURGERY) I SPEND EVERY MON-FRI DOING EXTREMELY PAINFULL EXERCISES + STRETCHES IN PT.    I AM CURRENTLY UNDER MEDICARE, BUT I WANT TO START A BUSINES/WEBSITE OF MY OWN SO I CAN AFFORD ALL MY FUTURE EXPENSES FOR THE REST OF MY LIFE. MY SITE WILL COLLECT IDEAS TO HELP US "FIGHT" OFF POLLUTION, RADIATION DAMAGE,WEATHER, TERRORIST ACTIONS, etc.

I AM ASKING FOR TEN K TO HELP ME PAY FOR MY  EXPENSES AND TO START UP MY SITE.  I AM NOT THE TYPE OF PERSON THAT TAKES "HAND-OUTS", BUT WHEN YOU ARE EXTREMELY DISABLED AND IN PAIN, YOU HAVE NO OTHER CHOICE.  I'M FAR TOO DISABLED TO START FROM SCRATCH AND WORK FOR A LIVING.  I REALLY NEED HELP WITH MY PATH TO THE FUTURE.  PLEASE HELP.

 

SINCERELY JPR

story:
My name is STOJAN Kolarov from Novi Sad (Vojvodina, Serbia)
I suffer from rare diseases called MUCOPOLYSACCHARIDOSIS type 4 (sy Morquio) The consequences of the underlying disease are deficient and abnormal development of bone and articular-muscular apparatus. I'm  105cm height.
That`s because I now have a wheelchair (up to a few years ago I walked and rode a bike without the extra help).

Because of the extreme narrowing of the spinal canal in the neck part of the spine (vertebra C1) operation is necessary  in that particular part of the spine to prevent further compression of the spinal cord. That means -  the end for me.


Otherwise I am a student of web design  - a final year (I passed all the exams and in September 2012 defending my Graduate work). It is very important for me to graduate, then I hope to perform the operation, and after that I plan and will devote myself to my work (I hope to work in this profession, and despite all the problems facing in this country, and the whole attitude towards the disabled).

I will have surgery on October 2012th (this year) in Paris

by the Prof. Dr. Michael Zerah 

http://fr.linkedin.com/pub/michel-zerah/37/655/502
 as there have been a few experts with experience with this rare disease. In addition, the conditions in our, serbian  healthcare is at a very low level.

In order to carry out the operation it is necessary to secure funding for the operation in France, and the means to stay in Paris (My companion is my father), and we can not afford  them. I live with my father (retired),  my mother died in a car accident. We just don`t have enough money to pay and go to the surgery.

For this reason I want to start this humanitarian action  and thanks in advance  to all the people of good heart for the help !

read more about
http://kolarovstojan.in.rs/


more about the dissease
http://www.healthimaginghub.com/medical-imaging-radiology-education-cme/radiology-teaching-files/237-mucopolysaccharidosis.html

my  facebook group page
https://www.facebook.com/groups/252222331563633/

story:
Short Summary

“I developed OnePure products because I wanted Muslims around the world to have the choice of halal- certified beauty products that were chic, effective and luxurious.” Layla Mandi

Layla Mandi the founder and CEO of the first luxury Halal cosmetics company www.onepurebeauty.com has been in a tragic accident breaking her neck, resulting in incomplete c5 quadrapelegia, her body and legs have been paralyzed. It IS possible for Layla to have a normal life again and be an inspiration and community leader around the world but it will take time, up to a year, of intensive therapy-it is very expensive and Sister Layla needs you to help to assist with her recovery. 

What We Need

Specific immediate urgent costs Layla needs help with:

Physiotherapy minimum 3 hours a day @$150 hour 6x a week = $10, 530 monthly 

Help with Layla Mandi's medical debt $76,000 total 

Medical furniture $ 40,000 total 

Transportation vehicle $57, 000 The MV-1 is the first factory-built, wheelchair friendly vehicle on the market( pic link http://mobile.mv1canada.com/ )

Nurse specialist in spinal cord recovery$4,000 monthly

Nutritional meals and supplements $3,500 monthly

Medications and supplies $2,900 monthly

According to National Spinal Cord Injury Statistical Center (NSCISC), Many would categorize SCI as one of the greatest survivable catastrophes experienced by a human being. The associated economic burden of SCI is substantial, due not only to direct health care costs, but also to high rates of physical morbidity and premature mortality that have an impact on productivity at a societal level. Estimated Average Yearly Expenses

Severity of Injury First YearEach Subsequent Year Low Tetraplegia (C5-C8) $712,308$105,013 

The Impact

Sister Layla fell from a small porch, resulting in a c5 anterior spinal contusion on December 12, 2011 while overseas working on a presentation for the launch a Halal cosmetics division for Brunei.
Layla Mandi was admitted to the hospital to undergo surgery and intensive rehabilitation.

The neurosurgeon in Thailand who operated on Miss Mandi said she can walk in 3 months if she gets intensive therapy. Understanding Miss Mandi's frustration the neurosurgeon in Canada apologized for the lack of treatment she has received in Canada and referred her to a rehabilitation clinic in the USA. Physiotherapists feel positive that with intensive therapy she can learn to walk again:)

Without your help and intensive rehabilitation Layla Mandi will never walk again regardless how determined she is.

Layla recently said " I pray to be able to get up and walk so I can have a shower, continue the work I love and have a family" Imagine if this happened to you! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations can be made by bank transfer, direct bank deposit, or Paypal help@laylamandi.com
Bank transfer: Emirates islamic bank
Account: 0046234028001
Iban AE810340000046234028001
Swift MEBLEAD,
Dubai
 
Td CanadaTrust
ParalyzedLife
Layla Mandi Tayeb
13282 004 05385220879
Swift TDOMCATTTOR
IBn 026009593

story:
Through our own personal experiences and those around us, we have noticed that many people lack the awareness of the way alcohol impacts the body. In order to alleviate this problem we have created the X-hale smartphone breathalyzer, an easy to use and versatile unit that gives the power of knowledge and awareness to its users. X-hale is perfect for a night out at the clubs, happy hour after a long day, or even a night at home with friends.

The X-hale breathalyzer has a sleek design that makes it appealing to all audiences and the range of available colors makes it perfect for any lifestyle. X-hale comes in Arctic White, Cobalt Blue, Midnight Black, or Fierce Orange (Limited Edition). Along with the unit, our Indiegogo backers will receive a carrying case that can be easily attached to a key-chain, or stowed away in a pocket or purse. 

Although we have a working prototype, a finalized design, and a production channel ready; we need your support to fund our initial production run. With the money we receive from our Indiegogo campaign, we will invest in a production run that will not only help us fulfill the Indiegogo rewards but also give us the necessary capital to produce further units for sale to the general public. Our goal is to get X-hale breathalyzers in every adult's hands to ensure that everyone makes smarter drinking decisions. 

 

 

Once the device is plugged into an iPhone or Android smartphone, the accompanying app will provide simple on-screen instructions in order to get an accurate B.A.C. result. Users will be able to access previous B.A.C. results through our easy to use and intuitive app.. Another optional feature available on the app is to get daily facts/figures related to alcohol effects and use. 

 

 

 

Below are the current screenshots of our app. We would love to hear feedback from you on things to change, add, or remove. After all, our users will be the ones using this app, and we would like to provide them with a pleasant experience.

 

 

Risks and Challenges

Even though we have been working tirelessly to ensure that the product is at its final stages, there are certain factors that are outside our control. Using the capital raised through Indiegogo, our goal is to make sure our production channel is as streamlined as possible. This will help us ensure a lower production cost and conversely, a lower sale price. Another risk, although not a big one, is to ensure that we get approval from Apple's app store for our free app. We also need to further test our product against as many apple products as possible to ensure that it is compatible. Although we have tested our product numerous times, we would like to continue testing to ensure total reliability and accuracy before we start production.

story:
Update: This is a multiple-target campaign which has reached its first target and now we are collecting for our second target : $79,000. 

You only need a credit card to contribute to this page. If you prefer to contribute through a bank transfer directly to the hospital (especially for larger amounts), please email me at ruwayna@gmail.com and I can provide you with the account info.


-------------------

Hello friends, friends of friends and strangers. My name is Ruwayna and I am launching this campaign to help raise funds for a life-saving bone marrow transplant for my friend Mona Abulhassan. 

 

As many of you already know almost 3 years ago in her mid-20s Mona was diagnosed with Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia type T. Since then, she has been defeating, struggling and overcome by this disease and is now urgently in need of a bone-marrow transplant. She has received most of her treatment in Cairo, Egypt but is now receiving treatment in London, England because the necessary drugs are not available in Cairo. Soon, we hope, she will be receiving a transplant. She has no matches in her family, and so the type of procedure she has to undergo can only be performed abroad (Egypt does not do the transplant for unrelated donors). There is no insurance to cover these costs so her family has been funding this through personal savings and grants.

 

Medical costs are constantly building up and after almost 3 years of treatment, you can imagine what kinds of hurdles those costs have become. I think that as a global community: Egypt, the Gulf, North America, Europe, Asia, perhaps even some of you down-under; we can help Mona and her family keep up with the finances necessary for her treatment, and make this journey a little less over-whelming.

 

What We Need

Please send what you can, all you need is a credit card and a few minutes. Whether it's 20$, or 20,000$, I assure you it all adds up. You can also send money by bank transfer directly to the hospital in England. Email me at ruwayna@gmail.com for the account info.

 

These are the costs that need to be covered: 

1-  10,000GBP ($15,800) This is the amount necessary in the next few days / weeks to cover a recent hospitalisation expense for an infection that has fortunately been cured.

2-  50,000GBP ($79,000) This amount is needed to cover the latest chemotherapy costs.


The transplant costs more than this, over 100,000 British pounds, but some of the costs have already been collected and I have decided to start with these immediate goals first.

 

These kinds of figures seemed huge to me when I first heard them, but I have discovered over the last few months through other fund-raising initiatives that anything is possible. So this website is only one of multiple avenues for fundraising, there are others. For now, let's reach the first goal of 15,800$ ... If we can meet that goal, we'll step up to the next one, then the next.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

1 - Ask your friends, families and co-workers. You can even start your own small collect then send the lump sum on their behalf.

2-  Leave a comment on this page after you donate, especially if you know Mona or her family personally.

3 - Spread the word through social media - facebook, emails.

4 - If you have campaigning ideas, contact me! ruwayna@gmail.com

5 - Visit this facebook page if you are in Egypt to learn about a campaign to find Mona a donor: https://www.facebook.com/groups/135928706477206/


A Little Bit About Mona

Mona was raised in Doha, Qatar then moved back to her hometown, Cairo in her teenage years. Mona studied philosophy in university, but like many graduates of this department, eventually found herself working in another field, and found a passion in the field of media and visual arts. She started her career working for a Cairo-based production agency, then became a freelance producer, mainly for news and documentaries.  As her experience grew she became concerned with the need and ability of audiences to analyze media production and narration. As a volunteer, and a philosopher still, she was regularly involved in organizing and facilitating projects that help youth develop a critical literacy of media and visual representation. 


By helping Mona regain her full health you are supporting a wonderful sister and friend, and also helping her continue this work. Thank you for your contributions and for helping us spread the word.


Team Matching Mona.

------------


نحن مجموعة من الأصدقاء نحاول جمع تبرعات لتغطية تكاليف عملية زرع نخاع لصديقتنا منى ابو الحسن. منى اصيبت  بمرض اللوكيميا (سرطان الدم) الليمافاوية الحادة منذ ٣ سنوات و منذ هذا الحين و هى تحاول التخلص من هذا المرض عن طريق العلاجات المختلفة. يرى الأطباء أن المرحلة الأتية اللازمة لعلاجها هو تلقيها عملية زرع نخاع  و لكن هذه العملية مكلفة للغاية  مع العلم أن تكاليف المستشفى و العلاج الكيماوى ، التى إضطرت منى أن تتلقاه بإنجلترا لعدم توفر ما تحتاجه فى مصر، قد وضعت عبئ رهيب على عائلة منى فى غياب أى تآمين طبى ومع الإْعتماد على المدخرات التى اوشكت علي النفاذ.

نحن على أمل فى أننا نستطيع جميعاَ كمجتمع عالمى أن نساعد منى و عائلتها على تغطية النفقات اللازمة للعلاج والشفاء من هذا المرض إن شاء الله..


كل مساهمة ، مهما صغر أو كبر حجمها، ستقربنا من هدفنا أكثر و أكثر . كل ما تحتاجونه للتبرع  من خلال هذا الموقع هو كارت إئتمان ولكن يمكنكم أيضاَ التبرع عن طريق تحويل بنكى مباشر للمستشفى التى تتعالج بها منى فى إنجلترا. يمكنكم معرفة البيانات اللازمة للتحويل عن طريق إرسال بريد إليكترونى إلى 
: ruwayna@gmail.com
 
النفقات التى نهدف إلى تغطيتها عن طريق التبرعات:
١. عشرة ألاف جنيه إسترلينى (١٥،٨٠٠ دولار). هذه أكثر النفقات إلحاحاَ و تمثل تكلفة إدخال منى المستشفى لعلاجها من عدوى أصابتها مؤخراَ،  و التى نحن  شاكرون لشفائها منها. 
٢. خمسون ألف جنيه إسترلينى ) ٧٩،٠٠٠ دولار) و هذا لتغطية نفقات العلاج الكيماوى

عملية زرع النخاع ستتكلف أكثر من مائة ألف جنيه إسترلينى و لكننا  قررنا أن نحقق الأهداف السابق ذكرها أولاَ مع العلم أن هذه الحملة إحدى الوسائل التى نقوم بها بجمع التبرعات اللازمة

طرق اخرى للمساعدة:

- إطلب من عائلتك، أصدقاءك أو زملائك بالعمل أن  يساهموا. يمكنك أنت أن تجمع التبرعات ثم ترسلها مجمعة بالنيابة عنهم -

- إترك تعليق على الموقع، خاصة إذا كنت تعرف منى أو عائلتها بصفة شخصية -

- إنشر هذه الحملة على  مواقع التواصل الإجتماعى آو عن طريق البريد الإلكترونى -

-  ruwayna@gmail.com إذا كانت لديك آفكار لطرق أخرى لجمع التبرعات، الرجاء مشاركتها على - 

إذا كنت فى مصر قم بزيارة صفحة حملة البحث عن متبرع نخاع ملائم لمنى - 

 https://www.facebook.com/ 

نبذة عن منى

نشأت منى بالدوحة، قطر، وعادت إلى مسقط رأسها، القاهرة، في مرحلة المراهقة.  تخرجت من الجامعة بعدما درست الفلسفة لكن انتهى بها الأمر، مثلها في ذلك مثل الكثير من خريجي القسم، بالعمل في مجال آخر. ومع التجربة العملية، وجدت في نفسها ميلا  للإعلام والفنون البصرية. وقد بدأت بالعمل لحساب شركة إنتاج بالقاهرة، ثم أصبحت منتجة حرة في مجالي الأخبار والأفلام الوثائقية. ومع اكتسابها المزيد من الخبرة، تبينت لها حاجة الجمهور إلى مهارات تحليل المواد والروايات الإعلامية . لذا شاركت بانتظام، بوصفها متطوعة وبروح دارسة الفلسفة، في تنظيم وتيسير مشروعات تساعد  الشباب على تكوين وعي نقدي إزاء المواد الإعلامية والبصرية 

إنكم بمساعدتكم لمنى على استرداد كامل عافيتها، تساندون اختا وصديقة رائعة، وتساعدونها أيضا على مواصلة عملها هذا. نشكر لكم مساهمتكم ومساعدتكم لنا على نشر هذا النداء
story_txt:
Update: This is a multiple-target campaign which has reached its first target and now we are collecting for our second target : $79,000. You only need a credit card to contribute to this page. If you prefer to contribute through a bank transfer directly to the hospital (especially for larger amounts), please email me at ruwayna@gmail.com and I can provide you with the account info.-------------------Hello
friends, friends of friends and strangers. My name is Ruwayna and I am
launching this campaign to help raise funds for a life-saving bone
marrow transplant for my friend Mona Abulhassan. 
 
As
many of you already know almost 3 years ago in her mid-20s Mona was diagnosed
with Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia type T. Since then, she has
been defeating, struggling and overcome by this disease and is now urgently in
need of a bone-marrow transplant. She has received most of her treatment in
Cairo, Egypt but is now receiving treatment in London, England because the
necessary drugs are not available in Cairo. Soon, we hope, she will be
receiving a transplant. She has no matches in her family, and so the type of
procedure she has to undergo can only be performed abroad (Egypt does not do
the transplant for unrelated donors). There is no insurance to cover these
costs so her family has been funding this through personal savings and grants.
 
Medical
costs are constantly building up and after almost 3 years of treatment, you can
imagine what kinds of hurdles those costs have become. I think that as a global
community: Egypt, the Gulf, North America, Europe, Asia, perhaps even some of you
down-under; we can help Mona and her family keep up with the finances necessary
for her treatment, and make this journey a little less over-whelming. 
What We Need
Please
send what you can, all you need is a credit card and a few minutes. Whether
it's 20$, or 20,000$, I assure you it all adds up. You can also send money by bank transfer directly to the hospital in England. Email me at ruwayna@gmail.com for the account info.
 
These
are the costs that need to be covered: 
1-
 10,000GBP ($15,800) This is the amount necessary in the next few
days / weeks to cover a recent hospitalisation expense for an infection that
has fortunately been cured.
2-
 50,000GBP ($79,000) This amount is needed to cover the latest
chemotherapy costs.
The
transplant costs more than this, over 100,000 British pounds, but some of the
costs have already been collected and I have decided to start with these
immediate goals first.
 
These
kinds of figures seemed huge to me when I first heard them, but I have
discovered over the last few months through other fund-raising initiatives that
anything is possible. So this website is only one of multiple avenues for
fundraising, there are others. For now, let's reach the first goal of 15,800$
... If we can meet that goal, we'll step up to the next one, then the next.
 Other Ways You Can Help
1 -
Ask your friends, families and co-workers. You can even start your own small
collect then send the lump sum on their behalf.
2-  Leave a comment on this page after you donate, especially if you know Mona or her family personally.
3 -
Spread the word through social media - facebook, emails.
4 -
If you have campaigning ideas, contact me! ruwayna@gmail.com
5 -
Visit this facebook page if you are in Egypt to learn about a campaign to find
Mona a donor: https://www.facebook.com/groups/135928706477206/A Little Bit About MonaMona was raised in Doha, Qatar then moved back to her hometown, Cairo in her teenage years. Mona studied philosophy in university, but like many graduates of this department, eventually found herself working in another field, and found a passion in the field of media and visual arts. She started her career working for a Cairo-based production agency, then became a freelance producer, mainly for news and documentaries.  As her experience grew she became concerned with the need and ability of audiences to analyze media production and narration. As a volunteer, and a philosopher still, she was regularly involved in organizing and facilitating projects that help youth develop a critical literacy of media and visual representation. By helping Mona regain her full health you are supporting a wonderful sister and friend, and also helping her continue this work. Thank you for your contributions and for helping us spread the word.Team Matching Mona.------------

story:
My Story

Hi!  This February, I am going to be starting a Kiva fellowship in Nairobi, Kenya and I need your help funding this unpaid volunteer fellowship.  Kiva is a non-profit organization whose mission is to connect people, through lending, for the sake of alleviating poverty.  To learn more about Kiva, check out http://nessainkenya.wordpress.com/about/ and http://www.kiva.org/about. 


For the next four months, I will be working with three of Kiva's field partners in Nairobi to help maximize Kiva's effectiveness and to increase the number of loans given out to students and entrepreneurs in Kenya.  I will be working with Strathmore University,  Faulu Kenya and SMEP.  My work with these three organizations will help to ensure that more Kenyans are able to attend university and that more entrepreneurs will be able to start or improve their businesses.  Support my fellowship and be a part of the microfinance solution!


So, how did a girl from Queens, NY become interested in dedicating 4-12 months of her life to Kiva and microfinance?  Good question!  I first became interested in microfinance and the concepts of peer lending while volunteering with a program called Young Women Enterprising Women (YWEW) at the YWCA in downtown Pittsburgh while at Carnegie Mellon University.  YWEW gave low and middle income women the tools they needed to start their own businesses through an entrepreneurial class and access to a peer lending group.  Witnessing the empowerment that comes with increased access to credit, I became convinced that entrepreneurship and microfinance can enable any individual to improve their life.  It was not until I studied abroad in Uganda and Rwanda and learned more about microfinance that I saw its power for international development.


After graduating from Carnegie Mellon University, I taught Pre-Kindergarten in Washington D.C. through Teach for America.  Living and teaching in D.C. secured my belief that knowledge is power.  A quality education can enable anyone, regardless of situation, to improve their life trajectory.  Knowledge and a quality education are not guarantees.  Kiva, through it's partnership with Strathmore University, hopes to increase the number of people who are able to receive a quality advanced degree by offering full tuition loans to students who otherwiscape would not have had the financial capability to attend university.  I am eager to witness the power of combining microfinance and education in Nairobi.


Knowledge and education are one key part of the puzzle that is opportunity; access to credit is the next piece of this puzzle.  Faulu and SMEP are traditional microfinance institutions which offer micro loans to clients who have traditionally been left out of the financial system.  I look forward to learning a great deal from all of the organizations I will be working with, while contributing my experience and training in order to increase their potential.   


What I Will be Doing- My Impact

While in Nairobi, I will be working with three different and amazing organizations.  For the majority of my fellowship, I will be working with Strathmore University.  Strathmore is Kiva's first non-traditional partner specializing in student loans.  I will be helping Strathmore launch their Kiva program in order to offer full-tuition loans to students.  These loans will enable Kenyans, who otherwise might not have the opportunity due to financial constraints, to attend university in Nairobi.  I will be an integral part of getting this much needed program off the ground and running in order to ensure more students have access to higher education.  [http://www.strathmore.edu/News.php?NewsID=753]


In addition, I will be working with Faulu Kenya to help them serve their 250,000 clients throughout Kenya.  While working with Faulu, I will be helping to continue the strong partnership Faulu has with Kiva by getting more of their clients on Kiva.org and increasing the information that lenders receive about Faulu's borrowers and their entrepreneurial successes.  Faulu's clients range from electronics saleswomen to farmers and Faulu provides loans and financial services to meet their needs.  [http://www.kiva.org/partners/142]


Lastly, I will also working with SMEP (Small and Micro Enterprise Programme), whose main objective is to alleviate poverty by empowering those who are economically marginalized.  SMEP is one of the premier MFIs in Kenya.  SMEP's clients range from retail sales men and women to transportation providers.  I look forward to helping them best provide services to their clients and ensuring their borrowers' effective use of the loans they receive through Kiva.  [http://www.kiva.org/partners/138]


What I Need and Where Your Money is Going

Funding a fellowship does not come cheap and Nairobi is one of the more expensive capital cities in sub-Saharan Africa.  Your donations will help me offset some of the costs of doing this. The cost of moving abroad and working on a volunteer basis are expansive and include such items as:


- Airfare

-Vaccinations

-Anti-malarial drugs

-Visas

-Research Materials

-Secure Accommodation

-Food

-Communication

-Transportation

-Apparel


An example of some of the costs of the fellowship in Nairobi include:

 

- $700-$1000 for a flight home from Nairobi [my flight to Nairobi and my round trip flight to San Francisco for training were purchased using generously donated miles]

- $400-$600 for a secure roof over my head for one month

-$100-$250 for vaccinations and anti-malarial drugs

- $20-$35 a week for matatu buses and taxis to commute to and from work [only taxis are recommended to commute after dark]

- $100 entry visa into Kenya

- $30 approximate cost of cellphone minutes and internet cafes for one month


All funds raised towards my goal will be used to help lessen the personal financial burden of this fellowship.


Five Reasons Why You Should Donate to my Fellowship Funds

You may be asking yourself why you might want to donate to my fellowship, and I thought of a few pretty good reasons:


  1. I work very hard.  If you know me, you know that I am dedicated to the people I am working with and the organizations and causes I am working for. I truly believe in the transformative power microfinance holds in breaking the cycle of poverty; thus, I am driven to see the organizations I will be working with succeed.  If you don't know me, here's one example of my determination: In D.C. I taught 3,4 and five year old students everything from how to read, write, and count to how to use the bathroom and how to be good friends. If you have taught any of these things, you know how much relentless determination and patience goes into it. I will use these and all the skills I honed through teaching and past leadership experiences in order to deliver results for Kiva, Strathmore University, Faulu and SMEP in Nairobi.
  2. This is a direct way for you to be involved with my fellowship without having to personally deal with the occasional electricity shortage, bucket shower or pit latrine. You can live vicariously and safely through my blogging and know that your money helped make an impact. 
  3. Transparency and Honesty. There are many organizations out there working towards making the world a better, more just place but, when donating to these organizations, you may never know where your money is going, nor do you consistently get to see exactly what your hard earned dollars are being used for. I will be consistently documenting who your money is impacting through blogs, photos, and videos. Your money will go directly to the costs I incur through my fellowship.  It will only be used for my basic necessities, it will not be used for any additional travel or entertainment.  And if you have any questions, you know where to find me. [nessa.french@fellows.kiva.org]
  4. Incentives! I myself am a sucker for incentives/prizes so, I thought of a few things to make fundraising a bit more interesting. [see right side panel]
  5. With your support and my on the ground presence we can work together to help alleviate poverty in the developing world.

Be Involved and Stay Informed about my Fellowship!

Follow my fellowship blog at www.nessainkenya.wordpress.com !  I will be busy working with the three wonderful organizations I mentioned above, follow along!  Share my blog and this page with all your friends and family.  The more people who share this page, the more likely it will be featured on IndieGoGo's home page.

Spread the word about Kiva.org and my fellowship with Kiva!  The more people who know about the work that Kiva.org is doing to empower and help students and entrepreneurs achieve their goals of educational and financial independence, the more potential there is for success.  Lend to a borrower on kiva.org and tell your friends all about it! 

Lastly, help fund my volunteer fellowship to Nairobi.  I truly appreciate any donation you are able to make.   I believe that the work I will be doing will enable so many more people to have access to the education and the credit which they deserve.  Be a part of the microfinance solution by supporting my work in Nairobi.

I Kiva because I do not believe that the situation in which you are born should determine your entire life trajectory. Check out why some past Kiva fellows kiva:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WwLvP2wKTB4&...
story_txt:

While in Nairobi, I will be working with three different and amazing organizations.  For the majority of my fellowship, I will be working with Strathmore University.  Strathmore is Kiva's first non-traditional partner specializing in student loans.  I will be helping Strathmore launch their Kiva program in order to offer full-tuition loans to students.  These loans will enable Kenyans, who otherwise might not have the opportunity due to financial constraints, to attend university in Nairobi.  I will be an integral part of getting this much needed program off the ground and running in order to ensure more students have access to higher education.  [http://www.strathmore.edu/News.php?NewsID=753]

Lastly, I will also working with SMEP (Small and Micro Enterprise Programme), whose main objective is to alleviate poverty by empowering those 
who are economically marginalized.  SMEP is one of the premier MFIs in Kenya.  SMEP's clients range from retail sales men and women to transportation providers.  I look forward to helping them best provide services to their clients and ensuring their borrowers' effective use of the loans they receive through Kiva.  [http://www.kiva.org/partners/138] 


What I Need and Where Your Money is Going

Funding a fellowship does not come cheap and Nairobi is one of the more expensive capital cities in sub-Saharan Africa.  Your donations will help me offset some of the costs of doing this. The cost of moving abroad and working on a volunteer basis are expansive and include such items as:

- Airfare
-Vaccinations
-Anti-malarial drugs 
-Visas
-Research Materials
-Secure Accommodation
-Food
-Communication
-Transportation
-Apparel

An example of some of the costs of the fellowship in Nairobi include:
 
- $700-$1000 for a flight home from Nairobi [my flight to Nairobi and my
 round trip flight to San Francisco for training were purchased using 
generously donated miles]
- $400-$600 for a secure roof over my head for one month
-$100-$250 for vaccinations and anti-malarial drugs
- $20-$35 a week for matatu buses and taxis to commute to and from work [only taxis are recommended to commute after dark]
- $100 entry visa into Kenya
- $30 approximate cost of cellphone minutes and internet cafes for one month

All funds raised towards my goal will be used to help lessen the personal financial burden of this fellowship.

Five Reasons Why You Should Donate to my Fellowship Funds

You may be asking yourself why you might want to donate to my fellowship, and I thought of a few pretty good reasons:



I
 work very hard.  If you know me, you know that I am dedicated to the 
people I am working with and the organizations and causes I am working for. I truly 
believe in the transformative power microfinance holds in breaking the 
cycle of poverty; thus, I am driven to see the organizations I will be 
working with succeed.  If you don't know me, here's one example of my determination: In D.C. I taught 3,4 and five year old students everything from how to read, 
write, and count to how to use the bathroom and how to be good friends. If you have taught any of these things, you
 know how much relentless determination and patience goes into it. I 
will use these and all the skills I honed through teaching and past leadership experiences in order to 
deliver results for Kiva, Strathmore University, Faulu and SMEP in 
Nairobi.

This is a direct way for you to be involved with my 
fellowship without having to personally deal with the occasional 
electricity shortage, bucket shower or pit latrine. You can live vicariously and safely through my blogging and know that your money helped make an impact.  


Transparency
 and Honesty. There are many organizations out there working towards 
making the world a better, more just place but, when 
donating to these organizations, you may never know where your money is 
going, nor do you consistently get to see exactly what your hard earned 
dollars are being used for. I will be 
consistently documenting who your money is impacting through blogs, 
photos, and videos. Your money will go directly to the costs I incur 
through my fellowship.  It will only be used for my basic necessities, 
it will not be used for any additional travel or entertainment.  And if you have any 
questions, you know where to find me. [nessa.french@fellows.kiva.org]

Incentives!
 I myself am a sucker for incentives/prizes so, I thought of a few 
things to make fundraising a bit more interesting. [see right side panel]
With your support and my on the ground presence we can work together to help alleviate poverty in the developing world. 



Be Involved and Stay Informed about my Fellowship!Follow my fellowship blog at www.nessainkenya.wordpress.com !  I will be busy working with the three wonderful organizations I mentioned above, follow along!  Share my blog and this page with all your friends and family.  The more people who share this page, the more likely it will be featured on IndieGoGo's home page.Spread the word about Kiva.org and my fellowship with Kiva!  The more people who know about the work that Kiva.org is doing to empower and help students and entrepreneurs achieve their goals of educational and financial independence, the more potential there is for success.  Lend to a borrower on kiva.org and tell your friends all about it!  Lastly, help fund my volunteer fellowship to Nairobi.  I truly appreciate any donation you are able to make.   I believe that the work I will be doing will enable so many more people to have access to the education and the credit which they deserve.  Be a part of the microfinance solution by supporting my work in Nairobi. I Kiva because I do not believe that the situation in which you are born should determine your entire life trajectory. Check out why some past Kiva fellows kiva:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WwLvP2wKTB4&...

story:
Ricky > Cancer

My awesome boyfriend Enrique Hernandez was diagnosed with testicular cancer at the beginning of January 2014. Before his diagnosis, he worked full time at both a tattoo studio and a barbershop, with plans on becoming an apprentice barber. He had a lot of awesome big moves to make this year and unfortunately cancer set him back.

Although this is bad news, if he gets good treatment he has a very high chance of beating cancer. He's twenty-six years old and relatively healthy (eats mostly vegan, does not drink or smoke, etc.). Testicular cancer is one of the most curable types. The 5-year survival rate for localized cancer is 99%, for regional is 96%, and for distant is 74%. If he gets surgery and a biopsy ASAP he's got pretty good chances.

In late January, Idle Hand Tattoo (where he works) threw an all-day/all-night benefit in which they raised $14,000! This benefit was extremely successful and there are other benefits planned in SF, but he still needs our help.

On February 21st Ricky is scheduled to have an orchiectomy -- a surgery that will run him about $30,000. After the surgery he will be on his feet again and a biopsy will be taken to stage the cancer as well as plan for any follow-up treatment.

We are almost halfway to being able to pay for his surgery, but we're not there yet! We still have $16,000 to raise. All proceeds received from this fundraiser will go directly toward his treatment and making sure he gets the best care possible. And after he's cured, he can get back to doing what he loves. Anything at all helps, and thank you for supporting him however you can.

What We Need & What You Get

The financial details:

  • At this point in time, we need exactly $16,000. Ricky's surgery will cost about $30,000, and so far we have raised $14,000.
  • Help Ricky out so he can get back to cutting hair, hiking, working on his motorcycle, and bein' a cool dude.
  • If the goal is not met, all funds will still go to treatment! He needs whatever he can get.
  • If you plan on donating $500 or more, please email me first to talk at cpweaver13@gmail.com. This is to avoid percentage-based fees.
  • IMPORTANT: Indiegogo will not let me receive PayPal funds through this website because I do not have a Premier/Business account. But if you'd like to donate through PayPal, you can use it and send to PayPal account cpweaver13@gmail.com. Thanks!

The Impact

  • Raising as much as possible for Ricky is extremely important to me as well as his sisters and the rest of his family. We want him to stick around for a long time and this diagnosis has made me want to find ways to help other cancer patients and survivors.
  • No amount of change is too small. Every bit makes a difference and we appreciate the help whether we know you or not!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, there are plenty of other ways to help!

  • Share this page on the internet. Anywhere and everywhere. Or tell people to visit this page or email cpweaver13@gmail.com if they want to donate. Let other people know.

Thank you for caring. <3

story:
At sixty-five years of age, poor health habits have a tendency to catch up with you. My Health Journey provides a platform to overcome complacency and focus on healthy living and a complete health management package. I’m looking for support to help make health a priority and help fund homelessness among our youth.

Philip's Journey

As a young man I was very active and kept fit with Judo, long distance running and rowing but as the case with so many people, the requirement of everyday living gets in the way. With work, travel and family commitments during my middle years, physical activity went by the wayside with consequent implications for my health and wellbeing.

I am happy to say that motivated by a hip replacement (no doubt partly due to previous extreme physical activity) and rising cholesterol I have been able to focus on restoring health in the last few years. A special thanks needs to go to doctor Donna Burgess, who has been marvelous in monitoring my health and pointing me in the right direction. Also Di Ragg of Western Earthmoving (WEM) who gave me the encouragement and sponsorship to commit to attending ‘New Image’, the gym where I exercise. The personal coaches (Sean and Dominique) have been outstanding in establishing an exercise program that suit my particular needs and limitations.

In addition, typical of most people I have been navigating my Health journey largely on my own; without a cohesive team or game plan in mind. Let’s face it, we can’t run to the doctor every five minutes to get some advice. We have financial planners and accountants to help with our finances, teams have coaches, businesses have managers. What about our health? Keeping track of all my preventative health screenings, engaging with the right professionals, keeping a record of everything, getting the right advice and remembering it all is virtually impossible not to mention exhausting!

I have found the answer…..Myhealthjourney!

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET!

My Plan,

I am going to put “My Health Journey” to the test. Sam, my Personal Healthcare Administrator (Health Coach) is going to help me navigate my Health Journey so that it is more effective, faster and more affordable. In essence helping me take control of my health without it overwhelming me.

To this end I have undertaken a Health journey sponsorship for Lighthouse Foundation raising funds for homeless young people throughout Australia.

I am looking to raise $1,000 of which 35% will go to the Lighthouse Foundation. The balance will go to My Healthcare Journey Administration in order to fund the “Healthcare Administrators” and online global healthcare portal.

Should you decide to become involved, the money we raise will be helping fund youth homelessness through the Lighthouse Foundation. Also, the funds will help fund ‘My Health Journey’ for which you can also register for your own health wellbeing as outlined below. 

The Impact

The impact is twofold:

1.  Raising funds for the homeless youth in our affluent society

2.  Helping develop the system that will enable participants to achieve their personal health goals.

We arrive at this destination from a range of circumstances and in my case a desire to address the following goals, although modest perhaps compared with many others:

a.  To lose from 4 to 7kg of stubborn “men’s” body fat around my waist

b.  To surround myself with a complete health team, that communicates with each other and knows what one another are doing in relation to my health.

c.   Upload all my health records onto a platform that I can control and share with the Health Practitioners on my team.

d.  Provide regular updates on this site, detailing how my journey is going and what I have learnt along the way. Hopefully helping others that find themselves in a similar situation.

e.  Find out just how affordable Healthcare can be….with the right help.

Without the time constraints I had previously, I have more time on hand to focus on improving my health and to explore the concept that maintaining one’s health is not as difficult or costly as it might otherwise seem. Below, is more detail about My Health Journey, their global healthcare portal, and the complete program provided.

FAST, AFFORABLE, EFFECTIVE HEALTHCARE

Other Ways You Can Help

-  If you are inspired by this project and would like others to be involved please pass this message along via your social media outlets, Facebook, twitter etc.

-  Get involved – Like the idea of getting your health in order, but not having to do it alone, PLUS have cutting edge technology to help you along with way. Contact us, or sponsor and select one of the perks and we can get you introduced to a personal Healthcare Administrator immediately, getting you onto the path to success.


Myhealthjourney.com was created by the University of New South Wales, Sydney Australia. Our aim is to provide fast, effective and affordable healthcare. We achieve this by connecting patients with Healthcare Professionals and the patients’ medical records in one place. We also provide the services of a personal healthcare administrator to help patients reach their healthcare goals. Together, we can create a better healthcare system. 

** To receive Free pharmacy services you must be located within 10km of Castle Hill NSW, 2154 or Morningside QLD, 4170.

To find out more go to www.myhealthjourney.com 

Lighthouse Foundation - If we reach our goal of $1,000, then 35% of all proceeds will be donated. If the goal is not reached, 10% of all funds will be donated.

Thank you

My Health Journey is under license from UNSW Australia

story:
It's been a season of many second places and third places.  After all the frustration and time spent making changes and adjustments to my car (with my dad's help), I finally took 1st place at the big race that counts most!  The locals!

Yup!  I won 1st place at the Silicon Valley Local Race for Stock Division.  I will be representing the Silicon Valley as a local champion at the 77th All-American Soap Box Derby in Akron, OH.

Heading to Ohio to compete requires some funds which I am hoping to raise through this to lighten the load on my parents.  Any amount will help!

Please consider giving as little or as much as you want!  :)

Thank you so much in advance!

story:
Background

Every two weeks, the last fluent speaker of a language dies, and humanity loses another language. Nearly half of the world's languages are likely to vanish in the next 100 years.
Over the last decade at Living Tongues Institute for Endangered Languages, we have worked with hundreds of people dedicated to endangered language documentation around the world. Through community collaboration, we have made some of the first-ever digital recordings of dozens of endangered languages, and we have traveled to many countries to train language activists in documentation techniques that can help preserve their cultural and linguistic legacy.

 

Papua New Guinea's Languages

The island nation of Papua New Guinea (PNG) represents the greatest single concentration of linguistic diversity on earth, with 830 listed languages identified thus far, and an unknown number remaining to be scientifically documented.

Without PNG, no survey of the world's languages would be complete, nor would our understanding of the current global process of languages extinction. With so many of PNG's languages being undocumented and in danger of disappearing, now is the time to start creating recordings of these languages, and helping local activists and students to create materials that can preserve their languages for the future.

 

Our Goal

Our goal is to teach a 4-day digital media skills workshop at the Papua New Guinea University of Technology (UNITECH) in which local indigenous students will learn how create new Talking Dictionaries for their own native languages. We have been invited by local scholars in Papua New Guinea to give this workshop later this year in October (2013), and we are raising the funds to make it happen.
Our workshop is already partially funded thanks to grants and donors, and we need a further $2750 to help cover the rest of our equipment and travel costs. Over 50 different local languages are represented at UNITECH. We aim to create Talking Dictionaries for 12 languages to start with, and then return once a year for the next 4 years to continue building more dictionaries with the students.

This will be the 4th time we teach a digital skills workshop of this kind, and the first time in the Pacific. Check out pictures and write-ups from our previous workshops for speakers of endangered languages (organized in collaboration with National Geographic) held in Santa Fe, New Mexico (USA); Shillong, Meghalaya (Northeast India) and Santiago (Chile).

 

What is a Talking Dictionary?

A Talking Dictionary takes the traditional paper dictionary to a whole new level. It is an interactive online tool that digitally preserves words and phrases, and it allows the user to hear high-quality audio recordings of words in their language, as well as record and upload new content.

The tool is a powerful educational tool for communities that are trying to revitalize their endangered languages. The online dictionary is programmed to be bilingual so that speakers of the local dominant language can easily use it. It serves as a resource to help fluent speakers teach their native language to a new generation of speakers.

Talking Dictionaries help create visibility for minority languages on the Web. They are a virtual space where speakers can go to listen to their language, no matter where they are in the world. Take a minute to check out our Talking Dictionary Portal, and our new site for the Talking Dictionaries of Latin America.

 

Why We Can Make a Difference

At the Living Tongues Institute for Endangered Languages, we are a small and dynamic team with a low overhead. We coordinate big long-term projects, such as the Talking Dictionaries, on a modest budget. Supporting us is a great way to support the creation of tools that will preserve threatened languages for future generations of speakers.

Thanks to a Talking Dictionary, you can listen to forms of human speech that you've never heard before, and get a further glimpse into the rich diversity of languages spoken on our planet.

We have a good relationship with a number of communities in Papua New Guinea because we have done language documentation there in the past. Here are some images from our fieldwork in Papua New Guinea in 2009.

 

Languge Documentation Fieldwork in Papua New Guinea: John Agid (left) speaking to Dr. Gregory D. S. Anderson in Matugar village. Photo by Chris Rainier.

 

Christina Yimasinant, of the Yimas people, a speaker of the endangered Karim language, Karawari region, Papua New Guinea. The type of body art she is wearing is called "Karatim" and the headress is called "Yangiliban" in her language.

 

Languge Documentation Fieldwork in Papua New Guinea: John Agid (left) and other Matugar Panau speakers of Matugar village consult with Dr. K. David Harrison. Photo by Chris Rainier.

 

Cultural Documentation in Papua New Guinea: Gibe and Pipe, Huli wigmen, in Southern Highlands. Traditional ceremonial paint colors: Mali-ambua-hare, Waterfall: Iba-Fugu. Photo by Chris Rainier.

Languge Documentation Fieldwork in Papua New Guinea: John Agid (left) and other Matugar Panau speakers of Matugar village consult with Dr. K. David Harrison. Photo by Chris Rainier.
 

Cultural Documentation in Papua New Guinea: Gibe and Pipe, Huli wigmen, in Southern Highlands. Traditional ceremonial paint colors: Mali-ambua-hare, Waterfall: Iba-Fugu. Photo by Chris Rainier.

story:
My toxic-bucket overflowed. My body shut down. 

Approximately 8 years ago (in my early 30's), I started having inexplicable health symptoms.  Daily headaches, heart palpitations, restless sleep, vision disturbances, anxiety and other debilitating symptoms became common-place.  Unfortunately, this led to several years of deteriorating health. 

After visiting countless doctors, undergoing test-after-test, and practically being on my death-bed, I finally met a doctor who had experienced and overcame MCS (Multiple Chemical Sensitivity) first-hand.  He was literally the first person that was able to diagnose and help.  He explained that, because my “toxic bucket” had overflowed, my body was almost literally shutting down.  He explained "in plain English" that everyone has a certain sized "bucket" that will hold a certain amount of toxins.  However, once that bucket is filled, it will "overflow" and have adverse effects on the body.  This was me!

It was during this journey and recovery process that I became aware of the massive amounts of environmental toxins and chemicals that were creating this adverse effect on my body.  The more I researched, the more I learned about how unhealthy our food, beauty products, cleaning chemicals, and other commonly used items are for us.  I realized that these items, all seemingly inconsequential on their own, played a significant role in my deteriorating health.  

Out of these health challenges, and because I’m passionate about this issue, I created a blog called Living Natural Today as a resource to help others learn about chemical sensitivities, toxins, and our food in an effort to live a more healthy and natural lifestyle.  I don’t want you to go down the same road I did!

The Blog... and Now, Radio – Oh, the Irony!

The blog has, without doubt, been an important medium for me to shed light on these issues.  Now, an additional opportunity has presented itself. Approximately 2 months ago (from the blog) I was contacted by an Executive Producer from VoiceAmerica to host my own radio show.  VoiceAmerica is an Internet Radio Station comprised of 7 channels, one of which is the Health & Wellness Channel.  It has, on average, over 3 million audio content accesses monthly and that number continues to grow.  

Ironically, I describe myself as a "behind-the-scenes" type of person.  Now, however, I will get the opportunity to be an advocate for change, behind the microphone, but in front of listeners, advancing a topic that is so necessary.

My radio show, entitled "Living Natural Today - Out with Toxins, In with your Health," will be a vehicle to not only share my personal struggles with toxins – and the detrimental impact they have on one’s health – but more importantly, to educate others on toxins and how you can minimize their harmful effects.  Listeners will learn simple and practical steps to begin minimizing toxic exposures that will ultimately improve their quality of life.

Throughout the 13 weeks, I will be interviewing experts as it relates to MCS (multiple chemical sensitivity), mercury fillings, food labels, household chemicals, food allergies, Organic Standards, nutrition (real whole foods) and much more – all in an effort to help educate my listeners so that they will not have an overflowing toxic bucket.

I Need Your Help to Cover Production Costs

I need your help, however, to make this endeavor a reality and a success.  I am not getting paid to host the show. If you know me, you know I don't like to ask for money, but without your help, I couldn't do this. I strongly believe in the information that is going to be shared. It is valuable to each one of us, and could, in fact, be life-saving! 

There are pre-production and production costs during the 13-week pilot.  I will be required to raise $5,500 just to cover these fixed costs.  I would appreciate any amount you would be willing to donate so this important message can be spread.

If you can't contribute financially you can still help us by sharing this campaign on Facebook and Twitter, or by simply telling your friends and work colleagues.  

Advertising & Sponsorship Opportunities Available

For those of you who would like to advertise or sponsor shows, there are many options available for single shows or for the full 13-week pilot, including audio spots, video spots, banner ads, guest appearance opportunities and more.  If you would like to take advantage of these opportunities, please email me using the email link above.  We would love to speak with you.

Please know that you’re making a positive difference in all of our lives, and the lives of loved ones, with your contribution and your social sharing.  Thank you and be sure to listen to the first show on Wednesday, September 17, 2014 at 4:00 PM EST.  I’ll keep you informed with more details as the show launch nears.  I am truly grateful for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Our objective is to increase access to important health education information and early noninvasive screenings and testing for the poor, disable, senior, home bound, and other vulnerable populations that have limited access to healthcare information and services.

====

This campaign is to refurbish two van mobile units to do outreach in the communities where disasters big or small occur and to impact the poor outcomes of chronic disease in our community. Chronic disease accounts for about 70% of all deaths per year in Pennsylvania.

The Pennsylvania chronic Disease Burden Report Statistics confirms that Blacks and those of lower socioeconomic status shoulder the burden of chronic disease throughout the State.

The Impact

Imagine the impact on the life of one teenager getting screened for HIV or an STD and getting the right information, support and medication in time. Or an elderly person getting a health screening for high blood pressure.  But we  plan to connect with 100 to 200 people every week with these two mobile units.

And so, due to the health screenings we do on the van and the referrals we give out, people will become more proactive with their health, they will live longer and healthier lives, and there will be a decrease in the number of people showing up in the hospital emergency rooms.   Additionally People will avoid expensive medical bills often resulting from an emergency room visit.

Who We Are 

The mission of Neighborhood United Against Drugs (NUAD)  -- using these mobile unites--  is to reduce drug use/abuse, teen pregnancy, chronic illness as well as the spread of HIV infection and senseless violence in the community and equip people with the skills needed to make positive choices in life.

NUAD has served the community for over 30 years providing services in West and Southwest Philadelphian communities where the poor and working poor reside. Communities that have one of the highest crime rates in the city and it is here that NUAD worked with teens around abstinence, youth violence, peer education, Men’s health and other programs.

NUAD has begun building partnerships to develop the potential and reach of the Health Mobile Units project.  Our partners include: CityLights, Haven Youth Center Inc., Health Annex Family Practice, National Black Leadership Initiative on Cancer,  Women’s Institute for Family Health, and the Southwest CDC,  You may know an organization too that you can invite to join us.


What We Need

Two large Recreational Vehicles were donates by a local community activist who wanted to support us.but before the can become Health Mobile Units they need to be refurbished and have medical equipment installed.  These cost break down to medical equipment / insurance / gas / storage /  schedule management and other maintenance costs.

Once we have the budget for these costs, we can go on the road and begin changing the lives of young and old.


What You Get

With your donations you get the satisfaction of changing people's futures by helping them at critical times in their lives.

But You Also Get

Individuals can get some  very unique and enjoyable perks.  We have handmade body  art,  jewelry from community artist and crafts persons, having your portrait painted.

Businesses and Not-For-Profits can opt to get recognition and promotion of their projects or causes (please see the $100, $500, and $1000 perks).

If We Don't Reach Our Entire Goal

If we don't reach our entire goal of funding 2 Mobile Units through Indiegogo, we hope to fund one of the Mobile Units first.  We plan to continue the campaign on our website to cover the difference because Prevention through Early Detection is a critical project.  We know it will save money, time and suffering to get out there with these Mobile Units.



Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can’t contribute money but you send this link to friends and co-workers.  Maybe you can ask businesses in your neighborhood if they would sponsor us for $100.   Also, you can use the  Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.    Thank you.

story:
Kaiya Barber was born with Cerebral Palsy.

Cerebral Palsy is a neurological disorder that affects a person's ability to ambulate and communicate. When Kaiya was born, the doctors said that Kaiya would never walk. In the past years, the Ramapo/Indian Hills High School community and their friends and families have banded together to raise money for Kaiya's treatments and therapies through donations, the Kaiya's Cup hockey game, and Kaiyapalooza. Kaiya's father, Ramapo High School math teacher and varsity coach Lee Barber, gives credit to the Ramapo/Indian Hills community for Kaiya's ability to walk, as the funds raised go to her ongoing therapy, including Hippotherapy (horseback therapy), which facilitates hip movement and ultimately the ability to walk.

What We Need 

Every year, these fundraisers and events are even more successful than the year before, and this year shouldn't be an exception! Your donations, no matter the size, help to increase the quality of life of someone who serves as an inspiration for everyone. With the help of the community in the past, Kaiya was able to break free from her wheelchair and walk- now, with your help, Kaiya will be able to break even more barriers.

Kaiyapalooza

Kaiyapalooza is an annual event held in May that benefits Kaiya Barber. Food is served, there's a show, and there's raffle baskets, auction items and a 50/50! It's always a great time, so we'd love to see you there. The date for the event is May 22, 2013 at 7:00 p.m.

Thank you for your generous contributions!

story:
Mike's Broken Hand

My name is Travis and i have been a good friend of Mike Childress for over 20 years now. Mike had a horrific accident at work which resulted in getting multiple fingers in his hand broken. (Look in the picture gallery to see the wound..ITS BAAADDDDDD)  Mike is a metal worker who creates art work with his hands. He was helping move a metal cabinet that weighed several hundred pounds when it dropped onto his hand, at this point he cant remember anything else because he blacked out. The next thing he knew, he woke up in a hospital. 

My goal is to raise $10,000 to help with his expenses and bills that are piling up because of this injury. Most of his hospital bills are covered but he is building up some debt because of this injury.

 

I want to raise $10,000 for him.

This money raised will all go directly to Mike, it will help with his bills piling up and pay for more rehabilitaion for his hand.

I did a similiar fund raiser for Yoshi's broken foot and he can vouch that he received all the money contributed. We raised almost $1000 for Yoshi and im hoping we can raise even more for Mike.

The Magic Hand's

Getting Mikes hand back to 100% is of the utmost importance because of all the positive things his hands contribute to the community. He volunteers his time and expertise building skateparks in the Seattle area, and God damnit, he is a damned handsome fellow who needs his handsome hand back!

 

Other ways to help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Please share the link to this page on Facebook or other website's to help encourage other's to contribute to our friend.

 

And that’s all there is to it.
