story:
(Para Español, haga clic aquí)

On July 14th, 2012, our friend, brother, and son Marco Lira suffered a severe brain injury. He’s currently in the best possible care with both amazing doctors and an incredible amount of positivity coming from family and friends surrounding him.

Unfortunately, he does not have health insurance. Great care costs a great deal of money, and that’s where we need you.

His father Aurelio, mother Susana, and brothers Danny and Fernando are some of the warmest and most welcoming people any of us have ever met. Few among us haven't immediately become a member of their ever-growing extended family. They’ve never hesitated to open their home, help anyone in need, and have ALWAYS made everyone feel like part of the family.

Now it’s time we return that favor and help them in their time of need 

To many of us Marco has been an inspiration- his art, music, and love of life have inspired countless numbers of us. Year and after year, whether through music or art, Marco has continuously blessed us with his talent, pushing us to explore our own. Rare is a talent like Marco’s, which encompasses so many disciplines- and rarer is a talent that brings out the best in those that are lucky enough to simply be there to experience it. As the weeks go by, we will be sharing samples of Marco’s staggering genius- and as always, beautiful glimpses into the heart and mind of person that we love so much. 

Marco has a huge emotional support system, but love won't cover his mounting hospital bills. The earliest prognosis has him in the hospital for weeks upon weeks, possibly months. As you know, medical care under such circumstances can reach astronomical heights. For those who have been asking what they can do to help, we ask that you give anything you can to relieve the burden of his current and coming medical expenses. Anything helps. Literally…anything. 

You might ask, how can I give?

We have set up this Indiegogo account as means to help raise funds for his medical bills. Indiegogo is a crowd funding website that allows regular people to set up campaigns to raise funds for a cause...Our cause is our friend Marco.

By giving through Indiegogo, and helping the campaign meet and exceed its goal, you are in no small way coming to the aid of a person and family who has given us so much through his music, art, and friendship- let's all pitch in and give him something back. 

Finally, we also ask that you, his friends and family, share here your stories and memories that you have experienced alongside Marco, for us all to enjoy and find comfort in.

All proceeds will go directly to Marco and his family.

 

If you decide to donate - please let people know. Use this as your profile picture on Facebook to get the word out.

-- 

 

El 14 de Julio del 2012 nuestro querido amigo, hermano, e hijo Marco Lira tuvo un accidente y sufrio un fuerte daño cerebral. Actualmente  él esta bajo los mejores cuidados con buenos doctores y con un apoyo increible de su familia y amigos.

Desafortunadamente él no tiene aseguranza y los mejores cuidados requieren de mucho dinero. Aquí es cuando necesitamos de ustedes.

Su papá Aurelio, mamá Susana y hermanos Danny y Fernando son de las personas más buenas y acogedoras que hemos conocido Todos hemos sido bienvenidos a su hogar y nos han convertido en miembros de su familia. Ellos siempre nos han abierto las puertas de su hogar, han ayudado a cualquiera que lo necesite, y SIEMPRE han hecho sentir a todos como parte de su familia.

Ahora es tiempo de devolverles el favor y ayudarlos en estos momentos que más nos necesitan.

Para muchos de nosotros Marco a sido una inspiración – su arte, música, y amor a la vida han inspirado a muchos de nosotros. Ya sea atraves de su música o su arte, año tras año Marco continua bendiciendonos con su talento y haciendo que exploremos los nuestros. El talento de Marco es raro, ya que cubre tantas areas pero más raro es el talento que hace que las personas den lo mejor de si mismas. En las siguientes semanas vamos a compartir ejemplos de la asombrosa genialidad de Marco y como siempre, muestras de el hermoso corazón y mente de la persona que tanto queremos.

Marco tiene un gran apoyo emocional pero este amor no puede cubrir sus costos de hospital que siguen aumentando. El primer pronóstico es que él estara en el hospital por muchas semanas, quisa hasta meses. Como ustedes saben, los cuidados medicos en estos casos son demasiado costosos. Para todos ustedes que se preguntan en como pueden ayudar, les pedimos que porfavor contribuyan cualquier cantidad que puedan y asi poder ayudar a aliviar los costos medicos que ya se estan acumulando y seguiran aumentando. Toda cantidad ayuda!

Cómo pueden contribuir??

Hemos creado una cuenta con Indiegogo para poder recibir donaciones y poder pagar sus cuidados medicos. Indiegogo es una pagina web que permite organisar campañas para recaudar fondos para todo tipo de causas. Nuestra causa es nuestro amigo Marco.

Al donar con Indiegogo y al ayudar a que esta campaña logre su meta, ustedes estan apoyando y ayudando a una persona y una familia que nos han dado tanto con su música, arte y amistad. Hay que unirnos en esta causa!

Finalmente les pedimos a ustedes, sus amigos y familiares que compartan sus historias y recuerdos que tengan de Marco.

Todas las donaciones iran directo a Marco y su familia.

-------------------------------------------

Desafortunadamente él no tiene aseguranza y los mejores cuidados requieren de mucho dinero. Aquí es cuando necesitamos de ustedes.
Su papá Aurelio, mamá Susana y hermanos Danny y Fernando son de las personas más buenas y acogedoras que hemos conocido Todos hemos sido bienvenidos a su hogar y nos han convertido en miembros de su familia. Ellos siempre nos han abierto las puertas de su hogar, han ayudado a cualquiera que lo necesite, y SIEMPRE han hecho sentir a todos como parte de su familia.
Ahora es tiempo de devolverles el favor y ayudarlos en estos momentos que más nos necesitan.
Para muchos de nosotros Marco a sido una inspiración – su arte, música, y amor a la vida han inspirado a muchos de nosotros. Ya sea atraves de su música o su arte, año tras año Marco continua bendiciendonos con su talento y haciendo que exploremos los nuestros. El talento de Marco es raro, ya que cubre tantas areas pero más raro es el talento que hace que las personas den lo mejor de si mismas. En las siguientes semanas vamos a compartir ejemplos de la asombrosa genialidad de Marco y como siempre, muestras de el hermoso corazón y mente de la persona que tanto queremos.
Marco tiene un gran apoyo emocional pero este amor no puede cubrir sus costos de hospital que siguen aumentando. El primer pronóstico es que él estara en el hospital por muchas semanas, quisa hasta meses. Como ustedes saben, los cuidados medicos en estos casos son demasiado costosos. Para todos ustedes que se preguntan en como pueden ayudar, les pedimos que porfavor contribuyan cualquier cantidad que puedan y asi poder ayudar a aliviar los costos medicos que ya se estan acumulando y seguiran aumentando. Toda cantidad ayuda!
Cómo pueden contribuir??
Hemos creado una cuenta con Indiegogo para poder recibir donaciones y poder pagar sus cuidados medicos. Indiegogo es una pagina web que permite organisar campañas para recaudar fondos para todo tipo de causas. Nuestra causa es nuestro amigo Marco.
Al donar con Indiegogo y al ayudar a que esta campaña logre su meta, ustedes estan apoyando y ayudando a una persona y una familia que nos han dado tanto con su música, arte y amistad. Hay que unirnos en esta causa!
Finalmente les pedimos a ustedes, sus amigos y familiares que compartan sus historias y recuerdos que tengan de Marco.
Todas las donaciones iran directo a Marco y su familia.
-------------------------------------------

story:
Help us for a safe patient journey

The shortest way for patients from Matibi Mission Hospital to the next bigger hospital with emergency surgery takes more than two hours. The new ambulance though is adequate for the bad roads but there is still no patient bed and no nurse stand in the canopy. 

In May 2012, we, the friends of Matibi, a Swiss based association to support the local hospital in Matibi, raised enough funds to buy a new Toyota Hilux 4x4 planned to be extended as an ambulance. In fall 2012, the hospital built a canopy on top of the pick-up and painted the car to be recognisable as ambulance. Now, we are looking for fundings for the next extensions: a patient bed and a nurse stand. 

Matibi Mission Hospital is the main medical venue for more than 20'000 people living around Matibi, a village in the south of Simbabwe. The 125 hospital bed are divided in differnent wards like maternity, men, and children. Every day, more than 40 patient are treated in the outpatient department. in the home based care programm, more than 300 patients are provided with anti-AIDS-medicines. For surgery the patients have to transferred to the Masvingo Province Hospital, more than two hours away, a long and stressful journey. 

The association Friends for Matibi supports the hospital with doctor's top-up, drugs, equipment like cd4 machine, anasthetic machine, x-ray films, and infrastructure development like solar panels, borehole pumps for drinking water, fridges and more. We're accepted as an official support organization by the Swiss government and the UNICEF.  

You will find more details about friends for Matibi under www.matibi.ch


We need 3628 US$ to build in a patient bed

The quotation we took is 3628 US$ including all taxes. 

With this money we will build a patient bedd, an stretcher bed, and a nurse stand into the canopy. See how this looks in another ambulance: 

With this installation we will be capable to transport patient in a manner that they have a minimal comfort and assistance by a educated nurse. The ambulance is already up an running but without patient bed it is really dangerours for the life of heavy insured patient on the bad roads. 

Your donations will be collected by the association of the friends of Matibi in Switzerland. Even if we do not raise the whole amout we will try to convince other donators here in Switzerland to donate the missing money. Our association is working entirely on a volontary base so be sure that every dime of the fundings we raise here will find his way down to the Matibi mission hospital. We're are working for the hospital for more than eight years and we have established structure and ways of communications and money-wiring to Simbabwe. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please help us in spreading the word about the Matibi mission hospital and their needs. Feel free to contact us under info@matibi.ch for more information.

story:
My name is Paul , i am 23 years old and for the past 7 months i have been living a nightmare. What started off with a small lump in the neck which doctors said was harmless parathyroid cancer ended in a lump the size of a potato, a really ugly infection which ate it's way through my body, eventually reaching the back of my neck and damaging my spine to the point that my head was so heavy for it, that it fractured 4 vertebraes. [Note from Auntie Sue - Look in the gallery for a photo of this - warning - quite shocking!]

    I will now tell you about myself, so that you understand why i need help. Growing up on my own since i was 12, without any sort of inheritance, life was and still is tough. I had to work the jobs most people didn't want, which then barely covered the rent and expenses, most of the times leaving me without a daily meal. I was alone, i had no friends and no family except my faithful cat, god bless and rest his soul. Then i met some wonderful people over the internet from Australia, which to this day help me in any way they can, and i wish that someday i might be able to repay their kindness. They helped me morally and financially and gave me the chance to do some small work here and there; everything was starting to look up, i don't drink alcohol and don't smoke so i was starting to save a bit of money, my biggest desire was a home of my own, not having to worry about the roof over my head.

    But then it happened... the stuff nightmares are made of. I had already undergone 2 surgeries to remove infection from the lump and the lump itself, but it kept coming back; then one morning, i woke up with a horrible pain in the back of my neck, a numb left arm and i realized that i can't hold my head up at all. I was hospitalized 3 months straight, had 3 surgeries on my neck, one of which involved screws being placed in my spine, then got diagnosed with lymphoma. The problem is that i live in a country with a poor health system, which doesn't cover certain expenses - i have to pay for the screws and and doctors are corrupt, they literally ask you a fee to do a proper job on you - a thing which has now came to bite me . I have been living with a cervical collar for the past 6 months, because the surgery on my spine is incomplete, because i could not afford it. I need a certain prosthetic and more titanium screws from what they've told me. And it keeps getting worse and worse - maybe because of the chemotherapy that i have to go through, or because the surgery is incomplete, one of my vertebrae is now exposed and my back has since then started to become more and more numb and stiff. The doctor's where i had surgery won't see me, saying all sorts of pretenses and i cannot afford a private surgeon to see me, a consultation alone costing 100$, I have been avoiding this because it is a lot of money, and when i think about it, i start doubting that i am worth it and that i will ever get better; the surgery costs about 7,000$ at a city hospital and at least 20,000$ at a private clinic. I added the private clinic option because of the way i have been treated by the surgeons at the hospital; as if they don't care if i live or die, they just want their paycheck.

    I apologize for the possibly robotic or rushed feel of my case, truth be told, i never imagined going through so much in such a short time, it would take me pages and pages to retell everything, it all feels so unreal that it keeps me up at night, crying and wishing i would stop breathing. But then i want to live, to have a chance at a normal life...

   Any help you can give, every 1 dollar you can spare or every person you tell, is one step closer to having a life. I will answer any questions, no matter how private it is, and i will try to repay everyone back in any way that i can. Thank you for your help !

Validation from the Australian family

This young man deserves a chance - he is so thoughtful, creative and intelligent. I owe a great debt to him. He was responsible for holding my son together with friendship and counselling - through talking on skype while they played their internet-based games. My son was going through such difficult times in the last years of school, when the bullying never stopped. He is like a son to us and we are helping him as much as we can.  I hope you can help him a little too. Thank you Sue M. We love you Paul.

story:
This campaign is running for 2 days: started 12am July 6th- ending 11:59pm July 7th, 2014.

Short Summary

If you have a loved one who requires hospitalization and/or long term care, it can be a full-time job managing the process. You don’t know your way through the health care system. We do. We provide personalized health care advocacy for all stages of your journey through the maze that is the Ontario Health Care system. Keeping you informed about treatment options. Helping you to maximize the care that your loved one receives.

  • We are a team of entrepreneurs that formed  26 hours ago during the Lean StartUp Machine, Toronto. We have successfully validated the idea among potential customers during in person interviews and now plan to take it live if we get enough support from you. 
  • Idea resonates with each one of us on a very personal level and as per our research with lots of other people, who have been facing similar challenges. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to collect as many service sign-ups as possible in the period of 2 days to make this happen.  

You get a HUGE thank you from us, obviously. But mainly, you are giving a birth to a service that will ease the hardest and most stressful moments of family's life.  

If you want to join the team, become an investor or have questions, please send us direct message via indiegogo. 


More about Health Concierge

Critical illness and long term care advocacy. 

Have you or a family member or loved one been diagnosed with a critical illness that required hospitalization or long term care?

When this happens it can be overwhelming and stressful. You’ve been thrust into a world that you don’t understand and likely have no idea how to effectively navigate.

The health care system is overtaxed, doctors and nurses are stressed, and frequently don’t have the luxury of focusing on your needs and questions. We pay people to help us buy a house, buy investments, personal trainers.

One point of contact to help- prioritize steps, schedule appointments, and make your illness priority number one.

Do you struggle to manage appointments, specialists, inter hospital transfers, post-operative care?

Did you have to go to an out of town health care facility that required travel and hotel stays?

If you require out of town care, we help you with personalized health care advocacy, as well as providing other services to make your experience less stressful. Helping you to find hotels, getting you directions, coordinating inter hospital transfers.

For those requiring long term outpatient care, we can help manage appointments and follow up treatments.

We can centralize and distribute treatment and procedure outcomes to family members. We are a single point of contact for information about the patient.

story:
We need your help!

Meet the Kinney Family from the lovely little town of Pittsboro, NC (population 2000).  

Both the husband (Phillip) and wife (Cassie) manage the local Andy's Hamburger shop.  As members of the community, they have often held fundraisers at Andy's for local charities and for others in need. 

Phillip was recently diagnosed with Stage 4 Hodgkins disease and started chemotherapy on July 11th.  Phillip is 28 years old.

Phillip and Cassie have 2 small children ages 2 and 4.

They have no medical insurance.

Their home is falling apart!

The Kinney family currently lives in a 30 year old single-wide mobile home with two small bedrooms.  Their electric bill alone is $400 each month.  With outside temperatures soaring to over 100 degrees they cannot keep the trailer comfortable for someone going through such intensive treatment.

They need to move into a better living arrangement for their family in Pittsboro.

We are raising funds to help them get moved and established in a better rental home.

The Battle Ahead

Phillip will be undergoing chemotherapy for an extended period of time and will not be able to work.  After the chemotherapy is done, the doctors will assess the prognosis to determine if a bone marrow transplant will be needed to increase his survival odds.

story:
This version of the campaign has been suspended due to unforeseen regulatory issues. Refunds will be issued to all contributors. We’ll relaunch soon. Stay tuned! 


Join Albert Martinez, H.R.H. Tunku Naquiyuddin, & Jun Ynion in the fight against mosquito-borne diseases. The people of the Philippines have suffered enough. Our R.E.A.P. programme will help them avoid even greater hardship by: 


The Problem: Mosquitoes Will Thrive

Mosquitoes don’t immediately come to mind when one thinks of Typhoon Haiyan and the devastation it caused in the Philippines. While the provision of food, water and shelter will make up the bulk of the aid effort, little is being done to combat the spread of mosquito-borne diseases. 

Mosquitoes are thriving in Haiyan’s aftermath because of the increase in breeding habitats. And with mosquitoes comes life-threatening diseases such as Dengue, Malaria, Japanese Encephalitis and Chikungunya. The WHO and Department of Health have expressed concern over the rising dengue incidence and the likelihood of an outbreak in typhoon-ravaged regions.


What Can We Do To Help?

With your help, we can prevent these diseases from causing further suffering and unnecessary loss of life in the Philippines.

Our approach to controlling mosquito borne-diseases is multi-pronged and can be summarised with R.E.A.P. (Reduce, Educate, Activate, Protect).

Reduce

Our key strategy is larval source reduction (i.e. killing mosquito larvae).  This is the most effective way to control the mosquito population because it:

·  Kills before they mature into flying adults that spread disease.

·  Kills when they are most vulnerable (i.e. confined to water).

·  Denies them the opportunity to breed 

We will achieve this by using a newly developed biolarvicide that is harmless to humans, animals and the environment. It’s also scientifically proven by independent laboratory and field tests to be 200 times more effective than other available biolarvicides.

Some relevant information about the biolarvicide:


Educate

 Spreading awareness & teaching effective mosquito control methods is crucial in our strategy to fight mosquitoes. We will mobilise dedicated teams to:

·  Visit houses to advise residents on common breeding sites & their removal.

·  Demonstrate the application of biolarvicide in potential breeding sites that cannot be removed (i.e. water storage containers).

·  Explain disease transmission, symptoms & the mosquito lifecycle.


Activate

We will engage with all levels of the community to inspire active participation in the fight against mosquitoes. We will secure community support by:

·  Organising community events & house visits.

·  Encouraging advocacy through social media & word of mouth.

·  Enlisting non-profit organisations & other like-minded community stakeholders to help in the fight.


Protect

To prevent the recurrence of disease within communities, measures will be put in place to protect against mosquito bites & disease transmission. We will accomplish this with:

·  Surveillance operations to monitor the number of cases of mosquito-borne disease/level of risk & adjust our measures accordingly.

·  The use of bio-repellents to protect against mosquitoes bites.

The bio repellents we will distribute are environmentally friendly (i.e. alcohol & CFC free) and are also made from non-toxic natural ingredients (wild tomato plant extract), making them safe to use on children & around food.

REAP is non-toxic, environmentally safe, highly-effective, & sustainable. The end result? Freedom from the threats of Dengue, Malaria, Japanese Encephalitis & Chikungunya.



Okay, I’m Convinced. What’s The Plan?

·  We will focus on Tacloban, the city hardest hit by Typhoon Haiyan. 

·  The Department of Health will help us identify Barangays (neighbourhoods/suburbs) at risk of an outbreak of mosquito-borne disease.

·  These “hotspots” must be identified at a date closer to the start of our programme because of varying ground conditions. This is to ensure maximum impact in areas that need it most.

Launch REAP: To be impactful we need to raise $50,000. Once this goal is reached, REAP will be implemented in the most high-risk hotspot in Tacloban to quickly suppress the mosquito population & prevent outbreaks of disease.

Expand REAP: Depending on the amount of money we raise, we can implement REAP in additional Barangays that need our help. For every $50,000 above our starting goal we will expand REAP into other at-risk Barangays.


How You Can Help

Contribute today & REAP the rewards! With your support we can turn the tide against mosquitoes & work towards a future free of mosquito-borne diseases.

Spread the Word. Tell everybody & anybody about our freedom from dengue campaign on Indiegogo. You can check out Indiegogo's easy to use share tools above.

On behalf of the Sabak Foundation & the people of the Philippines, we thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

safe, highly-effective, & sustainable. The end result? Freedom from the
threats of Dengue, Malaria, Japanese Encephalitis & Chikungunya.
Okay, I’m Convinced. What’s The Plan?
· 
We will focus on Tacloban, the city hardest hit by Typhoon
Haiyan.  
· 
The Department of Health will help us identify Barangays (neighbourhoods/suburbs)
at risk of an outbreak of mosquito-borne disease. 
· 
These “hotspots” must be identified at a date closer to the
start of our programme because of varying ground conditions. This is to ensure
maximum impact in areas that need it most.
Launch REAP: To be impactful we need
to raise $50,000. Once this goal is reached, REAP will be implemented in the
most high-risk hotspot in Tacloban to quickly suppress the mosquito population
& prevent outbreaks of disease. 
Expand REAP: Depending on the amount
of money we raise, we can implement REAP in additional Barangays that need our
help. For every $50,000 above our starting goal we will expand REAP into other
at-risk Barangays.
How You Can Help
Contribute today & REAP the
rewards! With
your support we can turn the tide against mosquitoes & work towards a
future free of mosquito-borne diseases. 
Spread the Word. Tell everybody &
anybody about our freedom from dengue campaign on Indiegogo. You can check out Indiegogo's
easy to use share tools above.

On behalf of the Sabak Foundation
& the people of the Philippines, we thank you from the bottom of our
hearts!

story:
The Festival of Life Health Awareness (FOLHA) is dedicated to the eradication of all diseases, especially Cancer, Diabetes, Arthritis, Cardiovascular Disease, Kidney Disease, and HIV/AIDS, among other illnesses.  It is presented as part of the International Festival of Life (IFOL), now celebrating its 21st Anniversary of bringing nations together, Thursday through Sunday, July 4-7, 2013 in Union Park, located at 1501 West Randolph Avenue, in downtown Chicago’s West-Loop region.

FOLHA is a new addition that we have added to ephisize the importance of leading a health lifestyle and teaching others to do the same. 

The FOLHA pavilion will feature a health/education stage, with a mix of gospel and inspirational entertainers.  Other uplifting presentations by health and medical professionals, personal testimonies and stories of hope by those struggling with cancer and other diseases, will also have a forum.  There will also be health screenings and recommended treatment for attendees with health issues.  Individuals seeking knowledge on overcoming various health issues are invited to attend and celebrate in a united force to fight against all diseases.

July 4th Independence/Freedom must have a new meaning! Independence (Free thy self) from Cancer, Diabetes, AIDS and other diseases, as victims, family, friends and supporters unite and fight to overcome the diseases that plague the human body.

This Health Awareness Freedom Celebration will feature, what may well be, the world’s longest Cancer, HIV and Diabetes line dance, in which all attendees will be invited to participate. Celebrity health experts will be invited as guest speakers and/or to serve as panelists in health workshops.  The participation of all medical, hospital and health institutions in the area will be solicited by FOLHA.

story:
My name is Jack W. Cooper. I am a 42 year transgender man who lives in Philadelphia Pennsylvania. On Wednesday, August 14, 2013, I am scheduled to undergo the ultra important next step in my transitional journey, a surgical procedure that will provide me with a beautiful, hand-crafted, male chest.

It had been my hope that this surgery, which is integral to aligning my gender identity with the body that I will spend the rest of my life in, would be covered by health insurance; however, despite the admirable efforts of my loving fiancé J.D Ackerman (Thank you Sweet Pea!), who has been my tireless champion in the process of making this dream a reality, we were unable to guarantee coverage.

Rather than despair over this unfortunate disappointment, J.D and I chatted about alternate solutions, and we decided to put together an indiegogo campaign to raise the funds for the procedure with the help of our community. By donating whatever amount you can afford, or if you cannot afford to donate, by simply sharing this page with folks who might be interested in helping out, you will be enabling me to achieve something that I have wanted and needed for a very long time.

 

The Journey So Far

I was born and raised in Texas. Growing up, I was most definitely aware that I was different from the kids around me; however, I did not have a name for how I was different until I moved to Philly about fifteen years ago. Shortly after arriving in the city, I was introduced to a few trans* folks and their allies, who had started a grassroots organization called THAC (Transgender Health Action Coalition). I became a volunteer for the group, and through my involvement, I got in touch with the fact that I was transgender.

As a result of that realization, I began to transition socially by telling my closest friends, requesting that they call me Cooper, rather than the first or middle names that I had been given at birth, and asking them to refer to me with male gender pronouns. Though these steps were pivotal to affirming my identity, I was unable to move beyond that point for many years, due to my struggle with an addiction to alcohol.

On October 24, 2005, I got sober. As a result of my recovery from active alcoholism, I discovered vipassana (insight) meditation, and began to practice it on a regular basis. Meditation has enabled me to befriend the body that I have been at odds with for most of my life, as well as to embrace the reality of my trans* experience with a level of compassion and acceptance that I never thought possible.

Today, I am connected with my own inner resources and more able to engage with my community than ever before. I am finally taking care of myself, and I have found the courage and fortitude to take some incredible steps on my journey to find refuge in my own skin.

Three years ago, I legally changed my name to Jack W. Cooper. A little over one year ago, I started hormone replacement therapy, and now, I am finally ready to give myself this gift that I struggled long and hard to believe that I deserve.

 

Looking Forward

It is with great pleasure that I ask for your help in achieving my goal of raising 6,000 dollars for the cost of the surgery, and 2,500 dollars to cover my living expenses during the 4 weeks I will be out of work while recuperating from the procedure. This adds up to a total of 8,500 dollars. Any amount raised beyond this goal will be paid forward to another transgender person who needs assistance with paying for a gender affirming surgery.

Thank you so much for any financial help you are able to give, and for spreading the word to others who may be in a position to donate.

May we all be Peaceful and at Ease.

- Jack W. Cooper.

 

And now a little treat for reading this whole story - Behind-The-Scenes on Jack W. Cooper's Indiegogo Fundraising Video!

 

Also, we will be adding info about the physical fundraiser, "Well, Bless His Chest" as soon as we have all the details confirmed!

story:
WHY AM I DOING THIS?

This is my campaign to recapture health while moving away from the public education sector for teaching. I have been considered a great teacher, counselor and mentor for a lot of people since I was 17 years old. While I am far from perfect, I do believe that by support has been an overall benefit to most communities that I have touched.

Now that I am trying to work from home I have gained so much weight that I have type II Diabetes. So I now seek sponsors to help me get a ZIZE bike for someone my size and change that. Instead of having family and friends that are worried, I felt that this was the most effective way to transmute all of that love and concern into an outcome that will be positive.

What I can offer in return are consultations. For my more qualitative light-worker friends and empaths, I offer you the readings that I give on my "Astrolosophy" site.

For my more qualitative scientific minded friends I can offer you academic support, counseling and peer-support.

These deliverables will be given in the form of emails, instant messages, phone calls or video chat sessions.


✰I assure you this bike will not become a dust collector! My focus and intention are set. I live right near a city lake that's perfect for biking and I am dying to get out there.

This is part of a larger experiment that I am writing about and I will be sure to credit everyone when the piece is done.

story:
ANN'S PLACE : A Private Care Home for Hospice Patients

Since 2010 we have been caring for the sick and dying.
 

While most of our patients are referred to us by a Hospice Agency and live an average of 90 days - 120 days,  2 of our current patients have been with us over a year. Lucy, who is 107 years old, is our country's oldest living WWII female veteran. Clayton, who is 95, served in the Army and fought in North Africa, Italy and France.

We work with area Hospices and other agencies who provide us with all the support we and our patients need. Doctors, Nurses, CNA's, Chaplains and Social Workers. We provide the home and 24 hr. care.  

Our focus is to provide our patients with a beautiful home, good food and love. It is where they have come to die.

We are looking to expand to serve more hospice patients. Please help us in our goal to purchase  a 4-5 bedroom, 3 bath house that can be remodeled to serve more patients.

Our mothers, fathers, sisters and brothers need your help!

story:
Please don't forget to SHARE this campaign!

Manchester Disc Golf

We are a volunteer-run organisation trying to bring the sport of disc golf to Manchester by building a permanent and completely free to use course in Longford Park. We also run community outreach sessions to introduce people in the area to this expanding sport. We love disc golf and we want to share it!

What is Disc Golf?

Disc golf is a similar game to "regular" golf except that it's played with a Frisbee disc. 

Players throw the disc as close as possible to a specially designed target called a basket, then throw again from where the disc landed, trying to get into the basket in the lowest number of throws. Chains on the targets are there to help catch the disc by deflecting it into the basket. The length of holes can vary between 40 - 100 metres. 

Disc golf is fantastic community sport, it's cheap, accessible and easy for anyone to learn and play. It is getting popular too... there are more than 5000 disc golf courses around the world.  

Who are we?

We're a group of people who met through our love of playing frisbee with our Manchester-based Ultimate Frisbee club "DUFFA".

We were asked by Trafford Council and the Friends of Longford Park group to help set up a disc golf course on the site of a disused pitch and putt golf course in Longford Park in Manchester.

We have a core working group of 10 people and a small army of volunteers who have helped us install our first three permanent baskets and run open days to showcase the sport. So far, about 400 people have tried it out!

Our team from DUFFA has a successful track record of running an annual not-for-profit community event with a £10,000+ turnover. We're very excited about bringing this project to life and sparking a surge in the take up of disc golf in the region. 

The plan...

We want to install nine permanent baskets, tees and signs, and buy more rental frisbee discs.  We will create a course that anyone can come and play, anytime, for free. We will use this course to build a strong community of players and friends, volunteering to run open days, and beginner sessions for schools and community groups.

If we exceed our funding goal we will be able to buy more permanent baskets, install more tees, plant more trees and work towards creating the first 18 hole course in the Northwest of England. The nearest proper 18 hole course is in Leamington Spa!

What We Need & What You Get

We need £4,000 to buy the material we need to install a 9-hole course. The installation will be done for free by our volunteers. 
A breakdown of our estimated costs for installing a 9-hole course follows:

8 Permanent Baskets + installation materials £1,650
50 rental discs £   400
Tee markers & Signs £   400
Tee bases £   450
Welcome/rules sign £   300
Information/Warning signs £   200
Scorecards £   400
Marketing £   200
Sub-total (money towards our project) £4,000
IndieGoGo Perks (rewards for donating) £1,280
IndieGoGo Fee (4% of £5,500) £   220
Total funds required £5,500

If we don't reach our funding target we will still use every penny we get to bring disc golf to Longford Park, making do with fewer holes.

But we think we can exceed our target! If we exceed our target we will buy more baskets, install more tees, run more community outreach days and make the course better. We have space for a full 18 holes, and eventually we want to raise enough money through crowdfunding and grants to build a brilliant 18 hole course, restore the land back to a more natural state, and make the course one of the best in the country. Let's see how far we can get!

Our Perks

Once you join our community of supporters, you can get some great perks to say thank you for your support! Have a look at our unique Manchester Disc Golf branded stuff, only available through this campaign!
Perks are expected to be dispatched early 2015 - there are lead times on production and delivery of custom items, we need to finalise artwork and wait for funds to following the end of the campaign. We'll email everyone updates of ETA when we have them! 

    The Impact

    We aren't just building a disc golf course, we are building a community! We hope that this project will attract people young and old to use Longford Park, and help everyone develop a feeling of ownership and responsibility for this community space for many years to come. Our new community group will provide opportunities to learn, play and enjoy one of the most accessible and interesting sports on the planet... for free!

    Disc golf is also great for the natural environment, and our course will bring a lot of improvement to a currently disused area in Longford Park. We don't require the huge areas of mown grass that regular golf courses do, and we have planned with Trafford Council how we will add more native trees and plants to encourage wildlife. 

    Disc golfers tend to be pretty community-minded people, so we expect that there will actually be less litter pollution  on the site than there currently is. We can make this site beautiful again!

    We need your help!

    We don't just need money. We also need enthusiastic people to PLAY disc golf, help us spread the word, and help us install and maintain the baskets and tees. If you think you can help in any way please sign up to our newsletter and Facebook group or get in touch with us.

    http://www.manchesterdiscgolf.co.uk/contact_us.aspx

    But most importantly please don't forget to SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN! With your help, we can make this happen!

story:
My colleague, Nicola Jordaan and I, would like to raise money for Gillian McCarthy, a customer of Suttons Consumer Products Ltd. After phone calls with her mother explaining the devastating effects Multiple Chemical Sensitivity has had on her daughter's life, we would like to help raise her money to go towards the renovation of her home, a small hut in the middle of a field.

Gillian currently lives on an organic farm, as anything to do with normal life effects her health. She lives without water and electricity and needs money to renovate the small  hut , as it is not suitable for her to live.

Please read her story; http://www.theguardian.com/theguardian/2008/jan/05/weekend7.weekend3

And watch the news story; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KF8eWp39eLw

We are aiming to raise £1000 for Gillian and her home, but if this goal is not reached, any amount will help towards this worthy cause.

Every little helps. so even if you can only afford to donate a very small amount, this will be a big step in reaching the goal we want to achieve.

story:
Hi!

My name is Garen Wolff and I am a second year medical student at Indiana University School of Medicine. Recently, I was accepted into the, Intensive Beginner Spanish & Healthcare Program in Quito, Ecuador. This program is sponsored by Child Family Health International (CFHI), a non-profit organization that has special consultative status with the United Nations (www.cfhi.org). The program will teach me medical spanish and expand my cultural horizons. During the 4 weeks in Ecuador, I will volunteer in hospitals, clinics, orphanages and schools. 

Besides being a medical student, I'm also a part-time, self-published author. My series, The Girlz of Galstanberry, focuses on 5 girls from different states, socio-economic backgrounds and ethnicities that become accepted into Galstanberry Girls Academy, a prestigious boarding school in Connecticut. 

My Goals

I need to raise $1,000 to pay for round-trip airfare to Quito, Ecuador and other necessary expenses, such as vaccinations, scrubs and gloves.

The Perks

Every Perk is berry-rific and affordable! They range from ShoutOuts, autographed books, to adorable tote bags. This campaign is a unique opportunity to get some great items at an unbeatable price!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, I understand. The NEXT best thing is to spread the word about my campaign to ANYONE!! My funds as a medical student are limited to none...really just none. So pleeeeeeeease spread the word to: Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Family
  • Friends
  • Co-Workers
  • Bloggers
  • Local Newspapers
  • Tweet or Facebook post my video or the link to this page

Every Perk is berry-rific and affordable! They range from ShoutOuts, autographed books, to adorable tote bags. This campaign is a unique opportunity to get some great items at an unbeatable price!
Other Ways You Can Help


If you can't donate, I understand. The NEXT best thing is to spread the word about my campaign to ANYONE!! My funds as a medical student are limited to none...really just none. So pleeeeeeeease spread the word to: Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Family
Friends
Co-Workers
Bloggers
Local Newspapers
Tweet or Facebook post my video or the link to this page

story:
Kristofer & Mackenzies Dream

Kristofer & Mackenzie have been living in the Gold Coast hinterlands of Australia for arround five years. Once joining the same highschool they realised they had a lot in common. Not long after both Kristofer & Mackenzie started Kung Fu (Tao Wu Shin) at a local monastery. This is what sparked both their interest in becoming fit, healthier human beings. Skip forward another year and they have decided they want to open a gym together.

People whom are willing to invest will help their dream greatly. Mackenzie already has the qualifications to be a personal trainer and this will help them tremendously on their journey. 

It doesn't matter if you donate one dollar or a thousand dollars, every single cent will help us purchase gym equipment and potentially rent / buy a vacant property for training people.

To help persuade people into donating we have decided to set ourselves a challenge. For every single dollar we raise we will complete one full heave, film it and upload it to YouTube for your enjoyment. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the rough outline and plan to what we intend to acheive:

  • We will be investing $4,500 of our own money towards gym equipment and locations.
  • We will be purchasing punching bags, kick pads, gloves, safety mats, weights and shinguards for our clients to use.
  • Each client will be charged a yearly fee of $120. That's simply $10 a month.

As breifly mentioned before Kristofer & Mackenzie will do one full heave for every single dollar donated. To make it clear how difficult heaves are: to get into the Marines you need to complete six full heaves. That means if we only get six dollars from this campaign we have the heave power of a Marine applicant.

All heaves will be recorded and posted on YouTube for all of you to watch and most probably enjoy.

The Impact

Health and Fitness is a major component of our lives and by donating a few dollars you are helping us reach our dreams. That's right; you as an individual can help and inspire people like us to acheive their goals in life.

Not only will you be helping Mackenzie and I you will be helping the local community get fit and also reach their goals. Imagine this as a spiral of good.. all started by a few dollars from you. You donate money to us, we get a cheap and sustainable fitness program running and the community benefits. It's a win / win situation for everyone.

 

We really hope you will be able to reach into your pockets and just donate a few dollars. Anything helps.. honestly.

story:
Transporter3D processes 2D & 3D video to be viewed on Oculus Rift


The Transporter3D is a device that supports the Oculus Rift by converting remotely transmitted video into a virtual reality experience called "telepresence". 

We have been designing and manufacturing telepresence equipment embraced by the FPV (first person video) community for over 6 years.  Starting with the 3D-Cam FPV in 2006, we pioneered the transmission of 3D video for RC aircraft pilots who fly from the ground wearing video glasses.

Over the years we pushed the telepresence technology further with force feedback joysticks (ForceFly) and aerial combat simulation systems (DogFighter).  When the Oculus Rift was born it was the obvious direction for FPV telepresence.  The Rift technology presented some challenges to adapt to conventional FPV equipment.  We set to work solving the problems, never compromising on our initially stated goals (see original project goals below) or on the quality that EMR Laboratories is known for.  Once we solved the big challenges we took to flight, ringing out the technology (think multi-rotor speeder bikes), studying the experience and revising the requirements.  We diverged from our normal development route and decided to crowd source the final design – asking the community what features would make them love the Transporter3D as much as we do.  Your input helped us get there and we listened to your suggestions.

The T3D is a crowd sourced design.  We want every one of the contributors to have the chance to experience the indescribable feeling of Oculus FPV.  By backing the project you get exclusive access to the T3D technology, you’re getting in at the ground level.  Backers will always be original backers and will be recognized for exclusive offers as they develop.


Original Project Goals

From the start our objective was to create an Oculus Rift interface designed for standard FPV/telepresence equipment.  The hardware solution had to meet these four key goals:

No perceptible latency: FPV users want the lag free experience they’ve come to expect from their analog systems.  Lag in multi-rotor speeder bikes turns a Jedi into a Storm Trooper.

Video formatting: To adapt to the Rift, the video needs to be completely adjustable.  Users need to be able to adjust the video screen size and position to exactly what they want.  Zooming and alignment modes are critical to using the Rift.  The T3D also needs to process the video without violating the latency rule.

Video stability: The hardware needs to cope with noisy video.  Analog FPV video is noisy at times.  The hardware needs to pass video regardless of how noisy it is and handle it gracefully (ie no blue screens)

Stereo Video:  The T3D needs to support stereoscopic 3D video to accommodate the capabilities of the Rift.

Once we met these goals we asked you what else you wanted to see in the final product.  You told us you wanted:

Support for different video modes:  Support for a 2D mode for the single camera, super wide field-of-view experience.  Other users asked for 3D support using two separate video inputs from separate video cameras.

Battery powered:  In-the-field operation is easier if the device can be powered by LiPo batteries.  Support for a wide range of input voltages with a connector that’s ideal for batteries.

Power the Rift: The T3D should also be capable of powering the Rift so that the system can be a complete video glasses solution for FPV.

Support for Cinemizers:  Make the T3D output also compatible with the Cinemizer glasses for users who already own these exceptional quality glasses and want the 3D FPV support.

Head Tracking:  The T3D should support the use of the Rift’s 1000Hz zero-drift head tracker to output head-tracking signals for controlling the camera pan, tilt and roll.


So we did it, the T3D is alive!

With the final goals on the drawing board we set out to make the hardware.  We designed it to support all the features you requested and moved the design from 3rd party development board to our own custom hardware.  The complex hardware design was a first-time-right success!

Transporter3D


T3D Technology

The T3D leverages an Altera Cyclone III FPGA (EP3C80F484C7N) for all its video processing.  The FPGA is programmable like a micro-processor except it’s actually the internal hardware that is being programmed.  This gives incredible speed, flexibility and power to achieve the T3D goals.  We’ve designed the T3D so that its internal hardware can be completely reconfigured simply by plugging in an identity module.  This future proofs the design and allows users to change the device functionality to suit their application.

The T3D can run on voltages from 6V-18V and total power consumption including the Rift is 6W.  For instance, with a 12V supply the T3D draws 0.5A.  Using a standard 3 cell, 2200mAh LiPo battery the T3D and Rift combo will last 4 hours.

The T3D supports 2D video, single channel encoded 3D video and dual channel 3D video for the ultimate resolution 3D experience.  To leverage the 3D capabilities we redesigned the 3D-Cam (T3D Edition) with higher performance sensors and T3D support for both single channel 3D and dual channel 3D video.  This gives camera package backers the ability to see 3D with their standard FPV system and provides the option to experiment with the ultimate dual channel 3D experience.

3D-Cam T3D Edition


Some users expressed interest in a case for the T3D.  We designed the T3D to fit into a custom machined case called the Transporter3D ‘Shuttle Craft’.  The case is sturdy protection for your T3D in the field.

Shuttle Craft Case

story:
Short Summary

On June 1, 2014 I, along with a team of 29 other young adults, will be cycling over 4000 miles from Baltimore, Maryland to Portland, Oregon in order to raise money for and awareness of the Ulman Cancer Fund for Young Adults.

The 4k for Cancer is a non-profit that raises money for the Ulman Fund and their support, education, and college scholarships for young adult cancer patients and survivors. A large portion of the money my team and I raise will actually go towards a college scholarship that we will hand deliver to its recipient.

What We Need & What You Get

As a member of the 4k for Cancer Portland team I am responsible for raising a minimum of $4,500 dollars. This money then goes towards support, education, and scholar ship programs for young adult cancer patients and survivors as well as the college scholarship that my team and I will be delivering along our cross country route. 

In an effort to raise this money I reached out to the Timbuk2 Company and they were great enough to donate one of their Classic Messenger Bags. Check out the pictures and video I made of it. Every $5 you donate gets you one entry into the Raffle and the Raffle winner will be selected during the first week of January. And every dollar of your donations will go towards the Ulman Cancer Fund and their work to help support young adult cancer patients and their families during their fight against cancer. Plus I've included a few other perks as well. 

By helping me, you become a part of my cross country journey and part of my inspiration for pedaling all the way to the West Coast. Those that make donations will receive a personalized postcard from me as I bike my way to Portland. I will also be writing their names on a poster board that I will bring with me on the trip and will take a photo with at every state line I cycle through. 

The Impact

At present, 70,000 young adults are diagnosed with cancer each year, affecting not just those diagnosed but also their families, friends, and loved ones. It is the goal of the 4k for Cancer to make sure that none of these people have to face their battle with cancer alone. Through support, education, and college scholarship programs, the 4k for Cancer and the Ulman Fund helps by improving the ability of young adults to manage their cancer experience and long-term cancer survival.

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember everyone: donations aren't the only way you can help me and my campaign. You can also help me by spreading the word about my cause to your friends and family.

story:
Moringa Tree - Smart Plan

I am Keith Davies, president of Lifestyle Ministries International in Canada.

Born in Durban South Africa, living in Canada and planting Moringa trees - called "The Tree of Life",  the world's most nutritious botanical!



In our Smart Plan, you will be starting Moringa tree nurseries in Haiti to reforest the country and improve the health of 9 million people. These fast growing trees grow one foot per month; in six months you have a mature six foot tree!

In our Smart Plan, we will grow 100,000 seedlings in a 12 month period!

and........

taste a delicious Moringa smoothie, eat a delicious blueberry Moringa muffin, smell the aroma of Strawberry or Pomegranate Moringa tea, use our Moringa calculator and take a journey with us in our photo book.These are some of our great perks!

Make your contribution. Together we can do this!

Moringa tree leaves are an incredible natural source of bio-available vitamins, beta-carotene, minerals, and amino acids essential to good health and vital to building the immune systems of the Haitian people.

Sample the health benefits in the perks!

Our Smart Plan is in partnership with Dr Franco who runs the Generations of Hope Orphanage and the Ministry of Humanities and Poverty in Haiti.

                         Dr Franco with a seedling in Haiti




The Smart Plan

Our SMART PLAN helps orphanages and other institutions to grow the 100,000 seedlings in Haiti. It is very simple.

  

  Plant 2000 seeds in 10 designated locations each month over a five month optimum growing period. Doing this each month we will have produced 100,000 seedlings!


   Buy back the seedlings from the designated growers with funds from large organizations who have already committed to raising funds for the Plan.

 

  Teach potential recipients the Moringa Training Course which will help them grow and nurture the plants, dry the Moringa leaves, use them in recipes and sell them in the market place.


The duration of this program in one year.


Growing these 100,000 trees in the SMART PLAN is done by the Haitian people assisted by a trained team of dedicated experienced young people and adults coming mainly from Canada and the US.

  

    

This is a realistic, achievable goal!

 

Plus...

 Money earned through growing trees in our "Buy Back Plan" will be used by orphanages towards their self-sustainable goals. An orphanage can earn $2000 per month growing 1000 trees!


We are not millionaires, but we can be part of planting seedlings in our 100,000 trees Smart Plan. ...... Plus you can sample Moringa Muffins, Moringa Smoothies and the aroma of our Moringa Tea in our Perks! ........ Plus, while you enjoy, you can read of our progress in the newsletter updates in our blog.

What will we do with the Moringa trees?


These trees will be planted throughout the land – some in the backyards of homes as a multivitamin medicine chest at their back door, others cultivated on farmland as a self-sustainable crop and others on hills and valleys to reforest the country. Products will be made and sold; the hills of Haiti will become alive with the sound of Moringa!

We are Ready! 

With seed.

With pilot projects

With people

With tools

  • We already have collected thousands of local seed using children across the country who earn pocket money collecting seed.
  • We have run a pilot program with better than expected results.
  • The Haitian Diaspora Association has already committed to raising money for the buyback program of Moringa trees.


Let's get started!


What We Need And What You Get!


We Need


• We need your investment to help launch the $60,000 Smart Plan

• This Smart Plan needs this money for seed gathering, potting bags, equipment, transportation, education, administration of the project, product development, on site visits and demonstrations.
• We need your help to change the lives of 9 million people especially malnourished children
• We need you to make an investment that will keep growing year after year


You Get

• You get Moringa Leaf Powder with Muffin and Smoothie Recipes
• Moringa Tea Variety Pack – eight flavours including: Strawberry, Pomegranate, Mint, Lemon, Ginger, Apple Cinnamon, Moringa,and Green Tea.
• You get a Moringa Calculator with the inscription to remind you of your investment.
• You get a photo book called “My Moringa Journey”

You Give

• Life giving vitamin trees to thousands of malnourished people.
• Moringa Calculators to orphaned children
• Heaven a reason to rejoice!

Your investment will keep growing!

These Moringa trees were planted in May. Four months later they are 6 feet (2 metres) tall!!!!
Two harvests of leaves were taken from these trees and used in scrambled eggs for the children in the orphanage seen in the above pictures.

The Impact


What difference does your contribution make?

To You

You will be part of a significant group of people who will be changing Haiti
You will taste Moringa Smoothies, Moringa Muffins and Moringa infusion teas which will enhance your health.
You will picture what this project is accomplishing in the photo book.
Using our calculator, you will be constantly reminded that you have a fast growing investment.


To the People in Haiti


Growing the trees will improve the health of thousands of people.
By establishing our Moringa tree nurseries, it will give institutions an opportunity
to provide funds to run their orphanages.
It will create self-sustainable businesses.
Growing the trees in Haiti will significantly enhance the environment where 97% of the trees have been destroyed.


      

Who Administers the Funds?

 
Funds will be paid to and administered by Lifestyle Ministries International, a registered Canadian charity.

Other Ways You Can Help


Please help us to get the word out about this campaign.
Email your friends – drive them to our funding site through  Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter and Google+
Share our campaign through your work colleagues and notice boards.
Have a party with Moringa Muffins and Moringa Smoothies!


If we do not succeed in attaining our goal for the Smart Plan, we will scale it down - but - if we do better we will:


•      Develop more Moringa health products and markets for the growers
•      Duplicate this Smart Plan in South Africa, Madagascar, and Mozambique!


Make this growing investment a success!


The Moringa Team


Keith Davies: Director of the Moringa Smart Plan Project
Dr. Franco: Director of the Go Haiti Moringa Project
Cheryl Terris:  Administration
Ren Dalton: IT Advisor
Rick Lawrence : Nation Hosting and Total Snap communications
Gill Davies: Moringa Muffin and Moringa Smoothie Recipes
Promotional Team: Paul Davies, Rachel Clark, Jacques West, Natalie West,
Wes Holmes, Ashley and Jay Richter, Robert Terris, Bear and Kathy Cherniawski,



Note: Perks shipping : free shipping for Canada and the USA and $10 for other countries.

To You 
You will be part of a significant group of people who will be changing Haiti You will taste Moringa Smoothies, Moringa Muffins and Moringa infusion teas which will enhance your health.You will picture what this project is accomplishing in the photo book.Using our calculator, you will be constantly reminded that you have a fast growing investment.To the People in Haiti 
Growing the trees will improve the health of thousands of people.By establishing our Moringa tree nurseries, it will give institutions an opportunityto provide funds to run their orphanages.It will create self-sustainable businesses.Growing the trees in Haiti will significantly enhance the environment where 97% of the trees have been destroyed.      Who Administers the Funds? 
  Funds will be paid to and administered by Lifestyle Ministries International, a registered Canadian charity.
Other Ways You Can Help 

Please help us to get the word out about this campaign. Email your friends – drive them to our funding site through  Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter and Google+Share our campaign through your work colleagues and notice boards. Have a party with Moringa Muffins and Moringa Smoothies!If we do not succeed in attaining our goal for the Smart Plan, we will scale it down - but - if we do better we will:•      Develop more Moringa health products and markets for the growers•      Duplicate this Smart Plan in South Africa, Madagascar, and Mozambique!


Make this growing investment a success!

The Moringa Team
Keith Davies: Director of the Moringa Smart Plan ProjectDr. Franco: Director of the Go Haiti Moringa ProjectCheryl Terris:  AdministrationRen Dalton: IT AdvisorRick Lawrence : Nation Hosting and Total Snap communicationsGill Davies: Moringa Muffin and Moringa Smoothie RecipesPromotional Team: Paul Davies, Rachel Clark, Jacques West, Natalie West,Wes Holmes, Ashley and Jay Richter, Robert Terris, Bear and Kathy Cherniawski,Note: Perks shipping : free shipping for Canada and the USA and $10 for other countries.

story:
Short Summary

My little sister lives in a cage of OCD and PTSD and could fall back/regress severely if her therapy isn't kept up. The NHS would put her on an extremely long waiting list and would not give her a child specialist and the private child specialist we found after her current psychiatrist has just retired is extremely expensive. Our medical insurance no longer covers mental health as it has been four years.

http://youtu.be/gGndhpZCqYY

My sister isn't comfortable with her face being shown on video and my family don't know I'm doing this but I can share this clip of one thing she enjoyed doing today:

http://youtu.be/r2PrTYNC_sQ

She has to always wear a coat or sweater because she is so embarassed by her extensive self-harm scarring on her arms. Today her OCD is also telling her that she has to go on tip-toes when she moves. She loves our dog Moose more than anything but has never been able to come out and walk him with us.

She gets some relief by drawing when her OCD lets her, that is what the campaign photo is.

What We Need & What You Get

Anything can make life more manageable for my parents and for my sister who is aware of the stress the cost of her therapy puts on the family. Not because anyone says it to her, but to put it simply she's an extremely bright girl and so understands what's going on around her.

The Impact

You'll be helping my sister on her path to being free and helping my parents survive more comfortably and with less of a "scrape" after this surprise increase in expense, I won't let them not take anything you give.


Other Ways You Can Help


Anywhere you can share this can help.


Anything you can do to raise OCD and PTSD awareness can help by improving public attitudes towards help.

story:
For 95 years BB Campers have called our magical camp their summer home. In 2015, we had 516 overnight campers at BB Camp – by far our largest year ever! Funds raised through #bbgives will provide the funding needed for financial aid for our growing camper population.  Our goal is simple – 200 gifts of $100! Can you help? Can you find friends to help?

Every donation, up to our $20,000 goal, will be matched by the Zidell Family. We thank them for this opportunity! Also, all new donations of $100 or more will be partially matched by the Harold Grinspoon Foundation.

Every donor of $108 or more will receive an exclusive "Can't Wait To See You Again" BB Camp T-shirt. 

We award over $163,000 in financial aid to BB Campers, making it possible for everyone to have the chance to experience the magic of BB Camp. Our average scholarship is $1,000 . . . . and you can sponsor an our of our #GivingTuesday campaign for $1,000.

Because of our growing number of Campers, there is more need than ever for financial aid dollars. Help us making 2016 the biggest and best summer yet!

story:
Hi we are Todd and Amy Vice from Westerville, Ohio.  Our passion and determination to make a difference in the community brought a thought to life and Camp Raw Studio was born June 1, 2013. We wanted to provide a fitness studio that fits into peoples lives on their terms with no catches or contracts. Our focus is  group fitness with a  variety of classes that are energized, fun and affordable.  We make sure to know and learn everybody's name as they walk through the door, creating a family friendly like atmosphere. 

Now, that we have passed the year mark of opening the doors, business is increasing and we are looking to raise awareness for current and new clients with New Fit Package deals. We have chosen Crowd Funding from Indiegogo to help us with this new transition into the future. Check out our New Fit Packages and find which Fit works for you.                                                                                              

                                                                                           Thank You 

                                                                                               and

                                                                                                 Join the Journey.

story:
Hi!

My name is Joel Salzman and I am a passionate golfer. I love the game and everything it entails and am constantly striving to improve my game and my enjoyment of the game. When a golfer sets up for his/her next shot, the most important factor that must be considered when selecting the appropriate golf club is the wind. Right now, the common practice to determine wind direction is to bend down, pick up a few blades of grass and throw them up in the air. Since I am over 50, bending down repeatedly isn't the most comfortable way to do it, nor is throwing grass in the air the most accurate. Often, a golfer will pick up too few blades or too many, so the process has to be repeated. An early morning or post rain round of golf will have you picking up wet grass and constantly wiping your hands on your pants.

Last summer, I was on the golf course on a par five hole and found myself within 215 yards from the green after my drive. With a good whack, that is a distance that is attainable for me but I needed to know what the wind was doing because of the water hazard in front of the green. If the wind was in my face, I wouldn't attempt it. I could feel the wind swirling around me but was unsure of which direction it was coming from. I looked at the flag on the green but it was hanging still because the green was completely shielded from the wind by the trees all around it. What did I do? I didn't go for it of course, and laid up to a safer distance. 

It was at that point that I told myself that there had to be a better way of finding out which way the wind is blowing, and how hard. Since then, I have been diligently working on a new product (It's a BREEZE!) that will revolutionize the golf industry. Not only will my product tell you exactly which way the wind is blowing, but it will also indicate whether the player should use one or two extra or one or two less club numbers to be able to hit the perfect shot.

Unfortunately, this has been / is a significantly expensive process and I have spent a lot of money so far. Patent lawyers, designers, engineers, materials, production molds etc. have put me in the position to solicit the help of others to be able to realize this dream. That's where this indiegogo campaign comes in. With your generous help, this product can hopefully be in the hands of golfers all over the globe within several months. 

The product has universal appeal for all levels of golfers, as well as a huge corporate tournament potential. My hope is that it will be able to retail for under $20. If you like the idea, I would be thrilled if you chose to contribute.

Ideally, this project needs in excess of $150,000 but I cannot expect to get everything for nothing so I am hoping to raise in the neighbourhood of $25,000. The greatest expenses are the production molds (approx. $100,000), followed by the legal fees for patents and trademarks. Whatever amount would still need to be raised after this campaign will have to be borrowed, but I am fully committed to seeing this project through to completion.

If you are a golfer, sports enthusiast, or someone that would derive satisfaction from knowing that your contribution helped bring an idea to the general public, please consider my project - your help means more to me that you'll ever know.

I know there are many of you reading this would love to help but personal budgets don't always allow it. I completely understand that. If I could ask a favour, could you please tell your contacts about it? Perhaps one of them may be in a better position to contribute. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to do so.

Sincerely,

Joel Salzman

story:
My Story

I finished High School just last year. Had 12 years of planning ready to go...but... I now face a set back. I look at it as one of life hurdles. And I'm sure I will face a lot more on my journey. It just sucks that this one is a biggy.

I have been diagnosed with DFSP.

Dermato-Fibro-Sarcoma Pro-Tuberans

Its a 1 in a million cancer and I need your help to raise the funds to remove it.


MOHS Surgery

I can get Wide Excision Surgery to have it removed but this is a very aggressive way of approaching this cancer. In some cases I can certainly understand that this might be the best option...but I'm 18 years old. If I can avoid brutal scars, I would like to.

The surgeons have said the scars will run from the top of my shoulder and down to my rib cage. It will be like a letter Z.

After much research we have found that MOHS surgery not only offers a better rate at Non re occurrence, but also much less scarring. They are only taking bits of me that are affected by cancer, instead of Wide Excision that takes a lot of healthy tissue. 

To learn more about MOHS Surgery please click on the following links.

Mohs on Wikpedia

Why MOHS Surgery is the way to go!


Fundraising

I don't have the funds to pay for this initial surgery. 

After the initial MOHS Surgery there is a chance that I will need Plastic Surgery, but this is all determined by what kind of area the DFSP cancer has affected. 

So I come here to ask for help.

Whatever change you can spare, I will be eternally grateful. If you can't help financially that's ok too. I only ask that you help by sharing my story. Share my link.


Paying It Forward

I simply can not thank everyone enough for any kind of help you have given me.

Whether it be donating money, praying for me, encouraging me or just sharing my story and link. I truly thank you all from the bottom of my heart.

I do want to pledge that every dollar more than I need for my medical costs will be paid forward to another DFSP sufferer. Someone that like me is having trouble paying their bills for the MOHS Surgery.


Please share my story.

Share my link.

Share your love.


Yours Truly,

Camellia

story:
A Nebraska court has scheduled a hearing for a protection order for my sons this Feb 13th.  Legal aid can't help me, and I have no lawyer to demonstrate the danger of sending my sons back to a household where they've been abused at least six times,* while their father can afford his own lawyer.


What We Need

This hearing could grant me emergency custody and shift jurisdiction from the boys' father's home state of Iowa to my home state of Nebraska:

  • The doctor who treated one of my sons in the emergency room the last time he was abused told me that I'd be reported for child endangerment if I gave my children back to their father.
  • My ex-husband got the Iowa courts to issue a warrant for my arrest if I didn't return my sons to him.
  • I need $2,500 to pay the retainer fees for a lawyer to represent me at my next hearing.

The Impact

Iowa Child Protective Services have documented six cases of abuse against my sons by their father and his girlfriend, who's being paid by the state to take care of them:

  • One of my sons is blind and has autism, the other has vision problems and is wheelchair-bound from cerebral palsy. They can't protect themselves from being kicked in the groin, or having hot sauce forcibly poured down their throats.
  • They have a loving home and a welcoming community here for them in Nebraska, and they're getting stronger now that they're getting enough to eat.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate today, please use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out!

* - http://indiancountrytodaymedianetwork.com/2014/01/17/thousands-sign-petition-asking-iowa-gov-help-abused-sioux-twins-153147
