story:
Introducing the


The Medical Activity App solves a problem, easily keeping track of medical and health related events for ourselves, and the people we care about.  There are so many things we have to remember to do each day that it is hard to keep track of everything.

Medical Activity App is a comprehensive digital record-keeping app for your personal medical information.

And we know you care, so it’s not just for you, but your entire family.  Medical Activity App is a perfect replacement for unreliable paper notes or various electronic systems that hold bits and pieces of your medical history.  From Blood Tests to Prescriptions, Medical Activity App is your personal easy to use health and medical recorder.

According to the World Health Organisation (WHO), Influenza (also more commonly known as the flu) is contracted globally by 20%-30% of adults and 5%-10% of children.  As the flu affects most people multiple times in their life and is quite common, this is just one of many situations where the Medical Activity App can be used to help with tracking care of a person(s) health.

Millions of people around the world suffer from short and long term illness, with some dependant on daily medications to prolong life and to reduce suffering.  It is quite challenging to keep track of all the medical activities.  The Medical Activity App takes care of record keeping, letting you and your doctor focus on treatment and getting well.

Currently the world's human population is 7.3 Billion and growing.  According to ITU 2015 ICT Facts and Figures, by end 2015, there would be more than 7 billion mobile cellular subscriptions.  That’s why we have chosen a technology stack that is available to a very large percentage of the population.  Additionally, we are making it free to help make valuable health tools accessible to people everywhere.



What Does Medical Activity App Do?

It Gives You Peace of Mind:

  • Track all your Medical Activities with ease
  • Keep track of all your medications and immunizations in one place



It Looks After You:

  • Easily record medical events for you, your family and friends



It Keeps You:

  • Informed, for yourself, your parents and near and dear ones
  • It allows you to keep critical and hard-to-remember information at hand all the time



It keeps you organized:

  • History of Medical Activities for yourself and your family members
  • Send your records to a doctor with the click of a button
  • Sharing your information has never been easier
  • Generate a report of all or part of your record and email it straightaway



Medical Activity App - Key Benefits


Track each time you:

  • Take prescription medicine;
  • Take non-prescription herbal or medicinal solutions
  • Log Physiotherapy exercises
  • Diabetic insulin injections
  • Applying drops, creams or ointments
  • Taking temperature or blood pressure or other readings
  • Changing bandages
  • Log any event from a treating medical professional


Other Tracking

Due to the app’s design, other non-medical activities can be logged, such as:

  • Exercise
  • Diet
  • Pet medical events such as tablets given, after all pets are part of the family too.
  • Fitness events
  • Activities to log for Psychiatrists, Psychologists and Counsellors

This versatility makes it easier for a larger audience to use this app as a tool to meet their daily needs.



The Medical Activity App - Key Features


App will be available for free on Android, and will be compatible with modern phones.

Some of the key features/highlights are:

  • Store health & medical related events for yourself, friends and family;
  • Keep critical and hard to remember medical information conveniently on your phone;
  • The email facility allows for quick export as a csv file for backup purposes or for sending to a medical professional. Sharing your medical information has never been easier.


Roadmap and Timeline

Here is the roadmap we are working on and expected delivery dates after successful funding is reached:


                            

About Me

I am an entrepreneur, technology evangelist who is passionate about using technology to bring positive social changes and to help people live better.  The aim of this project is to make useful health tools available to everyone, so that people have the resources to assist themselves and others they care for.

Stewart Campbell LinkedIn

Company Website: https://www.nebtrex.com



The Medical Activity App Angel Story

Earlier this year I was admitted to hospital for surgery.  After surgery I experienced the difficulty many people face of trying to keep track of many different pills and different health related activities that I needed to do. It was too easy to miss medications prescribed by my doctor.  Always trying to find solutions to problems, I went searching and was unable to find a solution to help me easily track medications and other health events, so I came up with a solution to address this and hence the Medical Activity App project was born.  Not content with implementing a solution for myself I wanted to make this available to everyone and to cater for a wide range of needs.  Additionally I wanted to make it freely available and not be hindered with in-app advertising, I believe everyone should have access to good healthcare tools no matter what their circumstances.

Being an IT practitioner for over 20 years, I decided to take advantage of technology to solve this problem by making a Medical Activity App mobile application which can store health and medical related data and events for yourself and for others you care for.  I wanted to ensure that it is a free app and accessible to all, it is easy to use and designed to run on smartphones.


Initially self funding the project to get it started, I am seeking assistance through this crowdfunding campaign to enable me to finish the Medical Activity App and make it available to everyone.

Like and share

History of Medical Activities for yourself and your family members
Send your records to a doctor with the click of a button
Sharing your information has never been easier
Generate a report of all or part of your record and email it straightaway



Medical Activity App - Key Benefits

Track each time you:

Take prescription medicine;
Take non-prescription herbal or medicinal solutions
Log Physiotherapy exercises
Diabetic insulin injections
Applying drops, creams or ointments
Taking temperature or blood pressure or other readings
Changing bandages
Log any event from a treating medical professional



Other Tracking
Due to the app’s design, other non-medical activities can be logged, such as:

Exercise
Diet
Pet medical events such as tablets given, after all pets are part of the family too.
Fitness events
Activities to log for Psychiatrists, Psychologists and Counsellors


This versatility makes it easier for a larger audience to use this app as a tool to meet their daily needs.

The Medical Activity App - Key Features


App will be available for free on Android, and will be compatible with modern phones.
Some of the key features/highlights are:

Store health & medical related events for yourself, friends and family;
Keep critical and hard to remember medical information conveniently on your phone;
The email facility allows for quick export as a csv file for backup purposes or for sending to a medical professional. Sharing your medical information has never been easier.


Roadmap and Timeline
Here is the roadmap we are working on and expected delivery dates after successful funding is reached:

                            
About Me
I am an entrepreneur, technology evangelist who is passionate about using technology to bring positive social changes and to help people live better.  The aim of this project is to make useful health tools available to everyone, so that people have the resources to assist themselves and others they care for.

Stewart Campbell LinkedIn
Company Website: https://www.nebtrex.com

The Medical Activity App Angel Story
Earlier this year I was admitted to hospital for surgery.  After surgery I experienced the difficulty many people face of trying to keep track of many different pills and different health related activities that I needed to do. It was too easy to miss medications prescribed by my doctor.  Always trying to find solutions to problems, I went searching and was unable to find a solution to help me easily track medications and other health events, so I came up with a solution to address this and hence the Medical Activity App project was born.  Not content with implementing a solution for myself I wanted to make this available to everyone and to cater for a wide range of needs.  Additionally I wanted to make it freely available and not be hindered with in-app advertising, I believe everyone should have access to good healthcare tools no matter what their circumstances.
Being an IT practitioner for over 20 years, I decided to take advantage of technology to solve this problem by making a Medical Activity App mobile application which can store health and medical related data and events for yourself and for others you care for.  I wanted to ensure that it is a free app and accessible to all, it is easy to use and designed to run on smartphones.

Initially self funding the project to get it started, I am seeking assistance through this crowdfunding campaign to enable me to finish the Medical Activity App and make it available to everyone.


Like and share

story:
• Short Summary – The Paul Uzzo Fund

My name is Anne Lofton I live with my husband and granddaughter. I am originally  from Chicago, Illinois. I was raised in Springfield, Missouri. I have five daughters one of which is no longer with us. I graduated from High School; I have attended college seeking a degree in Business. I am currently living in Henderson, Nevada.

My campaign is to raise funds for my son-in-law Paul who has bladder cancer. He was diagnosed with Stage ll bladder cancer March 2011, he had a radical cystectomy in April 2011. Following his surgery his urologist seen him every three months for a year. He never recommended nor suggested that Paul needed chemotherapy and/or radiation. Paul thought his surgery was successful until he became ill in February of 2013. He learned that the cancer had spread to his lung, adrenal gland and his right femur.

He has already completed radiation therapy and is now taking chemo therapy. These treatments have caused him to lose his appetite which has caused him to lose a tremendous amount of weight. He became very weak from not being able to eat solid foods. He now has a feeding tube to get liquid nourishment.  He also had to have a blood transfusion a couple of weeks ago due to his hemoglobin dropping to 7.3 because he was not getting any of the foods that provide him with iron. He is in constant pain from the radiation therapy; the pain medication is causing him to be constipated.

Paul has worked as a manager for USA Express Tire and Service in Lake Forest for many years; Paul has done such a spectacular job; he is admired by his employer, co workers and his customers. All of these people have been sending him get well cards, checks and cash.

Paul is a great family man that has family members who love him and need him around. Paul only has one child, Paul Jr. who  is a freshman in college. I’m certain that seeing his father being so ill bothers him but he tries to be strong when he comes home during school breaks. The past Thanksgiving and Christmas was the first in 18 years that they were not able to have dinner together since Paul Sr. was unable to eat and pretty much bed written. :( My family is praying daily, please unite with us.

The reason why this campaign is important to me is that Paul is a loving and caring husband, father and a good friend.

Together with others supporters you can save Paul’s life by helping him to get well. Please help us fight to win this battle. Your contribution will also relieve some of the stress from Paul’s family

What We Need & What You Get

Although he does have insurance which covers some of the cost; Paul has an urgent need right now to pay accumulated bills, Paul has a family he is supporting and he is currently unable to be at work. Even though he is receiving disability payments, which is extremely useful, but does not overpass the entire gap to meet his salary. Until he is able to go back to work, we can help lessen the added financial stress this is placing on him and his family.

To start we need $25,000 this will assist with Paul’s medical bills and help to maintain his household; all donations will be welcomed.



Wristband

story:
About Kara Lynn

Hi everyone! If you do not know me, I would appreciate it if you would take a few minutes to read about my campaign.

Who is Kara Lynn? Well, that's me! I am a 21 year old (turning 22 the day this campaign ends), transgender woman from Connecticut. I am currently a senior at a private university in Rhode Island, studying Fashion Merchandising & Retail Marketing. I began my transition from male to female when I was 16. I have lived full-time, as a woman, for over 3 years and have been on hormones for over 2 years. None of what I've experienced in the last 5 years would have been possible without the outpour of love and support from friends, family and fans.

Why lips?

I have been fortunate enough to have had a few procedures to take myself from a genetic male to a physical female. One procedure I have wanted since I was 14 years old was lip injections. I have always felt my lips were too small and never felt they fit my face. It is a procedure that I have overlooked for almost 10 years and I finally feel this is the right time. I know it would give me more confidence and make me a more beautiful woman, while improving my content and career as a model.

I have spent 3 months researching doctors in the Rhode Island and surrounding Massachusetts area and found a doctor that I am comfortable with. I have chosen her based on her extensive resume and her impressive before & after photos.

What's the goal?

  • The goal is set at $1,000. "Why so much?" you may be asking. As I'm sure you are aware, no medical procedure is cheap. The doctor I have chosen is slightly more expensive due to the recognition of her work and the fillers she uses.
  • As a professional model, I have many perks and rewards for each donation. This is such an important procedure for me to have and I feel it is equally important to show my appreciation to each contributor. Please take a look at the perks & rewards for more information. Rewards will be sent out and honored after the campaign has ended.
  • The campaign will end on December 10th, 2014. This is also my 22nd birthday. My goal is to hit the $1,000 goal by my birthday and to have the procedure shortly after, hopefully before the holidays.

The Impact

  • I have wanted this procedure for almost 10 years
  • It will help me continue my transition from male to female
  • I will feel more beautiful and be happier with my appearance
  • It will improve my confidence, yielding better movies and content for viewers

What if the money is not raised?

If the money is not raised, I will still continue to raise money on other social platforms to have this procedure as soon as possible. Perks and rewards will still be honored, regardless of whether or not the goal is met.

Please Help Spread The Word!

If you cannot contribute, please share this on your Facebook, Twitter or other social media accounts!

Anything you can donate or any promotions help and are extremely appreciated!

For more information about me or to hear more about my work, please follow me on Twitter at https://www.twitter.com/karalynn987

story:
IT'S A GAME CHANGER

78% of men age 15 - 34 do some sort of grooming below the neck.  It’s now standard among young athletes - cross fitters, bodybuilders, MMA fighters, triathletes, runners & swimmers - and virtually everyone who just wants to look their best and show off their muscle tone or tattoos. Regardless of this trend, the market has remained void of a masculine solution that really works.

Shaving? Tons of work and only lasts a day or two. Waxing? Expensive, painful and embarrassing. Hair removal creams? They're rebranded women’s lines stripped of all the important ingredients that care for the skin. This leaves us dry and prone to irritation. We work hard and play hard, but we like our skin soft. So why none of the good stuff for us?

As a lifelong athlete myself I’ve dealt with all kinds of hair removal issues and I became determined to solve this problem. I shaved - like most - and I was constantly stubbly, maintaining every second day. Insane, right?  I was too embarrassed to set up a waxing appointment, so I tried waxing kits and removal creams. They all had limitations. Stinky, painful, messy, limitations. And my wife? She loves me, but not so much getting rid of my back hair. I always thought it brought us closer together…Didn’t it?

I'd finally had enough, and I wasn't alone.

This is why I teamed up with Andrew (the product guru in our video) to create SmoothTech|Pro. The first ever men's hair removal system specifically formulated to remove unwanted body hair and keep it from growing back.

THE SMOOTHTECH|PRO SYSTEM

Our triple action, full body hair removal system not only removes unwanted hair, it restores moisture and reduces new regrowth leaving the skin smoother longer. It's easy, effective, pain free and long lasting. That means super smooth results (no more sandpaper ladies) and less maintenance. And for the back? We developed WINGMAN. Our applicator that enables men to remove back hair unassisted. It’s a game changer.

HERE'S HOW THE SYSTEM WORKS

STEP 1: ELIMINATE | Shower Off Hair Removal Lotion

Removes body hair quickly, easily and painlessly. All natural ingredients, paraben, fragrance, petrolatum, sulfate & cruelty free.

'Eliminate' Key Benefits:
   •   Removes unwanted hair & impurities
   •   Restores moisture
   •   Fights free radicals
   •   Exfoliates
   •   Fights hard water damage

STEP 2: REDUCE  | Regrowth Minimizer
This topical solution helps fight new hair growth by disrupting cellular division at the root. All natural ingredients, paraben, fragrance, petrolatum, sulfate & cruelty free.

'Reduce' Key Benefits:
   •   Helps impair new hair growth
   •   Hydrates skin with water magnet and NMF technology
   •   Helps reduce damaging TEWL (Trans Epidermal Water Loss)
   •   Helps promote new healthy skin cell growth  

WINGMAN  |  Back Applicator
Featuring a folding handle for easy storage and travel, this tool for do-it-yourself back hair removal makes hard to reach places a thing of the past.

PERFORMANCE ENHANCERS
Men's skin is different than women's so we've developed performance enhancers to address skin challenges men face.

SCRUB  | Ultimate Power Wash
Professional grade body wash developed to rid the skin of impurities while neutralizing and hydrating at the same time.

PREVENT  | Ingrown & Blemish Prevention
A professional grade treatment to help fight ingrown hair, irritation and other skin challenges.

NO LIMITS

Unlike lasers, SmoothTech|Pro™ is safe and effective on all skin tones

…and all hair colors.


WHAT WOMEN REALLY THINK



LADIES CAN FEEL THE DIFFERENCE



HERE'S WHAT OUR TESTERS ARE SAYING

“Honestly, this is the best hair removal product that I’ve ever used. I  can’t believe the way it makes my skin feel.  I’ve been recommending it to everybody since I was first introduced to it. I’ve completely switched over to SmoothTech|Pro™ even though my wife is an esthetician. It’s just easier this way.”    
- Darren C., Los Angeles, CA

"My first reaction was amazement.  I mean it really feels like a professional wax, I mean really. This is my new discovery and it saves me so much time."
- Terry W., Lubbock, TX

"My experience was extremely easy and painless. The products are ideal for anyone searching for a hair removal product that works! "
- Hunter C., Chattanooga, TN

"I didn’t think the product would work as well as it did. I was curious and worried how it would affect my tattoos but I was very pleased. I would very much so recommend this product."
- Nick J., San Antonio, TX

"I liked using the entire SmoothTech|Pro™ system. The eliminate lotion was a breeze to apply with the included spatula and Wingman applicator. I left the lotion on for only 6 minutes before trial scrapes with the spatula revealed loose hairs. After a quick rinse in the shower, I noticed a clean, smooth and odorless skin surface I hadn't seen before with shaving. A top notch product all the way. I will definitely be recommending the SmoothTech|Pro™ system! I have many gym buddies that are looking for an easy alternative to shaving their body hair. Once they experience the results, I'm confident they will become lifetime customers."
- Mo R., Pacific Palisades, CA

THE RESULTS SPEAK FOR THEMSELVES



QUALITY ASSURANCE

Experience and a long history of bringing quality products to market has enabled us to team up with the very best. Our manufacturing lab partner develops men’s cream solutions for one of the nation’s largest pharmaceutical retailers ensuring the highest quality products and quality controls. We’re paraben, fragrance, sulfate, petrolatum and cruelty FREE! Even our labels are printed in a wind powered, green facility.

OUR FOUNDERS

Andrew Lofts  | Managing Partner,  Co-Founder

Andrew is considered the go to guy when it comes to marketing and branding consumer goods. He has an impressive corporate history having worked with Pfizer UK, Colgate Palmolive UK, Kraft Foods, Max Factor and Gillette (Jafra Cosmetics Inc.) to name a few. He has held key consulting and ownership roles for several health and beauty brands and has a successful track record with launching and expanding new brands internationally. Andrew is an animal lover and without his glasses, he bares a striking resemblance to Bill Pullman.

Eric Brooks  | Managing Partner, Co-Founder

Eric is a Virgin Group groomed alumni with a proven ability to identify and capitalize on market opportunities. He has worked with athletes and iconic artists like Method Man, Ice Cube, Dr. Dre, Prince, Pharrell Williams, Lenny Kravitz and Janet Jackson to name a few. He also co-founded a clothing line with Hall of Fame basketball player Dominique Wilkins, working with Zach Randolph, Kenny Anderson and others. Eric is best known for re-launching “NOW” music compilations in the US market over 15 years ago. Still going strong today, it is considered one of the most successful compilation series of all time.  Eric is very athletic and enjoys being a smooth guy (at least he thinks he is). He holds a B.A. in Business and Music Theory Composition from the University of Miami. He now enjoys racing cars and being able to remove his own back hair unassisted.

FAQs

How Can I order SmoothTech|Pro™?

The only way to currently order is through our Indiegogo page here! If you back this project on Indiegogo you’ll be able to save up to 40% off retail.

Why is your hair removal lotion better than the leading Men’s Cream?

Current leading men’s removal creams are single action, meaning they only remove hair.  They're stripped of all the beneficial skin care ingredients and their formulations are engineered for women’s skin. This is problematic because the chemical that breaks down the keratin in the hair also breaks down the water band keratin in the skin. Over time this damages the skin and can lead to major issues or even a chemical burn. SmoothTech|Pro™ incorporates specific ingredients that create a barrier and prevent damage to the epidermal layer. Our second step refines, hydrates and soothes the skin while also reducing both TEWL (Trans epidermal water loss) and new regrowth. Our formulation is also ph balanced for men because our skin is different from women’s and it therefore requires different ingredients.

Are your products safe and natural?

All our products are made with natural and naturally derived ingredients including key humectants and vitamins that condition and promote healthy skin.  We’re Cruelty, Paraben, Fragrance, Sulfate and Petrolatum FREE! Even our labels are wind powered printed in a Green facility.

Can you ship internationally?

We plan to ship to all locations worldwide. For international shipping we have determined a median cost of $20 but in some cases we may require additional fees. In the event that this happens you will be contacted after the campaign closes and given the opportunity to continue with your order. We appreciate your understanding if this occurs, we simply have no way of predicting international shipping fees for all territories.

What about shipping to Hawaii, Alaska and Puerto Rico?

We do ship to these location but USPS considers these locations overseas so they do require international shipping fees

I forgot to include shipping on my original order. What do I do now?

It’s pretty easy to adjust your pledge, just go to the manage pledge function and you can adjust it there.

What about shipping to an APO address?

APO shipping is a bit difficult to get right, but we are working on it. If you want our products, just back one of the options to lock in your order number. We will then reach out to you prior to the campaign close to give you accurate shipping costs to make sure before we ship your product(s).

Are you really going to deliver by January?

We plan to ship no later than the end of January but in the event that we have large numbers we'll begin shipping in the order pledges were received. We don’t foresee any lead time problems but during the New Year there can be delivery challenges due to weather and logistical problems.  We will do our very best to get product to you as fast as possible.

Is this product made in the USA?

All of our formulations, design, production and fulfillment are done here in the USA. 'PREVENT', our award winning formula, was developed in Montreal Canada through one of our strategic partners but is produced here in the USA.


TIMELINE

  • October: Launch Prefundia page, website splash page and social media outreach.
  • November: Launch Indiegogo campaign and make lots of new friends, connect with influencers.
  • December: Finalize website and test custom subscription software, finalize distribution and fulfillment processes.
  • January/February: Manufacture, ship products and rewards to our Indiegogo participants.

STATUS

We’ve sourced our partners & experts and SmoothTech|Pro's unmistakable results have been proven. 40+ case studies were conducted on testers with different hair colors and skin tones producing excellent results, positive feedback and zero incidents of irritation or other issues. We’ve set up our logistics and support team for future fulfillment and we’ve done our initial test run. Our website is being developed to include a feature that will enable us to automatically refill products for our customers based on their individual hair removal needs. Excitement is building and fitness communities are buzzing in anticipation of SmoothTech|Pro's launch.

So, what's missing? You! We need you to help us spread the word about SmoothTech|Pro™ and support us on Indiegogo so we can raise funds needed to take this to the next level. Your support will help us greenlight the next manufacturing run, finalize the e-commerce website, implement social media marketing, expand product development, ship your Indiegogo rewards and make SmoothTech|Pro™ available to all the men out there in need of revolution.

Thank you so much – we truly appreciate your help.

ANDREW LOFTS & ERIC BROOKS 
Co-Creators of SmoothTech|Pro™

Our manufacturing lab partner develops men’s cream solutions for one of the nation’s largest pharmaceutical retailers ensuring the highest quality products and quality controls. We’re paraben, fragrance, sulfate, petrolatum and cruelty FREE! Even our labels are printed in a wind powered, green facility.
OUR FOUNDERS


Andrew Lofts  | Managing Partner,  Co-Founder



Andrew is considered the go to guy when it comes to marketing and branding consumer goods. He has an impressive corporate history having worked with Pfizer UK, Colgate Palmolive UK, Kraft Foods, Max Factor and Gillette (Jafra Cosmetics Inc.) to name a few. He has held key consulting and ownership roles for several health and beauty brands and has a successful track record with launching and expanding new brands internationally. Andrew is an animal lover and without his glasses, he bares a striking resemblance to Bill Pullman.




 
Eric Brooks  | Managing Partner, Co-Founder



Eric is a Virgin Group groomed alumni with a proven ability to identify and capitalize on market opportunities. He has worked with athletes and iconic artists like Method Man, Ice Cube, Dr. Dre, Prince, Pharrell Williams, Lenny Kravitz and Janet Jackson to name a few. He also co-founded a clothing line with Hall of Fame basketball player Dominique Wilkins, working with Zach Randolph, Kenny Anderson and others. Eric is best known for re-launching “NOW” music compilations in the US market over 15 years ago. Still going strong today, it is considered one of the most successful compilation series of all time.  Eric is very athletic and enjoys being a smooth guy (at least he thinks he is). He holds a B.A. in Business and Music Theory Composition from the University of Miami. He now enjoys racing cars and being able to remove his own back hair unassisted. 
FAQs
How Can I order SmoothTech|Pro™?
The only way to currently order is through our Indiegogo page here! If you back this project on Indiegogo you’ll be able to save up to 40% off retail. 
Why is your hair removal lotion better than the leading Men’s Cream?
Current leading men’s removal creams are single action, meaning they only remove hair.  They're stripped of all the beneficial skin care ingredients and their formulations are engineered for women’s skin. This is problematic because the chemical that breaks down the keratin in the hair also breaks down the water band keratin in the skin. Over time this damages the skin and can lead to major issues or even a chemical burn. SmoothTech|Pro™  incorporates specific ingredients that create a barrier and prevent damage to the epidermal layer. Our second step refines, hydrates and soothes the skin while also reducing both TEWL (Trans epidermal water loss) and new regrowth. Our formulation is also ph balanced for men because our skin is different from women’s and it therefore requires different ingredients.
Are your products safe and natural?
All our products are made with natural and naturally derived ingredients including key humectants and vitamins that condition and promote healthy skin.  We’re Cruelty, Paraben, Fragrance, Sulfate and Petrolatum FREE! Even our labels are wind powered printed in a Green facility. 
Can you ship internationally? 
We plan to ship to all locations worldwide. For international shipping we have determined a median cost of $20 but in some cases we may require additional fees. In the event that this happens you will be contacted after the campaign closes and given the opportunity to continue with your order. We appreciate your understanding if this occurs, we simply have no way of predicting international shipping fees for all territories. 
What about shipping to Hawaii, Alaska and Puerto Rico?
We do ship to these location but USPS considers these locations overseas so they do require international shipping fees
I forgot to include shipping on my original order. What do I do now?
It’s pretty easy to adjust your pledge, just go to the manage pledge function and you can adjust it there. 
What about shipping to an APO address? 
APO shipping is a bit difficult to get right, but we are working on it. If you want our products, just back one of the options to lock in your order number. We will then reach out to you prior to the campaign close to give you accurate shipping costs to make sure before we ship your product(s). 
Are you really going to deliver by January? 
We plan to ship no later than the end of January but in the event that we have large numbers we'll begin shipping in the order pledges were received. We don’t foresee any lead time problems but during the New Year there can be delivery challenges due to weather and logistical problems.  We will do our very best to get product to you as fast as possible. 
Is this product made in the USA?
All of our formulations, design, production and fulfillment are done here in the USA. 'PREVENT', our award winning formula, was developed in Montreal Canada through one of our strategic partners but is produced here in the USA.
TIMELINE


October: Launch Prefundia page, website splash page and social media outreach.

November: Launch Indiegogo campaign and make lots of new friends, connect with influencers.

December: Finalize website and test custom subscription software, finalize distribution and fulfillment processes.

January/February: Manufacture, ship products and rewards to our Indiegogo participants.

STATUSWe’ve sourced our partners & experts and SmoothTech|Pro's unmistakable results have been proven. 40+ case studies were conducted on testers with different hair colors and skin tones producing excellent results, positive feedback and zero incidents of irritation or other issues. We’ve set up our logistics and support team for future fulfillment and we’ve done our initial test run. Our website is being developed to include a feature that will enable us to automatically refill products for our customers based on their individual hair removal needs. Excitement is building and fitness communities are buzzing in anticipation of SmoothTech|Pro's launch.So, what's missing? You! We need you to help us spread the word about SmoothTech|Pro™ and support us on Indiegogo so we can raise funds needed to take this to the next level. Your support will help us greenlight the next manufacturing run, finalize the e-commerce website, implement social media marketing, expand product development, ship your Indiegogo rewards and make SmoothTech|Pro™ available to all the men out there in need of revolution.Thank you so much – we truly appreciate your help.ANDREW LOFTS & ERIC BROOKS Co-Creators of SmoothTech|Pro™

story:
The Hope For Stability: Conquering Bipolar II

Bipolar disorder is an debilitating mental illness with an appalling lack of resources for those suffering through a "manic/depressive episode". Maintaining a state of stability is a lifelong battle I fully accept.  For more than a year I have been in a "mixed cycle" of relentless mania overlapping with devastating depression. To put things in perspective: a manic/depressive episode typically lasts 1-3 months until medication induces mental stability. I have been consumed with all the classic symptoms for 18 months.  Every day continues to be an unknown gamble of mental states.

My name is Jessica, I am freshly 25 years old and desperate for a chance to regain my life, my identity, my soul. Cursed with type II bipolar disorder it is a constant battle for stability.  With the traumatic symptoms come a forced inner strength molded by a fight-or-flight perspective. In spite of this disorder, I have an unyielding passion for life. I followed my childhood dream and graduated from the Culinary Institute Of America (Greystone, Napa Valley) with an associates degree in baking & pastry. I have since dedicated myself to working in Michelin Star restaurants and studying under world champion chefs evolving, learning, and growing. I am obsessive about my passions for pastry, art, and introspective growth. The sublime opportunities and experiences I cherish have made the fall to rock-bottom infinitely more devastating.

During culinary school, I experienced my first "hypo-manic/depressive state." An acute version of a full-blown "episode" I was ripped from reality without warning. It took me 3 months to find the right medication but I finally became stable, graduated, and worked tirelessly to be the best at what I do (mainly desserts). When I began to tumble towards mania once again, I tried the mood stabilizers that had worked in the past; this time around I began what was to be the most traumatic time of my life including demonic hallucinations. My symptoms became increasingly severe.  Maintaining composure at work was both an glimmer of normalcy and mentally asphyxiating.  Desperate for help and with limited funds, I tried finding a close doctor who was physically close and covered by my insurance.  I followed his regiman and tried all the medications suggested.  Nine months later, I found myself in the care of a doctor who had thrown 8 intense medications at me, claimed to be counseling me through this distortion of reality.  My trust was shattered and I was in worse shape than ever.   His malpractice spun me to a dimension I hadn't even fathomed possible. I've lost nearly all grasp on reality, become suicidal, resigned from my job, and made my husband take a medical leave from work to be my legal caretaker. 

Loosing control of myself has been the hardest lesson life has thrown at me, and I'm struggling to fully learn how to be myself again. My mother and brother have moved in with my husband and I for emotional and financial support. As I stew in a toxic shell of self, pressure mounts for my husband to return to work. I have been a victim of the Social Security process for months.  Trying to qualify for disability benefits while fighting for my life and I am still in the waiting line. Every moment is so unpredictable, I am unable to drive, make doctor's appointments, shop at a supermarket, I even rely on my husband to feed me my morning and nightly medications.

One thing I have learned is there is no option but to fight. Having abundant manic energy most days, I have tried to provide some source of income by selling online. While I have managed to "stay afloat" with the help of my family, eBay can't replace a steady income. My husband and I have a business plan for a local shipping store, but can't qualify for a loan mostly because I restrict him from earning a steady paycheck.  Undaunted, we never stop searching every avenue to make our life work. My younger brother has stayed home as well to mediate my violence or suicidal behavior when I have drained my husband dry.   Needless to say, money is scarce.

Fortunately, I am under the care of a knowledgeable doctor in the treatment of bipolar disorder to help me titrate off the obscene amount of medications I was prescribed.   But he is two hours away and not covered by my insurance.  I have to pay for COBRA since I have not been accepted by Social Security.

Months of searching has left me with two options: admit myself to the hospital, or seek the ONLY outpatient program accessible to me.  My goal and inspiration for recovery is that within the 45 days of this campaign I will have seen at least a glimmer of improvement; maintaining stability as a concept has become foreign to me. If I can raise $1,000 it will provide me 10 days of intensive outpatient care, an opportunity I know is necessary yet currently impossible. This program would lift the spirits of my entire family just for the hope of recovery and rehabilitation from this incredibly damaging ordeal. More importantly, it would allow me to recover from the depths of despair and return to normalcy.  Without this program, when my husband goes back to work, even part-time,  I am certain it will shatter my mental state all over again.

This program will go a long way in giving me the skills and support to begin my life again.  I haven't talked to any of my friends other than co-workers for 2 years. Once my complete obsession and passion, in my current condition I can't cook for myself.  

I'm trying to make as much money as possible selling my things online to pay the bills; now I need to turn to your generosity. Paying for prescriptions, doctor's visits, not to mention a roof over our head is becoming nearly impossible for me and my family, who have sacrificed immensely to support me however they can.

Your donations are my opportunity to come out of this nightmare alive, thirsty to thrive once again.  I drew the picture above in pastels, years ago during a brief anxiety attack. I titled it "conquer your mind" as a reminder of how powerful one's will can be; instead of taking anxiety medications I broke free through that drawing. When my illness began to flare, I drew the second picture as an expression of my engulfing hopelessness (titled manic depression.)  Life can be beautiful again.  I can't imagine yearning for anything more than a chance to stabilize myself and be rid of the toxicity my many medications cause. If you have ever seen light in darkness, if you have ever profoundly found yourself, I implore you to lend a helping hand. I'm banking (no pun intended) on the universe showing me some relief in the form of your generosity. I am sincerely grateful that you have even taken the time to hear my story. It isn't just for me that I ask for your support, my husband, my mom, my brother, even my cat all have endured enough. Bipolar disorder is insidious; it inflicts tremendous pain on me and simultaneously I strike primal fear in those who know and love me most. If nothing else, I hope those of you who read this far will have a heightened awareness of the severely lacking resources available for relief from mental illness. Please, your donations will be life changing.

story:
Our Mission:

No Mirror Movement is a San Francisco-based nonprofit dedicated to getting children and adults out of the mirror and back into their bodies. We use dance as a tool to develop self-worth, promote body acceptance, and challenge deeply held myths of beauty and health.

After struggling with and recovering from her own decade-long eating disorder, Founder and CEO Samantha Ethridge saw a monumental need in her community for mindfulness skills and accurate health information, as well as build a strong foundation of acceptance and compassion in order to empower everyone, especially dancers, to live fully expressed and holistic healthy lives - free from self-destructive thoughts and disordered eating and exercise habits.

No Mirror Movement believes that when we #DitchTheMirror and #ChooseLove we can be our most authentic selves, ready to connect with our communities and empowered to lead lives full of joy and purpose.

 

Why Body Image Matters:

  • 75 million people worldwide struggle with a diagnosable eating disorder.
  • This includes 20 million women and 10 million men in the United States alone.
  • Millions more go untreated because of social stigma and misunderstandings of what “counts” as disordered thoughts and eating/exercise habits.

This study also shows how excessive exercise is prevalent across the main types of eating disorders (anorexia, bulimia, binge-eating, EDNOS)

*Learn More Myths Debunked Here*

 

Why Early Prevention Is Essential:

 

  

 

The WHO defines Mental health as "a state of well-being in which every individual realizes his or her own potential, can cope with the normal stresses of life, can work productively and fruitfully, and is able to make a contribution to her or his community."

THIS is our goal. This is our work. This is what our curriculum for any age, but especially youth, is geared towards. 

Creating a strong foundation of self-worth and positive body image at a young age is essential for developing into a resilient, empathetic, and joyous adult, who is able to manage life challenges and live life to it's fullest.

If young people gain the following skills and competencies, they will be able to follow their heart, develop their minds, and build meaningful relationships:

  • Every human has intrinsic worth. Full stop.
  • Every BODY is different and every BODY is beautiful and strong in it's own way.
  • Everyone has baggage, challenges and experiences pain. When we choose to be vulnerable and share that pain with others, we build our empathic skills and connect as humans.
  • Happiness isn't the goal. The goal is to FEEL everything: the good, the bad, the neutral. To live a full life not afraid of our emotions, but in honor of them.
  • Everyone has a purpose in life. You will find it and you will be successful.
  • You must love yourself unconditionally in order for others to love you the same.
  • Everyone is worthy of love.
  • There is no such thing as "good" or "bad" foods. Practice intuitive eating to be balanced.
  • There is no such things as a "ballet body" a "beach body" or an "in shape body." There is just your body.

Our Founder’s Story:

Our Branches of Impact:

No Mirror Movement is comprised of three community-oriented branches of impact:

Dance+Wellness Intensives:

The only integrative curriculum of its kind in the Bay Area provides top-notch dance training (street and classical styles) with wellness workshops (intuitive eating, meditation, body acceptance) to all ages, with a key focus on middle school and high school years.

Our work is founded in the knowledge that early prevention works. Our program aims to help students grow leaps and bounds not just as dancers, but as whole people leading a life full of joy, connection, and self-expression.

Going On a Dance Workouts:

High energy, fun, positive, and inclusive roving dance parties around the parks of San Francisco. Our classes are for all-ages and work on strengthening the "I don't give a f*** muscle."

Workouts help build confidence, body-acceptance, cardio stamina and a sense of community. They are twice a month and change locations.

Professional Dance Collective:

Curates art that comments on and challenges society's messages on how we "should" relate to our bodies, and hence how we develop self-worth. Our dance style is a fusion of hip-hop, contemporary, and waacking, tells stories that shine light on the taboo subjects of mental illness and body image.

What We Need & What You Get:

We are raising $30,000 through Indiegogo to support our youth dance+wellness workshops, professional dance company, and operational and staffing costs of running a nonprofit.

[Youth Workshops = supplies, teachers, space; Dance Company = travel, rehearsal space, choreographers; Staff = outreach, fundraising, media; Operations = insurance, legal fees, marketing]

We hope to have 10 free workshops for youth this winter and spring to:

  1. Serve communities that cannot afford a workshop or have cut the arts from their school budgets
  2. Spread awareness of our name and curriculum to increase sign ups for our summer programs

We have SO MANY amazing perks that we can’t wait to giveaway to our supporters to help us in achieving our vision and growing this #ditchthemirror movement.

Here are pictures of just a few!

Supporter Badge for Facebook

 

Four No Mirror Movement Sticker Choices

 

Going On a Dance Class Passes

 

Picnic In the Park with No Mirror Movement Dance Company:

 

Tickets to No Mirror Movement End of Year Showcase

Surprise Flashmob Performance! (only available in San Francisco Bay Area)

 

No Mirror Movement Party Box

 

A Day out in San Francisco and a one-on-one dance class with our dance company

 

If we don’t reach our entire goal we will still use 75% of the funds for our youth workshops and 25% for operational costs.

No Mirror Movement is a registered 501(c)(3) so all contributions are tax deductible! Many companies match donations if you show them the emailed receipt of your donation and give them our EIN: 81-3876067 - please consider checking if your company does this!

story:
the cause  

At Ophelia’s Place, we dream of people celebrating their bodies, not bashing them; of choosing health at every size, not diets and unreal body ideals.

We dream of people relating to their bodies as their instrument to be of purpose and service in the world, not an object to be criticized, scrutinized, and sexualized.

  • Over 50% of females between the ages of 18-25 would prefer to be run over by a truck then be fat. (Gaesser, G., 1996, Big Fat Lies)
  • Over the past three decades body image concerns for men have increased from 15% to 43%.  https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/statistics-males-and-eating-disorders
  • 3 out of 4 women have disordered eating. http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2008/04/080422202514.htm

our work

For 13 years, we’ve been providing support, treatment, education, and community for individuals and families impacted by eating disorders, disordered eating, and body dissatisfaction.

  • 50-75 individuals and families are supported each week
  • Thousands are reached each year
Providing support and treatment to those suffering from eating disorders is critical, and so is preventing them in the first place.

a revolution

Circles of Change is our movement to change the culture and conversation around health, beauty and body image. We believe change first starts with ourselves and then within our own circles of influence.

This is why we’re actively bringing Circles of Change events to communities across the country. They are about empowerment. They are educational. And they are transformational. 




warriors for change

Your contribution to Ophelia’s Place this Giving Tuesday is critical for us to continue this work. Whether you’re able to give today, on a monthly basis, or by simply sharing our story through social media to help change the conversation, we are deeply grateful.

$10,000 will:

  • Support the daily services of Ophelia's Place.
  • Share our mission through events and workshops in Arizona.
  • Expand Circles of Change to communities across the country.

Join us, and others, in this revolution. We are Warriors for Change.

the cause  
At Ophelia’s Place, we dream of people
celebrating their bodies, not bashing them; of choosing health at every size,
not diets and unreal body ideals. 
We dream of people relating to their bodies
as their instrument to be of purpose and service in the world, not an object to
be criticized, scrutinized, and sexualized. 

Over 50% of females between the
ages of 18-25 would prefer to be run over by a truck then be fat. (Gaesser, G.,
1996, Big Fat Lies)

Over the past three decades body
image concerns for men have increased from 15% to 43%.  https://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/statistics-males-and-eating-disorders


3 out of 4 women have disordered eating. http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2008/04/080422202514.htm


our workFor 13 years, we’ve been providing support,
treatment, education, and community for individuals and families impacted by
eating disorders, disordered eating, and body dissatisfaction. 

50-75 individuals and families are supported each week
Thousands are reached each year

Providing support and treatment to those suffering from eating disorders is critical, and so is preventing them in the first place.
a revolutionCircles of Change is our movement to change
the culture and conversation around health, beauty and body image. We believe
change first starts with ourselves and then within our own circles of
influence.
This is why we’re actively bringing Circles
of Change events to communities across the country. They are about empowerment.
They are educational. And they are transformational. warriors for changeYour contribution to Ophelia’s Place this
Giving Tuesday is critical for us to continue this work. Whether you’re able to
give today, on a monthly basis, or by simply sharing our story through social media to help change the conversation, we are deeply grateful. $10,000 will:
Support the daily services of Ophelia's Place.
Share our mission through events and workshops in Arizona.
Expand Circles of Change to communities across the country.
Join us, and others, in this revolution. We
are Warriors for Change.

story:
Business plan for a new and innovative subscription box focused on offering dairy free alternatives for vegans and people suffering from an allergy to dairy or lactose intolerance.

    

    

 

 

Did You know?

In 2016 The Vegan Society in partnership with Vegan Life Magazine commissioned research that found that there were over half a million vegans in Great Britain: three and a half times as many as estimated in 2006.

At least 542,000 people in Britain are now following a vegan diet and never consume any animal products including meat, fish, milk, cheese, eggs and honey. This is a whopping increase since the last estimate of 150,000 ten years ago.

The study, carried out by leading researchers Ipsos MORI, surveyed almost 10,000 people aged 15 or over across England, Scotland and Wales – the biggest ever poll quantifying the vegan community. For more information, read the full article.

 

 

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Subscription boxes for products that are beauty related have grown to become incredibly popular in 2016. Riding on the wave of this trend, some ‘health food’ boxes have started to tap into this market (although Graze, one of the trailblazers in this field has been around since 2007).

Unfortunately, one of the gaps in the market I have identified as someone who is lactose intolerant myself, is that most of these subscription boxes are based around health food. PR and marketing departments for these companies are naturally assuming that anyone who is vegan or cannot have dairy also wants to eat healthy, but this is not always the case.

A lot of consumers who choose to avoid dairy also just want to eat and enjoy what is considered ‘normal’ food. This is where the ‘Don’t have a cow’ box comes in.

Sales figures from meat free and free from sales were expected to hit £949 million in 2012. (Taken from the Vegan Society)

Not only is there are market from the products themselves, but the price range of boxes currently on the market range on average from £16.50 - £35, which is not affordable for most of the younger market in the 18 – 25 age bracket.

 

 

 

 

BUSINESS SUMMARY

The premise of a subscription box is that subscribers receive a monthly box containing a certain amount of products each month. A comfortable amount of products for both the company and the consumer appears to currently be 10 judging by competitor’s boxes, such as Vegan Tuck Box. Initially, the first 12 months of boxes will need to be paid for by using wholesale companies to source content for the boxes. Within the second year, we project costs will reduce as the box becomes more well-known and larger companies wish to have their samples included.

Initial investment will cover the costs of packaging, marketing, and content. Twenty boxes will initially be ‘made’. When subscribers first sign up, they will always get the ‘first box’, which will also include a welcome pack.

SERVICE PROPOSITION AND DESCRIPTION

This subscription is aimed at people who cannot have dairy, vegans, and people that just do not necessarily like dairy products. The boxes will target the large market of people who cannot have dairy but still want ‘treats; instead of health food. Things like chocolate and sweets will feature in a balanced mix of healthier options. Each box will contain a printed dairy free ‘recipe’ card with the ‘Don’t have a cow’ logo on it.

The typical products included in a box will include:

 

  • Confectionary
  • Crisps/Popcorn
  • Cake/Baking mixes
  • Seasoning
  • Drinks
  • Jam/Sauces

 

Process flow

Stage 1

The customer pays online and signs up for the boxes. This will be a recurring Paypal payment that will take the same amount of money on the same date each month.

Stage 2

The first box, including the welcome pack will be sent out. All first boxes will be the same, it will only be the subsequent ones that will be monthly. This will encourage word of mouth for the people who have just signed up to recommend friends.

Stage 4

The marketing team will then send deals and offers to existing customers to encourage them to recommend people to sign up.

MOBILISATION

January to March

Tasks completed by Kelly Jackson during January, February and March will be as follows:

  • Sourcing a packaging company and getting packaging samples
  • Setting up the social media channels and websites
  • Completing the crowdfunding campaign
  • Testing foods that will potentially go into the boxes
  • Editing and completing the first ‘Moo’s bite’ the in box magazine

March onwards

March onwards will depend on the success of the crowdfunding campaign.

FINANCES

Due to the variable attributes of not only the contents of the box, but also the number of subscribers, the costing model will be worked out on a ‘budget’ for each box. This means we do not need to sell a certain amount of boxes to ‘break even’.

Box retail cost: £15.95 + £2.95 postage

Single box trade cost: £8.00 + £2.95 postage

This will be looked at on a month by month basis. For example, if we have 10 subscribers in the first month, we will only buy enough stock to fill ten boxes. This will keep costs down for the actual boxes.

The business aim is £7.95 profit per box.

Marketing

The initial marketing costs will be what the bulk of the initial investment is spent on. The cost breakdown is as follows:

Professional website including CMS and online order system: £1500

Sponsored Facebook post to promote launch: £250

Royal Mail leaflet drop: £500 (this will be targeted in Essex as this is where the company is based from).

Packaging and branding

250 – 500 printed boxes: £850

Filler or ‘grass’ for 250 – 500 boxes: £150

The initial ‘run’ after the crowdfunding campaign will be based on 500 boxes. All of the packaging will be pre bought and stored in the office premises.

Total launch costs: £3250

MARKETING

The marketing campaign for ‘Don’t have a cow’ will be based around ‘saving the cows’. Each piece of marketing and branding will be based around ‘farmyard colours’. The main premise will be to save the cows by not having dairy.

The marketing will be handled by the Director, Kelly Jackson, who is also a social media consultant and blogger, with her own marketing company. These skills and experience will be free of charge and used to create marketing campaigns for ‘Don’t have a cow’.

From January to March, before the end of the crowdfunding campaign, the marketing will be based around the launch. This will mean showing products that will be included in the boxes, using videos of cows to provoke emotion, and using humours pictures of cows. The aim will be to sign up people to a mailing list so that they can pre-subscribe.

We will also have a blog that will share Vegan recipes, and reviews on foods that go into the boxes. Kelly Jackson will use her contacts to use bloggers to review the boxes and put them on blogs and youtube channels.

Each review will get a free one off box to review. We will not look to use paid blogging until further down the line.

12 MONTH PROJECTION

We estimate that when ‘Don’t have a cow’ launches at the end of April, providing the success of the crowdfunding campaign, it will gain 10 subscribers in the first month.

Projected growth is that the subscriptions will double each month until around September, when things usually wind down or halt completely, due to people saving money for Christmas and started Christmas shopping. Based on the gap in the market, it looks like the niche for ‘sweet’ treats without dairy is not being filled, so we not only have an entire captive market but also all of the market share.

story:
Hi my name is Kristy Lockhart and my best friend was diagnosed with Lyme Disease in 2012 after being misdiagnosed for many years. It took her years and at least 100 doctors/hospital/specialist appointments and visits to finally receive a proper diagnosis.

In March 2014 Heather was 50% better in beating lyme, this has to do with her amazing lyme doctor & her extraordinary chiropractor and naturopath team & her own strength. Heather was on same antibiotics for 18 months, she got bit by ‘something’ weeks ago, ever since then she went from being 50% better to only 10% better with 80% of her previous lyme symptoms returning. She was bit by an unknown bug in late march which caused her ankle to turn red and swell double it’s size, insane itch, she wasn’t able to walk and I took her to the hospital emergency 3 times in one week to get no help, no referrals, nothing. For the last 6 months there was so much improvement, so much hope and light, and now, to be perfectly honesty, we are scared. Physically and neurologically it is as if Heather’s state is as it was before we even started lyme treatment back in September 2012. I have to help her wash her hair, I have to prepare all of her meals, do her laundry and dishes as her joints are swollen, painful and inflamed and she can’t do the things she normally did for the last 6 months as this new ‘infection’ is making all symptoms return that were seemingly gone. We have made an emergency appointment to go back to her lyme doctor only a month after seeing her, as everything we were doing (medication/supplement/etc wise) is no longer working. So far, in 2014 Heather has gotten shingles 3 times & is currently trying to recover from them again. Her immune system is compromised and this is the cause of them recurring.

Thank you to heather’s loving online family, on redbubble and face book, to her friends and even strangers that have donated in the past, shared this link, and supported her with love, kindness and patience and unconditional love during her journey. I couldn’t have helped heather go this far without all of you beautiful souls, and I don’t know what we would do without you. It’s a scary time, Heather likes to put on a brave face, but I myself am not only her best friend, but caregiver and have been watching her rapidly decline over the last few weeks. I need your help now more than ever.

If you know you were bitten by a tick and seek immediate treatment in Canada you go on antibiotics for a few weeks and you’re cured. If you didn’t know you were bit by a tick the tick not only infects you with a devastating bacteria, but it lays its eggs in your body which hatch in 18 days. Heather went almost 4 years in extreme physical pain, I watched her mind and body deteriorate in the most devastating way. Going to every medical appointment, ambulance ride, neurosurgeon, MRI, family dr visit and never getting an answer, having it all blamed on her ‘anxiety’ I decided to take matters into my own hands and researched full time, it was months of extensive research that all signs and symptoms pointed to lyme disease. In Canada treatment beyond a month is NOT available. Chronic lyme is not treated in Canada, and the few doctors who have done so, have lost their license. This is why we have to travel to the USA every 3 months for treatment and expensive antibiotics which are not covered.

The majority of people with Lyme disease are misdiagnosed for years and by the time it is discovered it is almost too late

 

In 2009 Heather had a gym membership, walked 5 miles a day, hiked, spent time in nature, and constantly doing photo shoots. Now, she can't walk more than 20 minutes, becomes so fatigued far too quickly, has difficulty breathing, chest pains, migraines, her joints swell up so bad she can't write or type, difficulty folding laundry, doing dishes and playing with her cat. Something in her body is malfunctioning as her entire body is covered in edema.

This woman means everything to me. I can't put into words how I love her. She is an amazing artist/photographer (www.locustgirl.comwww.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl) and a genuine pure soul and there's nothing I won't do for her. Meeting someone like this only happens once in a lifetime, and I fear her lifetime will be over soon if her medical treatment is unable to continue.

Donating to this campaign will ensure proper medical care and treatment and lodging while undergoing this care. It doesn't matter if it's $1 or $1000 every little bit helps. Even if you have no $ to donate, please will you post this on various social networking tools to spread the word?

Even while ill, both she and I helped out with other fundraisers (Rideau Valley Wildlife Sanctuary) by donating hundreds of dollars worth of her art to be sold to help treat injured wildlife. She went to college to learn how to take care of the disabled, now she is disabled.

On a happier note, Heather got to spend time with her favorite wild snowy owl this year, snowy momma goddess and this owl was/is the reason why Heather continues to have hope/fight, as 3.5 yrs ago she had lyme and no one would help/diagnose her, and meeting this owl, watching this owl survive and brave the cold ALONE is what motivated Heather to change her life for the better, mentally and emotionally.

-if you look under the tab ‘gallery’ you will see photographs of this beautiful owl and many other wildlife photos that we are offering as a perk, our gift to you for donating.

Please check out her wildlife photography as they will make you fall even deeper in love with wildlife. Heather (when she is able to go out) has this deep soulful connection with animals and it clearly shows in her photography.

She left home at 15 and she has no blood relatives who can help her, and she hasn't worked for years due to being so ill. I am a single woman and the ONLY person who has been helping her for years, please can you help me help her?

Any questions or for a list of the prints you would like, please email me here lockhart_ottawa@hotmail.com

I promise you if you were to meet Heather you would love her almost as much as I do. I have never met another soul with such an enormous loving heart as hers. Please helps us

Love,

Kristy

WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Donating

Perks

$5 - a photograph of heather holding a thank you note with your name on it emailed to you

$15 - a handmade wildlife thank you card with a hand written note to you written by Heather snail mailed to your door.

$20 - a 1 minute audio/voice email of Heather thanking you and acknowledging gratitude for your help

$40 - 8x10 or 8x12 photograph, your choice from the ‘gallery’ tab or her website.

$50 - a personal thank you video made especially to you and a personal handmade card/written and snail mailed to your door.

$100 - 11x14 or 12x18 signed photographic print of your choice from Heather snail mailed to your door

$250 - Ten 8x10 photographic prints of your choice snail mailed to your door

$500 - if you’re in the Ottawa area, I am a gourmet chef, and would be pleased to your cater your event or an intimate meal in your home. (my labor is free, the cost of food would have to be covered by you)

$1000 - if you live in the Ottawa/montreal area, my dear friend has 20 yrs experience as a plumber/electrician, welder and he would work for you for a day doing whatever repairs/renovations you wish.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute financially, that’s okay we understand. Spreading the word via social networking sites helps tremendously.

Always check yourself and loved ones for ticks. They are the size of a poppy seed. Anytime after hiking, camping, out in nature, have your friend to a full body tick check, this could save your life.

MEDICAL BREAKDOWN

Monthly costs in Canada

- travel expenses to medical appointments, pain specialists, etc ( $200)

- vitmans, supplements, tinctures, probiotics of a specific nature ($500)

(none of this is covered, this is all out of pocket)

- chiropractic / naturopathic / acupuncture treatments ($1000)

Every 3 months trip to USA

- travel expenses ($100)

- doctors visit ($500)

- antibiotics ($1500 - $2500)

Tests that are needed that we cannot afford in the USA

- $1000 +

story:
Dearly Beloved,

We are gathered here today on behalf of a VEEERRRRRY good friend of mine, Amanda Velez (aka A-Sharp).  I've known Amanda for 7 beautiful years and she is someone who has always inspired me through her integrity and overall moral compass. As many of you may know, Amanda was in a motorcycle accident in 2011, that greatly disrupted the motion in her right wrist via serious nerve damage. As even more of you know, Amanda is a classically trained pianist who used to play on tour with Alejandro Sanz, shortly before her disabling and unfortunate incident.  Due to her accident, many of her dreams and goals were put on a stand-still; most people would never know of the depression she faces behind this because she doesn't complain much.  In fact, she spends most of her time taking care of, and inspiring others. Any of you who know her as well as I do, know just how generous, helpful, and kind-hearted she truly is.


Anywhoo, just last night, she confided in me that the surgery she's been considering (and increasingly becoming more and more excited about) for the last  few months, was not fully approved, due to it being considered a cosmetic procedure by her insurance company (Aetna). Recently, Amanda's uncle died and she had to help her family with very costly funeral bills. She also had a fire at her apartment a few months ago, which caused her to face several extra expenses.  She has remained surprisingly strong through all of this, saying "...This is just life - hills and valleys, right? I guess this is just one of those really loooong valleys."     But last night, she finally broke down into tears; she clearly feels hopeless and fearful (and maybe even defeated) that she'll never get to play piano again the way she used to.   Due to this prolonged valley in her life, she only has about $1000 to use toward this very expensive surgery.  In my humble opinion, this wrist surgery is not cosmetic in any format, since it's the only option in improving the physical mobility of Amanda's wrist.  In addition, it will also aid in the repair of her mental and emotional health, which is depleting due to not being able to do something she has done for more than half her life and adores more than most people care for their own pets.  


The insurance company will cover a little over $1900 of this $6,000+ procedure. She has no idea I'm creating this campaign on her behalf; she probably wouldn't even let me launch it if she knew. I want her to be surprised a week or two from now when I tell her she'll be able to get the procedure done, and all of her friends and family cared enough to pitch in!!  Amanda has done so much for me throughout the years and I've witnessed her do so much for friends and family, without ever expecting anything in return. She is one of the most magnanimous, benevolent, altruistic people I have ever met and I aspire to be more like her each day. This is less than the least I can do for all she has done for me. This is the least any of us can do. If she has ever been there for you, in anyway at all, here is your chance to reciprocate her kindness; here is your chance to help her get back on track physically, mentally and emotionally, so that she can continue doing for others. This is your chance to give a friend a piece of hope.   
Thank you for taking the time to read this. And thank you for your contributions!

Bohani 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute financially, but that's ok and it doesn't mean you can't help:  

    -Get the word out!!! Please spread the link of this campaign, via PRIVATE INBOXING (so the surprise is not ruined) to anyone you think may be wiling to give.

    -Keep Amanda in your prayers.  Call her. Text her. Email her. Let her know you are thinking of her. Let her know you love her! It helps more than you think.
story_txt:
Dearly Beloved,
We are gathered here today on behalf of a VEEERRRRRY good friend of mine, Amanda Velez (aka A-Sharp).  I've known Amanda for 7 beautiful years and she is someone who has always inspired me through her integrity and overall moral compass. As many of you may know, Amanda was in a motorcycle accident in 2011, that greatly disrupted the motion in her right wrist via serious nerve damage. As even more of you know, Amanda is a classically trained pianist who used to play on tour with Alejandro Sanz, shortly before her disabling and unfortunate incident.  Due to her accident, many of her dreams and goals were put on a stand-still; most people would never know of the depression she faces behind this because she doesn't complain much.  In fact, she spends most of her time taking care of, and inspiring others.
